query: Standard Model gauge group F-theory compactification Calabi-Yau selection criteria

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau compactification
concepts.description: A compactification procedure that adds a divisor at infinity to a Landau-Ginzburg model to create a log Calabi-Yau variety with trivial log canonical bundle.

concepts.label: Landau-Ginzburg model
concepts.description: A non-compact algebraic variety defined by a holomorphic function (superpotential) used in mirror symmetry and string compactifications.

concepts.label: Fano variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety whose anticanonical divisor is ample; del Pezzo surfaces and projective spaces are principal examples.

concepts.label: del Pezzo surface
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface with ample anticanonical divisor; a special case of Fano variety of dimension 2.

concepts.label: singularity
concepts.description: A point on an algebraic variety where the variety fails to be smooth; characterized by vanishing partial derivatives of defining equations.

concepts.label: anticanonical divisor
concepts.description: The negative of the canonical divisor; for Fano varieties, this divisor is ample and defines the anticanonical system.

concepts.label: anticanonical system
concepts.description: The linear system of divisors linearly equivalent to the anticanonical divisor; dimension equals the number of independent anticanonical sections.

concepts.label: fiber over infinity
concepts.description: The divisor at infinity added in the compactification procedure, obtained as the fiber over a point at infinity in the extended space.

concepts.label: projective space covering
concepts.description: A finite morphism from an algebraic variety to projective space; in this work, covers of index one with degree greater than 2.

concepts.label: index of Fano variety
concepts.description: The greatest positive integer dividing the anticanonical divisor in the Picard lattice; index one means the anticanonical divisor is primitive.

concepts.label: smooth projective variety
concepts.description: A variety over a field that is smooth (regular at all points) and projective (embedded in projective space).

concepts.label: log canonical bundle
concepts.description: For a log variety with a divisor D, the log canonical bundle K_X(D) such that K_X(D) is trivial for log Calabi-Yau varieties.

concepts.label: fiber components
concepts.description: The irreducible components of the fiber of a morphism; in this work, components of fibers over infinity and finite fibers are counted.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau metric
concepts.description: Complete Ricci-flat Kähler metric on a Calabi-Yau manifold, satisfying Einstein equations with zero cosmological constant.

concepts.label: maximal volume growth
concepts.description: Asymptotic behavior of a metric where volume grows at the fastest possible rate compatible with the geometry at infinity.

concepts.label: Cartesian product of cones
concepts.description: Geometric construction combining Calabi-Yau cones with smooth cross-sections to form a singular space.

concepts.label: weighted blow-up
concepts.description: Geometric resolution technique for manifolds with corners that compactifies singular spaces by introducing weighted singularities.

concepts.label: manifold with corners
concepts.description: Topological space locally modeled on closed orthants of Euclidean space, generalizing smooth manifolds to include boundary stratification.

concepts.label: Laplacian operator
concepts.description: Differential operator computing the trace of the Hessian; fundamental tool for studying Ricci-flat and harmonic functions.

concepts.label: weighted Hölder spaces
concepts.description: Function spaces with controlled regularity and decay rates at infinity, essential for elliptic regularity on non-compact manifolds.

concepts.label: conical singularity
concepts.description: Isolated singular point of a metric locally modeled on a cone; characterized by its tangent cone geometry.

concepts.label: tangent cone at infinity
concepts.description: Limiting geometric structure obtained by scaling a complete metric; describes asymptotic cone geometry.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau cone
concepts.description: Singular metric cone whose link is a Sasaki-Einstein manifold; basis for constructing complete Calabi-Yau metrics.

concepts.label: exact Kähler form
concepts.description: Closed two-form defining the complex geometry where the metric is determined up to isometry by the Kähler class.

concepts.label: elliptic regularity
concepts.description: Theorem establishing that solutions to elliptic PDEs inherit higher regularity from the smoothness of coefficients and source terms.

concepts.label: quasi-asymptotically conical metric
concepts.description: Complete metric approaching a conical geometry at infinity, with controlled deviation from the tangent cone.

concepts.label: F-theory compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of 12-dimensional F-theory on elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds to obtain 4D or 6D effective field theories with realistic gauge groups.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A complex three-dimensional Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class, used as the compactification space for string theory and F-theory.

concepts.label: elliptic fibration
concepts.description: A structure on a Calabi-Yau threefold where each fiber over the base is an elliptic curve, providing the geometric foundation for F-theory compactifications.

concepts.label: Kodaira fiber classification
concepts.description: Classification of singular fibers in elliptic fibrations by Kodaira type, which determines the gauge algebra content in F-theory compactifications.

concepts.label: gauge algebra
concepts.description: The Lie algebra structure of the gauge group emerging from F-theory compactification, determined by the geometry of the Calabi-Yau and its singularities.

concepts.label: Standard Model gauge group
concepts.description: The gauge structure SU(3)_C ⊗ SU(2)_L ⊗ U(1)_Y of electroweak and strong interactions, the target structure for string phenomenology models.

concepts.label: hypercharge embedding
concepts.description: The correct embedding of the U(1)_Y hypercharge factor within the gauge algebra, a necessary condition for a realistic electroweak theory.

concepts.label: chiral generations
concepts.description: The number of chiral fermion families (generations) arising from the topology and matter curves of an elliptic fibration, expected to be three for realistic models.

concepts.label: Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: Interaction strength between Higgs and fermion fields; rank structure of Yukawa matrices is a key discriminant for realistic string models.

concepts.label: proton decay
concepts.description: Baryon-number-violating process suppressed in the Standard Model; protection mechanisms against fast proton decay are required in GUT-scale models.

concepts.label: moduli stabilization
concepts.description: Mechanism to fix the expectation values of scalar fields (moduli) in string compactifications, essential for obtaining stable ground states.

concepts.label: heterotic-F-theory duality
concepts.description: Duality between heterotic string compactifications and F-theory on elliptic fibrations, relating 6D and 4D effective theories.

concepts.label: Weierstrass model
concepts.description: Standard form of elliptic curve equation in toric geometry used to explicitly encode F-theory compactifications on elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: reflexive polytope
concepts.description: A lattice polytope that is self-dual under the polar duality; used to classify toric bases for F-theory compactifications.

concepts.label: type II/heterotic duality
concepts.description: Strong-weak coupling duality between type II string theory and heterotic string in lower dimensions, promoted to heterotic-F-theory duality in 6D.

concepts.label: Mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Duality between pairs of Calabi-Yau manifolds exchanging complex structure and Kähler moduli, relating different geometric and physical descriptions.

concepts.label: Gauged linear sigma model
concepts.description: A 2D N=2 quantum field theory with gauge symmetry whose target space is a toric variety, used to study mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Toric Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety with a torus action, encoded by combinatorial data from reflexive polytopes.

concepts.label: Superpotential
concepts.description: A holomorphic function in a supersymmetric theory that determines interactions and the moduli space of vacua.

concepts.label: Elliptically fibered K3
concepts.description: A K3 surface with a genus-one fibration structure, exhibiting elliptic fiber topology over a base curve.

concepts.label: Hirzebruch surface
concepts.description: A toric ruled surface F_n with a P¹ fibration structure, parametrized by integer index n.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau fourfold
concepts.description: A 4-dimensional Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class, relevant for F-theory compactification to two dimensions.

concepts.label: ADE hypersurface
concepts.description: Hypersurface singularities classified by ADE Dynkin diagrams, related to singularity resolution and gauge algebras.

concepts.label: SO(8) gauge model
concepts.description: A six-dimensional supersymmetric gauge theory with SO(8) gauge symmetry arising from F-theory on special geometry.

concepts.label: Affine so(8) Lie algebra
concepts.description: The affine extension of the so(8) Lie algebra, characterizing toric data in special geometric configurations.

concepts.label: constant coupling
concepts.description: Special points in the moduli space where the gauge coupling constant remains invariant across the compactification.

concepts.label: singularity enhancement
concepts.description: Emergence of larger gauge groups at special loci where two or more singular divisors intersect in the base space.

concepts.label: Hirzebruch surface base
concepts.description: A toric del Pezzo surface used as the base of an elliptic fibration; F_n denotes the n-th Hirzebruch surface.

concepts.label: instanton coalescence
concepts.description: Process in which multiple point-like instantons merge at a single locus, triggering enhancement of the gauge group.

concepts.label: orbifold limit
concepts.description: Special point in moduli space where the Calabi-Yau geometry can be realized as an orbifold quotient of T^6 by a finite group.

concepts.label: moduli space
concepts.description: Parameter space of all inequivalent F-theory compactifications on elliptically fibered CY3s, including geometric and non-geometric regions.

concepts.label: Sp(k) gauge group
concepts.description: Symplectic gauge group arising from certain singularity enhancement patterns, particularly when instantons coalesce on Hirzebruch bases.

concepts.label: discriminant locus
concepts.description: The divisor in the base space where the elliptic fibration becomes singular, controlling gauge group structure via Kodaira classification.

concepts.label: Hodge numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants h^{p,q} characterising the cohomology of a manifold; for CY3s, h^{1,1} and h^{2,1} count Kähler and complex-structure moduli respectively.

concepts.label: chiral generation
concepts.description: A chiral fermion family arising from string compactification; three generations are required by Standard Model phenomenology.

concepts.label: chirality index
concepts.description: The topological invariant (difference of left- and right-handed zero modes) that equals net chirality only after flux choice; equals χ/2 for certain topologies.

concepts.label: rank structure
concepts.description: The hierarchy of Yukawa matrix eigenvalues and texture zeros that reproduces observed fermion mass hierarchies (top ≫ bottom ≫ electron).

concepts.label: heterotic string
concepts.description: A ten-dimensional string theory with E8 ⊕ E8 gauge symmetry compactified on CY3s with vector bundles to produce 4D effective theories.

concepts.label: Shioda map
concepts.description: Homomorphism from Mordell-Weil group of sections to the Picard lattice of an elliptic surface, encoding abelian gauge factors and their global charge structure.

concepts.label: Mordell-Weil group
concepts.description: Abelian group of rational sections on an elliptic fibration; generators correspond to U(1) factors in the gauge group.

concepts.label: global gauge group
concepts.description: Quotient of the continuous gauge algebra by its center, determining physical charge quantization and selection rules in effective field theory.

concepts.label: U(1) charge constraint
concepts.description: Restriction on allowed charge assignments of matter fields imposed by Shioda map geometry, constraining hypercharge embedding and matter spectrum.

concepts.label: Standard Model algebra
concepts.description: Gauge algebra su(3)⊕su(2)⊕u(1) of the electroweak and strong nuclear forces.

concepts.label: geometric (un-)higgsing
concepts.description: Mechanism in F-theory where singular locus deformations or resolution of codimension-two fibers transition between different gauge groups at different points in moduli space.

concepts.label: matter representation
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of the gauge group to which matter fields transform, determined by homology classes of curves in the base and fiber.

concepts.label: swampland criterion
concepts.description: Conjectured constraint on effective field theories consistent with quantum gravity, ruling out certain gauge symmetries and field spectra.

concepts.label: Picard group rank
concepts.description: The rank of the Picard lattice of divisors modulo numerical equivalence, measuring the dimension of the divisor variety.

concepts.label: syzygetic structure
concepts.description: The system of syzygies (algebraic relations among generators) in the homogeneous coordinate ring of a projective variety.

concepts.label: projection
concepts.description: A linear map from a projective variety to a lower-dimensional projective space obtained by center of projection.

concepts.label: singular Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau variety with singularities, obtained before resolving or smoothing to reach a smooth model.

concepts.label: smoothing
concepts.description: A deformation of a singular variety to a smooth variety, preserving the Kähler structure and canonical bundle properties.

concepts.label: exceptional divisor
concepts.description: The divisor contracted by a birational map; in a blowup, the preimage of the center of blowup.

concepts.label: primitive contraction
concepts.description: A birational contraction that is extremal in the cone of curves; contracts a single extremal ray to a point or curve.

concepts.label: blowup of projective plane
concepts.description: The birational morphism replacing a point in ℂℙ² with an exceptional divisor isomorphic to ℂℙ¹.

concepts.label: Standard Model
concepts.description: The gauge theory framework unifying electromagnetic, weak, and strong interactions with gauge group SU(3)⊕SU(2)⊕U(1) and spontaneous electroweak symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Swampland constraints
concepts.description: Quantum gravity consistency conditions that restrict effective field theories realizable within a consistent UV-complete theory.

concepts.label: SU(5) unification
concepts.description: A grand unified theory where SU(3)⊕SU(2)⊕U(1) is embedded in SU(5), broken to the SM via appropriate Wilson lines or moduli.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau category
concepts.description: A differential graded category equipped with a non-degenerate cyclic pairing satisfying certain homological properties; generalizes pre-Calabi-Yau algebras to the categorical setting.

concepts.label: dg quiver
concepts.description: A differential graded quiver; a directed graph with a differential graded vector space structure on the set of paths, enabling homological algebra on quiver representations.

concepts.label: homotopy transfer theorem
concepts.description: A fundamental result asserting that algebraic structures and morphisms can be transferred along quasi-isomorphisms via coherent higher homotopies.

concepts.label: quasi-isomorphism
concepts.description: A chain map inducing isomorphisms on all homology groups; a weak equivalence in the category of differential graded objects.

concepts.label: minimal model
concepts.description: A cofibrant replacement of a differential graded object with trivial differential; a model with zero differential used for computing invariants and transfer structures.

concepts.label: pre-Calabi-Yau morphism
concepts.description: A structure-preserving map between pre-Calabi-Yau categories respecting the cyclic pairing and differential; analogous to a homomorphism of CY structures.

concepts.label: cyclic pairing
concepts.description: A non-degenerate bilinear form on a dg category satisfying cyclic and quasi-isomorphism properties; the key data defining a pre-Calabi-Yau structure.

concepts.label: quasi-inverse
concepts.description: A morphism whose composition with a given map is homotopic to the identity; the weak categorical inverse of a quasi-isomorphism in a homotopical category.

concepts.label: properadic calculus
concepts.description: A computational framework using props and operads to systematize higher homotopy algebra; employed to study coherent algebraic structures.

concepts.label: differential graded algebra
concepts.description: A chain complex equipped with an associative, unital bilinear product satisfying the Leibniz rule; the foundational object for homological algebra.

concepts.label: isomorphism in category of pre-Calabi-Yau categories
concepts.description: A pre-Calabi-Yau morphism with isomorphic dg quiver component that is fully faithful and surjective; establishes equivalence of pre-CY categorical structures.

concepts.label: Leray–Vallette theorem
concepts.description: Foundational result on homotopical properties of pre-Calabi-Yau algebras; provides existence and transfer of CY structures along quasi-isomorphisms.

concepts.label: klt log pair
concepts.description: A projective pair (X,D) where X is normal and the log canonical threshold satisfies klt (Kawamata log terminal) conditions, ensuring mild singularities.

concepts.label: absolute coregularity
concepts.description: A numerical invariant c measuring the complexity of singularities in a klt log pair, related to the structure of the exceptional divisor under log resolutions.

concepts.label: fundamental group
concepts.description: The topological invariant π₁(X,D) capturing the algebraic structure of loops and holes in a variety; π₁^reg denotes the fundamental group of the regular locus.

concepts.label: abelian subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup of the fundamental group whose elements commute; finite index abelian subgroups reflect near-commutative algebraic structure.

concepts.label: almost abelianity
concepts.description: The property that a fundamental group admits a normal abelian subgroup of finite index, implying the group is virtually abelian.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: A klt log pair (X,D) where the anticanonical divisor K_X + D is numerically trivial, generalizing CY manifolds to the singular and log setting.

concepts.label: log resolution
concepts.description: A birational morphism π: Y → X that is a log resolution of singularities for a pair (X,D), used to analyze the structure of exceptional divisors.

concepts.label: regular locus
concepts.description: The smooth open dense subset of a variety where no singularities occur; its fundamental group is often more tractable than that of the full space.

concepts.label: solvable subgroup
concepts.description: A normal subgroup whose derived series terminates at the trivial subgroup; more restrictive than abelian but still provides algebraic control.

concepts.label: finite index subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup H of π₁ such that [π₁:H] is finite; equivalently, H corresponds to a finite covering of the underlying space.

concepts.label: rank bound
concepts.description: An upper bound on the minimal number of generators of a free abelian subgroup within the fundamental group, controlled by coregularity.

concepts.label: dimension three
concepts.description: The case of 3-dimensional varieties (CY3 threefolds), where almost abelianity of the fundamental group is proven for klt CY pairs.

concepts.label: low dimensional pairs
concepts.description: Projective klt log pairs of dimension ≤3, for which explicit results on fundamental groups and coregularity can be established.

concepts.label: Spectral cover
concepts.description: A curve in the heterotic compactification encoding the vector bundle structure; transitions to F-theory via the duality map.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: Complex Kähler manifold with vanishing first Chern class, fundamental in string theory compactifications and mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: Tyurin degeneration
concepts.description: A special type of degeneration of Calabi-Yau manifolds used to study relationships between mirror symmetry structures.

concepts.label: Doran-Harder-Thompson conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture bridging mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds and quasi-Fano varieties via degenerations and Lagrangian fibrations.

concepts.label: SYZ mirror symmetry
concepts.description: Geometric approach to mirror symmetry via special Lagrangian torus fibrations, proposed by Strominger-Yau-Zaslow.

concepts.label: Lagrangian torus fibration
concepts.description: A fibration of a Calabi-Yau manifold into special Lagrangian tori, central to SYZ mirror construction.

concepts.label: Quasi-Fano variety
concepts.description: A variety related to Fano varieties whose anticanonical divisor is ample or semi-ample, appearing in mirror symmetry contexts.

concepts.label: Theta functions
concepts.description: Special holomorphic functions on Calabi-Yau manifolds used in geometric quantization and mirror symmetry constructions.

concepts.label: Geometric quantization
concepts.description: Procedure for constructing quantum mechanics from classical symplectic or complex geometry, relevant to CY mirror pairs.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau fibration
concepts.description: A fibration where fibers are Calabi-Yau manifolds, enabling construction of higher-dimensional CY spaces.

concepts.label: Degeneration
concepts.description: A specialization or limiting process in which a Calabi-Yau manifold approaches a singular variety, studied to understand mirror structures.

concepts.label: genus-one fibered CY4
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau 4-fold with a fibration whose fibers are genus-one curves; lacks a global section in the studied constructions.

concepts.label: matter curve
concepts.description: A curve in the base where two or more components of the discriminant locus intersect; carries chiral matter fields in 4D.

concepts.label: complex multiplication
concepts.description: Endomorphisms of genus-one curves (or elliptic curves) with special arithmetic properties, imposed via symmetries of the defining equations.

concepts.label: hypersurface construction
concepts.description: Defining genus-one fibered CY4 as a hypersurface in a product of projective spaces; a method to control fiber geometry.

concepts.label: double cover construction
concepts.description: Defining genus-one fibered CY4 as a double cover of a product of projective spaces; provides additional geometric constraints.

concepts.label: global section
concepts.description: A choice of one point on each fiber of the fibration, varying continuously over the base; absence forces non-Abelian structure.

concepts.label: matter spectrum
concepts.description: Collection of chiral multiplets and their multiplicities arising from intersection numbers of matter curves with the discriminant.

concepts.label: E₆ gauge group
concepts.description: Exceptional Lie group arising in F-theory models; appears in certain genus-one fibered CY4 constructions studied here.

concepts.label: SU(5) gauge group
concepts.description: Grand unified theory gauge group; relevant for GUT-like embeddings in F-theory CY4 compactifications.

concepts.label: twisted Calabi-Yau algebra
concepts.description: A noncommutative algebra satisfying a twisted version of Calabi-Yau duality, generalizing geometric properties of Calabi-Yau manifolds to the algebraic setting.

concepts.label: graded algebra
concepts.description: An algebra with a direct sum decomposition indexed by a monoid (typically ℕ), where the product respects the grading structure.

concepts.label: Artin-Schelter regularity
concepts.description: A homological regularity condition on noncommutative algebras analogous to smoothness in commutative geometry, defined by finite global dimension and Cohen-Macaulay duality.

concepts.label: generalized Artin-Schelter regular
concepts.description: A weakening or variant of classical Artin-Schelter regularity suitable for graded locally finite-dimensional algebras, adapted from work of Martinez-Villa and Minamoto-Mori.

concepts.label: locally finite-dimensional algebra
concepts.description: A graded algebra where each graded component is a finite-dimensional vector space.

concepts.label: graded radical
concepts.description: The sum of all graded nilpotent ideals, or the Jacobson radical of a graded algebra, capturing the non-invertible elements at each grade level.

concepts.label: separable algebra
concepts.description: An algebra A over a field k such that A ⊗_k A^op is semisimple, guaranteeing projectivity of A as a bimodule and controlling representation structure.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau dimension
concepts.description: The homological dimension of a twisted Calabi-Yau algebra, generalizing geometric dimension; dimension d means the algebra satisfies a d-dimensional CY duality.

concepts.label: tensor algebra of bimodule
concepts.description: The free algebra generated by an invertible bimodule over a base algebra, with relations respecting the bimodule structure.

concepts.label: invertible bimodule
concepts.description: A bimodule M over an algebra A such that M ⊗_A M* ≅ A and M* ⊗_A M ≅ A, making it invertible in the Morita category.

concepts.label: Gelfand-Kirillov dimension
concepts.description: A notion of dimension for algebras measuring the polynomial growth rate of the Hilbert series, denoted GK dimension.

concepts.label: noetherian algebra
concepts.description: An algebra satisfying the ascending chain condition on left and right ideals, ensuring finiteness properties in representation theory.

concepts.label: Cohen-Macaulay duality
concepts.description: A duality property in homological algebra where modules admit injective resolutions paired with projective ones, central to Artin-Schelter regularity.

concepts.label: global dimension
concepts.description: The supremum of the projective dimensions of all modules over an algebra, measuring homological complexity.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: A pair (X,B) consisting of a normal variety X and a divisor B such that K_X+B is numerically trivial or has trivial numerical properties.

concepts.label: Weil index
concepts.description: The smallest positive integer λ such that λ(K_X+B) is Cartier; bounds the index of a pair.

concepts.label: klt Calabi-Yau varieties
concepts.description: Kawamata log terminal singular Calabi-Yau varieties where index can grow doubly exponentially with dimension.

concepts.label: generalized log Calabi-Yau pair
concepts.description: Extension of log Calabi-Yau pairs allowing more general singularities and divisor configurations.

concepts.label: semi-log canonical pair
concepts.description: A singularity class intermediate between log canonical and klt, generalizing log Calabi-Yau structure.

concepts.label: isolated log canonical singularity
concepts.description: Log canonical singularities localized at isolated points; subject to index bounds under coregularity 0 condition.

concepts.label: Gross-Siebert program
concepts.description: Mirror symmetry construction via toric degeneration and scattering diagrams; produces Calabi-Yau varieties with controlled index.

concepts.label: Kontsevich-Soibelman program
concepts.description: Categorical enumerative mirror symmetry framework; CY varieties arising from this construction have bounded index.

concepts.label: holomorphic symplectic variety
concepts.description: A smooth projective variety with a non-degenerate holomorphic 2-form; studied with finite group actions.

concepts.label: purely non-symplectic automorphism
concepts.description: A finite-order automorphism of a holomorphic symplectic variety that acts trivially nowhere on the symplectic 2-form.

concepts.label: numerical triviality
concepts.description: A divisor D is numerically trivial if D·C=0 for all curves C; central to characterizing K_X+B in CY geometry.

concepts.label: Cartier divisor
concepts.description: A divisor locally principal, admitting a regular function representation; fundamental for defining the Weil index.

concepts.label: heterotic string compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of the heterotic string on a Calabi-Yau threefold with a vector bundle, relating geometry and topology to low-energy gauge groups.

concepts.label: Monge-Ampère equation
concepts.description: A nonlinear partial differential equation governing deformations of the Kähler structure, central to Yau's proof of Calabi's conjecture.

concepts.label: singularity classification
concepts.description: Systematic method for categorizing singular loci in elliptic Calabi-Yau manifolds and their geometric properties.

concepts.label: generalized Calabi-Yau manifold
concepts.description: A symplectic manifold with a closed non-degenerate two-form admitting a compatible generalized complex structure, extending classical Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: Hamiltonian action
concepts.description: A smooth action of a Lie group on a symplectic manifold preserving the symplectic form and generated by a moment map.

concepts.label: Duistermaat-Heckman theorem
concepts.description: A localization formula stating that the push-forward of the symplectic form under a moment map yields a piecewise polynomial measure.

concepts.label: moment map
concepts.description: A map from a symplectic manifold to the dual of a Lie algebra encoding the Hamiltonian action of a Lie group.

concepts.label: piecewise polynomial density
concepts.description: A measure density function on the dual of a Lie algebra that is polynomial on each chamber of a hyperplane arrangement.

concepts.label: localization formula
concepts.description: An equivariant cohomology formula reducing integrals on a manifold to contributions from fixed-point sets of a group action.

concepts.label: torus action
concepts.description: An action of a compact abelian Lie group (torus) on a manifold, commonly used in localization techniques.

concepts.label: symplectic manifold
concepts.description: A smooth manifold equipped with a closed, non-degenerate differential two-form (symplectic form).

concepts.label: equivariant cohomology
concepts.description: A cohomology theory for spaces with a group action, generalizing ordinary cohomology to account for group symmetries.

concepts.label: fixed-point set
concepts.description: The subset of a manifold consisting of points invariant under a given group action.

concepts.label: hypercharge U(1)_Y
concepts.description: Abelian gauge factor orthogonal to SU(2) with specific charge assignments; its embedding constrains realistic models.

concepts.label: heterotic string duality
concepts.description: Duality between F-theory on CY fourfold and heterotic string on CY threefold; relates gauge algebras, moduli, and anomaly cancellation.

concepts.label: K3 fibration
concepts.description: Fibration where generic fibers are K3 surfaces; additional structure constraining gauge algebras and moduli in CY4.

concepts.label: toric geometry
concepts.description: Algebraic geometry of varieties defined by torus actions, enabling systematic classification of F-theory base geometries via polytope combinatorics.

concepts.label: discrete gauge symmetry
concepts.description: A finite abelian gauge group arising in the low-energy effective field theory from the geometry of the compactification manifold.

concepts.label: multisection
concepts.description: A divisor on a fibered manifold that intersects each generic fiber in a fixed degree d > 1; generalizes sections (d=1).

concepts.label: cyclic cover
concepts.description: A covering map corresponding to a cyclic Galois extension; used to construct higher-dimensional Calabi-Yau manifolds from lower-dimensional bases.

concepts.label: Segre embedding
concepts.description: A canonical embedding of a product of projective spaces into higher-dimensional projective space; preserves product structure.

concepts.label: hyperplane class
concepts.description: The first Chern class of the dual of a very ample line bundle on a projective variety; represents a divisor.

concepts.label: intersection number
concepts.description: A topological invariant measuring the degree of intersection between divisors on an algebraic variety.

concepts.label: fiber class
concepts.description: A homology class representing the generic fiber of a fibration; used to compute intersection numbers with divisors.

concepts.label: projection map
concepts.description: A morphism from a fibered variety to its base; used to compute pullbacks of divisor classes.

concepts.label: Tian-Todorov theorem
concepts.description: A foundational result asserting that infinitesimal deformations of Calabi-Yau varieties are unobstructed; extended here to line bundle case.

concepts.label: line bundle
concepts.description: A holomorphic vector bundle of rank one; used to define sections and encode spectral cover data in heterotic models.

concepts.label: SO(32) heterotic string
concepts.description: A ten-dimensional heterotic string theory with SO(32) gauge symmetry that can be compactified on Calabi-Yau threefolds to derive four-dimensional particle physics models.

concepts.label: direct flux breaking
concepts.description: A mechanism in heterotic string theory where background fluxes break the gauge symmetry directly to generate the Standard Model gauge group, analogous to hypercharge flux breaking in F-theory.

concepts.label: Euler characteristic
concepts.description: Topological invariant χ of a manifold; for CY threefolds, χ/2 equals the number of chiral generations in certain compactifications.

concepts.label: background-independent formula
concepts.description: A general result for generating three chiral generations and suppressing exotics that holds across diverse Calabi-Yau compactifications without dependence on specific geometric details.

concepts.label: intersection theory
concepts.description: Homological and cohomological intersection calculus on Calabi-Yau threefolds used to compute gauge algebras and hypermultiplet representations.

concepts.label: anomaly cancellation
concepts.description: Consistency requirement in six-dimensional supergravity that constrains the geometry of the elliptic Calabi-Yau and generates numerical predictions on Hodge numbers.

concepts.label: monodromy action
concepts.description: Non-trivial monodromy around curves of singularities in the Weierstrass model that affects how 2-branes wrap 2-cycles and generates non-simply-laced gauge groups.

concepts.label: non-simply-laced gauge group
concepts.description: Gauge groups arising from F-theory on elliptic fibrations where monodromy action on A_even singularities induces affine or twisted affine structures.

concepts.label: M-theory compactification
concepts.description: Eleven-dimensional M-theory compactified on a Calabi-Yau threefold, yielding an effective six-dimensional theory with gauge and matter determined by intersection theory.

concepts.label: type IIA string theory
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional superstring theory whose compactification on Calabi-Yau threefolds depends on Ramond-Ramond field expectation values for determining the gauge sector.

concepts.label: rigid Calabi-Yau threefold
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau threefold with trivial deformation space (h¹¹ = 0), admitting a unique complex structure up to isomorphism.

concepts.label: modularity
concepts.description: Property that the L-function of an algebraic variety coincides with the L-function of a modular form, establishing a deep arithmetic-geometric correspondence.

concepts.label: good reduction
concepts.description: A variety has good reduction at a prime p if its defining equations reduce to smooth equations modulo p, preserving the geometric structure.

concepts.label: L-function
concepts.description: A generating function encoding arithmetic invariants of an algebraic variety, generalising the Riemann zeta function and Dirichlet L-functions.

concepts.label: modular form
concepts.description: An automorphic form on the upper half-plane satisfying transformation properties under SL(2,ℤ) or a congruence subgroup, with an associated L-function.

concepts.label: Chern class
concepts.description: Topological characteristic class measuring the curvature of a vector bundle; chirality in heterotic string theory is computed from Chern classes of gauge bundles.

concepts.label: quotient geometry
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau manifold obtained by quotienting an elliptically fibered CY3 by a freely acting discrete group, producing new fibered manifolds and modified effective physics.

concepts.label: Euler characteristic χ
concepts.description: A topological invariant of a manifold (χ = -6 for certain reflexive polytope CY3s); χ/2 predicts the chiral index but does not uniquely determine net chirality without flux data.

concepts.label: U(1) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry generated by rational sections of the elliptic fibration in F-theory, subject to charge quantization and anomaly constraints.

concepts.label: Neron-Tate height
concepts.description: Arithmetic height function on the Mordell-Weil group measuring intersection-theoretic properties of sections with fibral rational curves.

concepts.label: anomaly equation
concepts.description: Constraint relating the Neron-Tate height of a section to intersection numbers, enforcing anomaly cancellation in the six-dimensional F-theory effective action.

concepts.label: charge quantization
concepts.description: The discrete spectrum of allowed U(1) charges determined by the lattice structure of the Mordell-Weil group and intersection pairings.

concepts.label: fibral rational curve
concepts.description: A rational curve contracted in the base of the elliptic fibration, contributing to the intersection form and Kodaira fiber type classification.

concepts.label: abelian anomaly coefficient
concepts.description: Matrix encoding mixed and pure anomaly constraints for U(1) factors, constraining rational section charges and the structure of the low-energy theory.

concepts.label: matter charge
concepts.description: The U(1) quantum number of a matter field in the F-theory effective theory, quantized by the Mordell-Weil lattice structure.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau operator
concepts.description: A Fuchsian differential operator conjecturally determining Sp(4)-local systems underlying a ℚ-VHS with specific Hodge numbers (1,1,1,1), appearing as Picard-Fuchs operators of CY threefold families.

concepts.label: Fuchsian differential operator
concepts.description: A linear differential operator with regular singular points, fundamental to the study of moduli spaces and periods in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: Picard-Fuchs operator
concepts.description: Differential operator governing the variation of periods in a family of algebraic varieties; obtained from the Gauss-Manin connection.

concepts.label: Sp(4)-local system
concepts.description: A local system with structure group Sp(4) arising from the symplectic geometry of the middle cohomology of Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: ℚ-VHS
concepts.description: A rational Hodge-Tate structure (variation of Hodge structure defined over ℚ) encoding period integrals and their differential equations.

concepts.label: Rational curves
concepts.description: Genus-zero algebraic curves on a variety; counted by invariants encoded in mirror manifold Picard-Fuchs operators.

concepts.label: Gauss-Manin connection
concepts.description: Connection on the relative de Rham cohomology of a family of varieties that governs how periods vary with moduli.

concepts.label: One-parameter family
concepts.description: A family of algebraic varieties parameterised by a single variable; yields a rank-4 differential system for CY threefolds.

concepts.label: Enumerative invariants
concepts.description: Numerical invariants counting curves, surfaces, or other geometric objects on a variety; related to mirror symmetry predictions.

concepts.label: ordinary crystalline cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology theory for varieties in characteristic p>0 that recovers de Rham cohomology through a crystalline structure, generalizing Hodge theory to positive characteristic.

concepts.label: Hodge structure
concepts.description: A decomposition of cohomology into Hodge types (p,q) with integrality and positivity properties, characterizing the Kähler geometry of complex manifolds.

concepts.label: maximal unipotent monodromy
concepts.description: A limiting behavior of the period matrix at a boundary point of the moduli space where the monodromy operator is maximally unipotent, giving rise to canonical coordinates.

concepts.label: prepotential
concepts.description: A holomorphic generating function encoding Yukawa couplings and instanton corrections; its integrality is a structural property of mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: canonical coordinates
concepts.description: A privileged system of coordinates on the moduli space of Calabi-Yau threefolds arising from the period matrix, with integrality properties under mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: period integral
concepts.description: Integration of a holomorphic n-form over a topological cycle in a Calabi-Yau manifold, encoding information about moduli-dependence and monodromy.

concepts.label: p-adic integrality
concepts.description: Integrality properties of geometric invariants when viewed in characteristic p>0, providing a positive-characteristic analogue of mirror symmetry predictions.

concepts.label: characteristic p geometry
concepts.description: Algebraic geometry over fields of positive characteristic p, including reduction modulo p and Frobenius structure, providing a bridge to arithmetic properties.

concepts.label: Gromov-Witten invariant
concepts.description: An enumerative invariant counting pseudo-holomorphic curves in a symplectic manifold, computable from the mirror via period integrals.

concepts.label: de Rham cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology theory defined by exterior derivatives of differential forms on a smooth manifold, recovering topological invariants via Hodge decomposition.

concepts.label: Tate cycle
concepts.description: A geometric cycle efficiently describing the relationship among codimension-two cycles on the base of an elliptic fibration, directly computable from the Weierstrass equation.

concepts.label: proton decay protection
concepts.description: Mechanism preventing rapid proton decay through anomalous U(1) symmetries or discrete remnants, a critical filter for viable particle physics models.

concepts.label: toric hypersurface CY3
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau threefold defined as a hypersurface in a toric variety, characterized by Hodge numbers h^{1,1} and h^{2,1}.

concepts.label: Kreuzer-Skarke database
concepts.description: Comprehensive catalogue of reflexive polytopes in dimensions 3 and 4, used to classify toric Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: toric fiber type
concepts.description: Classification of fibers in a toric fibration based on the combinatorial structure of the associated polytope slices.

concepts.label: manifold fibration
concepts.description: A surjective map from a manifold to a base space, with specified generic fiber structure.

concepts.label: topological invariant
concepts.description: A property of a manifold invariant under continuous deformations, such as Hodge numbers or Euler characteristic.

concepts.label: special Lagrangian submanifold
concepts.description: Calibrated m-dimensional submanifold in a (2m)-dimensional Calabi-Yau manifold minimizing volume in its homology class and satisfying phase condition on holomorphic form.

concepts.label: holonomy group
concepts.description: Lie group of parallel transport automorphisms of a vector bundle along loops; SU(m) holonomy characterizes Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: Kähler geometry
concepts.description: Riemannian geometry on complex manifolds with compatible symplectic structure, foundational for defining Calabi-Yau manifolds.

concepts.label: Calabi Conjecture
concepts.description: Statement that Kähler manifolds with zero first Chern class admit Ricci-flat Kähler metrics; proved by Yau and establishes existence of Calabi-Yau metrics.

concepts.label: calibrated geometry
concepts.description: Framework using calibrated differential forms to identify volume-minimizing submanifolds; special Lagrangian submanifolds are calibrated with respect to the imaginary part of the holomorphic form.

concepts.label: almost Calabi-Yau m-fold
concepts.description: Generalization of Calabi-Yau manifolds relaxing some conditions while retaining essential structure needed for special Lagrangian geometry and deformation theory.

concepts.label: deformation theory
concepts.description: Study of how geometric structures vary under small perturbations; describes infinitesimal deformations and moduli spaces of special Lagrangian submanifolds.

concepts.label: ellipse
concepts.description: Plane curve defined as the locus of points where the sum of distances to two fixed foci is constant.

concepts.label: extremal problem
concepts.description: Optimization problem seeking to minimize or maximize a geometric quantity subject to constraints.

concepts.label: minimal area
concepts.description: The smallest possible area among all geometric figures satisfying specified constraints.

concepts.label: minimal perimeter
concepts.description: The smallest possible perimeter among all geometric figures satisfying specified constraints.

concepts.label: ellipse family
concepts.description: Parametric collection of all ellipses satisfying a common geometric constraint.

concepts.label: Euler's E563
concepts.description: Historical mathematical treatise by Euler from the 1770s on extremal ellipse problems.

concepts.label: calculus of variations
concepts.description: Mathematical framework for finding functions or curves that extremize functionals such as arc length or area.

concepts.label: rational double point
concepts.description: A type of singularity in an algebraic surface characterized by a minimal resolution into a union of rational curves; classified by ADE Dynkin diagrams.

concepts.label: representation
concepts.description: A homomorphism from the gauge Lie group to a vector space, constructed from local contributions at singular points and enhanced singularities.

concepts.label: enhanced singularity
concepts.description: A point on the Weierstrass model where the singularity is worse than generic (e.g., has higher multiplicity), contributing additional representations beyond those from ADE fibers.

concepts.label: Coxeter number
concepts.description: A numerical invariant of a simple Lie algebra equal to one plus the sum of the exponents; related to the rank in the simply laced exceptional series.

concepts.label: simply laced group
concepts.description: A Lie group whose Dynkin diagram has no multiple edges; includes ADE types and Deligne's exceptional series.

concepts.label: Deligne exceptional series
concepts.description: A special infinite family of simple Lie algebras and groups studied by Deligne, satisfying exceptional geometric and combinatorial properties.

concepts.label: divergent series
concepts.description: An infinite series whose partial sums do not converge to a finite limit, yet may be assigned a value through regularization methods.

concepts.label: factorial series
concepts.description: An infinite series composed of factorial terms, such as 1! − 2! + 3! − ..., which diverges in the classical sense.

concepts.label: series summation
concepts.description: The process of assigning a finite value to an infinite series, either through classical convergence or regularization techniques.

concepts.label: regularization method
concepts.description: A mathematical technique for assigning meaningful values to divergent series by extending classical summation beyond convergent cases.

concepts.label: partial sums
concepts.description: The finite sum of the first n terms of an infinite series, used to analyze convergence behavior.

concepts.label: Euler summation
concepts.description: Summation methods and techniques developed or employed by Euler to assign values to divergent series.

concepts.label: numerical value
concepts.description: The specific real number (approximately 0.59) assigned as the sum of the alternating factorial series by Euler's methods.

concepts.label: subpolyhedron
concepts.description: A reflexive polytope contained within another reflexive polytope; used to identify fibration structures and obstructions in toric CY hypersurfaces.

concepts.label: fibration obstruction
concepts.description: Geometric or arithmetic condition preventing a subpolyhedron from inducing a valid fibration on the corresponding CY hypersurface.

concepts.label: cyclic L-infinity algebra
concepts.description: A graded algebraic structure with higher products and a compatible inner product, generalizing Lie algebras and preserving cyclic symmetry.

concepts.label: Milnor fiber
concepts.description: The generic fiber of a holomorphic function germ; an analytic space encoding singularity structure through its topology and cohomology.

concepts.label: Thom-Sebastiani theorem
concepts.description: A classical result computing topological invariants of product singularities from the invariants of individual components.

concepts.label: derived category of coherent sheaves
concepts.description: The triangulated category of bounded complexes of coherent sheaves on an algebraic variety, central to derived algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: semi-Schur object
concepts.description: An object in a triangulated category satisfying stability conditions related to slope stability, generalizing vector bundles.

concepts.label: Behrend function
concepts.description: A constructible function on a moduli space of objects in a triangulated category, used to weight counting invariants.

concepts.label: Joyce-Song formula
concepts.description: An identity expressing invariants of semi-stable objects via weighted Euler characteristics, generalizing DT theory.

concepts.label: étale cohomology
concepts.description: A Weil cohomology theory applicable to varieties over arbitrary fields, providing an algebraic substitute for singular cohomology.

concepts.label: motivic Milnor fiber
concepts.description: A motivic refinement of the classical Milnor fiber, living in the Grothendieck ring of varieties and capturing arithmetic information.

concepts.label: Lefschetz fixed-point theorem
concepts.description: Topological tool relating the trace of an endomorphism on cohomology to geometric fixed points; used here via étale cohomology.

concepts.label: Galois representation
concepts.description: A homomorphism from the Galois group of a number field (or its étale fundamental group) into a general linear group, encoding arithmetic symmetries.

concepts.label: symplectic Calabi-Yau caps
concepts.description: Symplectic manifolds with vanishing first Chern class used to obstruct exact fillings of contact manifolds.

concepts.label: exact fillings
concepts.description: Exact symplectic manifolds whose boundary is a given contact 3-manifold, preserving the contact structure.

concepts.label: contact 3-manifolds
concepts.description: 3-dimensional manifolds equipped with a contact structure (a hyperplane field maximally non-integrable).

concepts.label: first Chern class
concepts.description: Topological invariant measuring the obstruction to finding a nowhere-zero section of a complex line bundle.

concepts.label: disk cotangent bundle
concepts.description: The total space of cotangent vectors of bounded length over a hyperbolic surface, forming a compact symplectic manifold.

concepts.label: symplectic uniruled caps
concepts.description: Symplectic manifolds with positive genus curves used to restrict fillings of contact 3-manifolds.

concepts.label: strong fillings
concepts.description: Compact symplectic manifolds with boundary a contact manifold, weaker condition than exact filling.

concepts.label: integral homology
concepts.description: Homology groups with integer coefficients; a fundamental topological invariant of manifolds.

concepts.label: intersection form
concepts.description: Bilinear form on middle homology measuring intersection numbers of cycles in even-dimensional manifolds.

concepts.label: Stein fillable contact
concepts.description: Contact structures on 3-manifolds that admit complex structures extending them as Stein manifolds.

concepts.label: Betti numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants counting the rank of homology groups; measure topological complexity.

concepts.label: adjunction contact structures
concepts.description: Contact 3-manifolds distinguished by adjunction-type symplectic caps.

concepts.label: finiteness property
concepts.description: Property that exact fillings of a contact 3-manifold have uniformly bounded topological invariants.

concepts.label: planar contact 3-manifolds
concepts.description: Contact 3-manifolds admitting planar diagrams, studied via Legendrian knot theory.

concepts.label: complexity zero
concepts.description: Contact structures with minimal topological complexity in the uniruled/adjunction classification.

concepts.label: double octic CY3
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau threefold defined as a degree-8 hypersurface in weighted projective space, determined by singular locus arrangements.

concepts.label: birational map
concepts.description: A rational map between algebraic varieties that is invertible away from codimension ≥2 subsets; used to relate different CY families.

concepts.label: Gopakumar-Vafa invariants
concepts.description: Integer-valued invariants of Calabi-Yau threefolds defined as linear combinations of Gromov-Witten invariants, capturing genus-zero and higher-genus curve-counting data.

concepts.label: integrality
concepts.description: Property that Gopakumar-Vafa invariants are integer-valued, as opposed to rational or real numbers.

concepts.label: genus vanishing
concepts.description: Phenomenon that Gopakumar-Vafa invariants of high genus vanish for toric Calabi-Yau threefolds, constraining the curve-counting structure.

concepts.label: linear combination
concepts.description: Mathematical construction expressing one quantity as a weighted sum of others; GV invariants are defined as integer linear combinations of GW invariants.

concepts.label: number theory
concepts.description: Mathematical discipline dealing with properties of integers; used in this work to prove integrality of GV invariants.

concepts.label: operator formalism
concepts.description: Algebraic framework using operator algebra and representation theory to manipulate generating functions and partition functions.

concepts.label: exponential formula
concepts.description: Combinatorial identity relating exponentials of sums to products, commonly used in enumerative geometry to relate invariants across different genera.

concepts.label: curve counting
concepts.description: Enumerative problem of counting holomorphic or pseudoholomorphic curves in a given homology class on a variety.

concepts.label: generating function
concepts.description: Formal power series encoding enumerative data; GV invariants appear as coefficients in generating functions built from GW invariants.

concepts.label: mirror factorization
concepts.description: Property where the mirror of a fibered Calabi-Yau manifold decomposes as a fibration over a dual base, with mirror structure preserved fiber-wise.

concepts.label: stability conditions
concepts.description: A mathematical framework classifying triangulated categories via stability data; objects are parameterized by phases and central charges in the complex plane.

concepts.label: triangulated category
concepts.description: An additive category with shift functor and distinguished triangles satisfying axioms; encodes homological algebra of coherent sheaves or derived categories.

concepts.label: chamber structure
concepts.description: A decomposition of a parameter space into open regions (chambers) separated by walls where the structure or stability classification changes discontinuously.

concepts.label: movable cone
concepts.description: In birational geometry, the cone of divisor classes that can be moved away from any irreducible subvariety; related to the ample cone.

concepts.label: bi-section
concepts.description: A divisor that generically intersects elliptic fibers in two points, weaker than a section for defining rational maps.

concepts.label: hypercharge flux
concepts.description: Gauge flux of the hypercharge U(1)_Y symmetry in Type IIB/F-theory compactifications used to break GUTs to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: F-theory GUT models
concepts.description: Grand unified theories constructed from elliptic fibrations of Calabi-Yau four-folds in F-theory, yielding unified gauge algebras that break to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Type IIB limit
concepts.description: Weakly-coupled limit of F-theory obtained by taking the fiber elliptic curve to be a Jacobian, enabling local 7-brane constructions.

concepts.label: U(1)_Y-U(1)^2 anomaly
concepts.description: Specific triangle anomaly involving one hypercharge and two additional abelian symmetries that constrains matter content and flux configurations.

concepts.label: geometrically massive U(1)
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry acquiring mass from non-Kähler deformations of the Calabi-Yau four-fold rather than from Stückelberg mechanism.

concepts.label: matter curves
concepts.description: Codimension-two loci in the F-theory base where massless matter fields localize; dual to seven-brane intersections in the Type IIB picture.

concepts.label: doublet-triplet splitting
concepts.description: Mechanism to separate the light Higgs doublets from heavy GUT triplets in SU(5) breaking, preventing fast proton decay; here induced by hypercharge flux.

concepts.label: gauge coupling unification
concepts.description: Requirement that three gauge couplings α₁, α₂, α₃ of the MSSM meet at a single coupling constant at the GUT scale.

concepts.label: tree-level gauge splitting
concepts.description: Difference in running gauge couplings at the GUT scale induced by hypercharge flux at tree-level in Type IIB/F-theory; typically order unity.

concepts.label: MSSM running
concepts.description: Renormalization group evolution of the three gauge couplings in the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model from the weak scale to the GUT scale.

concepts.label: 7-brane configuration
concepts.description: Stack of D7-branes wrapping 4-cycles in Type IIB Calabi-Yau three-fold, carrying gauge fields and matter; uplift to F-theory divisors.

concepts.label: U(1)_PQ symmetry
concepts.description: Peccei-Quinn global U(1) symmetry introduced to solve the strong CP problem; here preserved while achieving hypercharge flux doublet-triplet splitting.

concepts.label: E₇ gauge group
concepts.description: Exceptional Lie group of rank 7 arising as the generic gauge symmetry in certain F-theory compactifications before flux breaking.

concepts.label: Chiral matter
concepts.description: Fermions that transform asymmetrically under left-handed and right-handed representations of gauge groups; essential for realistic particle physics models.

concepts.label: Generations of matter
concepts.description: Number of repetitions of the fundamental fermion family structure; three generations is necessary to match the Standard Model phenomenology.

concepts.label: F-theory GUT
concepts.description: Grand unified theory constructed via elliptic fibrations over toric bases in F-theory, where gauge groups emerge from singularities of the elliptic curve fiber.

concepts.label: cubic Abelian anomaly
concepts.description: Triangle diagram anomaly in Abelian gauge theories where three U(1) currents couple; must vanish for consistency via Green-Schwarz mechanism or flux constraint.

concepts.label: vector-like matter
concepts.description: Matter field representations appearing in conjugate pairs (e.g., ψ ⊕ ψ̄) that are massive and decouple from low-energy physics.

concepts.label: GUT representation
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of a grand unified gauge group (e.g., SU(5), SO(10)) before symmetry breaking to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: mixed anomaly
concepts.description: Triangle anomaly coupling a U(1) gauge current with two additional U(1) gauge currents; may not be automatically canceled in local spectral cover constructions.

concepts.label: NMSSM
concepts.description: Next-to-Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model extending MSSM with singlet Higgs coupling; realizable from certain F-theory GUT breaking patterns.

concepts.label: local model
concepts.description: F-theory construction where matter and gauge algebras are studied on divisors or curves without reference to global compactification geometry.

concepts.label: Green-Schwarz mechanism
concepts.description: Anomaly cancellation in string theory via coupling of the axion to the anomalous current; implemented in F-theory through flux quantization.

concepts.label: 3+2 split
concepts.description: Decomposition of GUT representation fields into 3-plet and 2-plet under the Standard Model gauge group, with specific U(1) charge assignment.

concepts.label: 2+2+1 split
concepts.description: Decomposition of GUT representation fields into doublet, doublet, and singlet under the Standard Model gauge group, satisfying anomaly constraints.

concepts.label: massless exotics
concepts.description: Extra matter states beyond the Standard Model that remain massless in the spectrum due to protection by additional U(1) symmetries in the low-energy effective theory.

concepts.label: monodromy group
concepts.description: Small discrete group controlling the structure of multiple extra U(1) symmetries arising from the geometry of the elliptic fibration in F-theory.

concepts.label: R-parity symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete multiplicative symmetry that forbids baryon-number-violating and lepton-number-violating interactions, protecting against rapid proton decay in supersymmetric models.

concepts.label: Froggatt-Nielsen mechanism
concepts.description: Flavor structure generated by spontaneous breaking of a horizontal symmetry at intermediate scales, explaining hierarchical quark-lepton mass ratios through effective operators.

concepts.label: quark-lepton mass splitting
concepts.description: Systematic difference in mass hierarchies between quark and lepton families in GUT models, arising from flavor physics and breaking of GUT symmetries.

concepts.label: GUT singlets
concepts.description: Scalar fields transforming trivially under the GUT gauge group; vacuum expectation values of such fields can break the GUT symmetry and lift exotic states.

concepts.label: MSSM
concepts.description: Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model; the simplest supersymmetric extension of the Standard Model, predicting gauge coupling unification at the GUT scale.

concepts.label: G-flux
concepts.description: A supersymmetric four-form flux in F-theory compactifications that constrains moduli and determines coupling hierarchies via flux-induced superpotentials.

concepts.label: three generations
concepts.description: The empirically observed number of quark and lepton families in the Standard Model; in string constructions, encoded topologically by the Euler characteristic χ/2 or via chiral index.

concepts.label: flavor structure
concepts.description: The pattern of couplings between different fermion families and Higgs bosons, including mass hierarchies and flavor-changing neutral currents; constrained by phenomenology and family symmetries.

concepts.label: Gauge symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Mechanism by which a large geometric gauge group is reduced to a smaller subgroup through flux or Wilson line effects.

concepts.label: Vertical flux
concepts.description: Cohomological flux wrapping internal cycles that couples to the fiber structure and can break the geometric gauge algebra.

concepts.label: Remainder flux
concepts.description: Flux that does not pair with the zero section and can induce chiral matter and further gauge breaking.

concepts.label: Proton decay suppression
concepts.description: Mechanism preventing rapid proton destabilization through anomalous U(1) factors or discrete symmetry remnants.

concepts.label: Wilson line
concepts.description: Path-ordered exponential of a gauge connection around a non-contractible loop; used to break heterotic/F-theory GUT gauge algebras to SM without explicit flux.

concepts.label: line bundle stability
concepts.description: Condition (e.g., μ-slope stability) that a holomorphic line bundle on a surface satisfies, ensuring the gauge bundle gives a supersymmetric heterotic vacuum.

concepts.label: GUT group breaking
concepts.description: Process of spontaneously breaking a Grand Unified Theory gauge group (e.g., SU(5)) down to the Standard Model gauge algebra through flux or Wilson line mechanisms.

concepts.label: U(1) flux
concepts.description: Quantized abelian gauge flux turned on in the compactification to engineer hypercharge and break GUT symmetries while preserving massless modes.

concepts.label: Threshold corrections
concepts.description: Loop-level corrections to gauge kinetic terms from massive KK and string modes, affecting gauge coupling unification and related to Ray-Singer torsion in the geometry.

concepts.label: Ray-Singer torsion
concepts.description: Analytic invariant of elliptic fibration and spectral cover capturing topological data relevant to threshold corrections and proton decay amplitudes.

concepts.label: G₄-form
concepts.description: Four-form flux in M-theory on Calabi-Yau threefolds, dual to the IIB flux configuration in the Sen limit.

concepts.label: IIB flux
concepts.description: Ramond-Ramond and NSNS flux in Type IIB string theory that modulates the moduli and can break GUT symmetries via hypercharge-preserving mechanisms.

concepts.label: Sen weak coupling limit
concepts.description: A parametric limit in F-theory where the elliptic fiber degenerates, connecting F-theory compactifications to Type IIB string theory with weakly coupled D-branes.

concepts.label: M-theory
concepts.description: Eleven-dimensional supersymmetric theory conjectured to underlie Type IIA, Type IIB, and heterotic string theories via dualities.

concepts.label: Type IIB string theory
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional superstring theory with two identical right-handed supersymmetries, compactifiable on Calabi-Yau threefolds.

concepts.label: 7-brane
concepts.description: Extended object in Type IIB carrying gauge symmetry; in F-theory, collections of 7-branes support the gauge algebra of GUT models.

concepts.label: Gauge flux
concepts.description: A background G₄-form flux threading the four-dimensional F-theory compactification, determining chiral matter content and anomaly cancellation.

concepts.label: Top construction
concepts.description: A toric geometric method for engineering non-abelian gauge groups SU(3)⊕SU(2) in F-theory via codimension-two singularities of the elliptic fibration.

concepts.label: Standard Model spectrum
concepts.description: The full set of chiral fermions and their quantum numbers in the Standard Model: three generations of quarks and leptons with SU(3)⊕SU(2)⊕U(1)_Y charges.

concepts.label: Primary decomposition
concepts.description: An ideal-theoretic technique from commutative algebra that decomposes ideals into irreducible components; used here to classify cohomology groups on matter surfaces.

concepts.label: Tate model
concepts.description: A special class of Weierstrass models with enhanced singularities whose local properties are captured by spectral cover methods, facilitating explicit Yukawa coupling computation.

concepts.label: Gauge group emergence
concepts.description: The appearance of non-abelian gauge symmetries in F-theory from the geometry of the elliptic fibration, specifically from the topology of the discriminant locus.

concepts.label: MSSM gauge coupling
concepts.description: The three running gauge couplings αₛ (strong), α₂ (weak), α₁ (hypercharge) of the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model.

concepts.label: one-loop gauge coupling
concepts.description: Leading-order perturbative calculation of gauge coupling evolution and unification; flux effects can spoil this prediction at O(g²).

concepts.label: string scale
concepts.description: Energy scale M_s ≈ 10^17–10^18 GeV where string theory effects become significant and GUT scale coupling convergence is expected.

concepts.label: curvature-induced tadpole
concepts.description: Anomaly constraint arising from the curvature of the Calabi-Yau fourfold that must be cancelled for a consistent compactification.

concepts.label: complete intersection
concepts.description: Algebraic variety defined as the intersection of hypersurface constraints; used here to realize the Calabi-Yau fourfold as a complete intersection in ambient projective space.

concepts.label: massless spectrum
concepts.description: The light fermionic and bosonic modes emerging from the geometry and spectral cover, including gauge bosons, matter multiplets, and Higgs fields.

concepts.label: exotic matter condition
concepts.description: Phenomenological requirement that dangerous exotic fermions (e.g., color-triplet scalars) not appear in the low-energy spectrum after GUT breaking.

concepts.label: discrete symmetry alignment
concepts.description: A discrete symmetry condition that aligns contributions to Yukawa matrices from multiple codimension-three singularity points on the GUT surface.

concepts.label: codimension-three singularity
concepts.description: Isolated points on a GUT 7-brane surface where the gauge group is enhanced and matter multiplets localize; multiple points can contribute to the same Yukawa coupling.

concepts.label: rational elliptic surface
concepts.description: A rational surface with an elliptic fibration structure over ℙ¹; a lower-dimensional analog of K3 surfaces sometimes used as GUT surface candidates.

concepts.label: GUT surface topology
concepts.description: The topological and geometric properties of the divisor wrapped by a GUT 7-brane, determining which matter curves and singularities exist and how Yukawas form.

concepts.label: F-theory geometry search
concepts.description: Systematic scan or classification of elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau 4-folds and candidate GUT surfaces to identify viable phenomenological models.

concepts.label: SU(5) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Five-dimensional special unitary group used as the GUT symmetry that breaks to the Standard Model gauge algebra su(3)⊕su(2)⊕u(1).

concepts.label: D3-tadpole cancellation
concepts.description: Consistency condition requiring the net RR charge from D3-branes (including contributions from background flux) to vanish in F-theory compactifications.

concepts.label: U(1) symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry factor in GUT models, constrained by anomaly cancellation conditions and potentially identified with Peccei-Quinn or hypercharge.

concepts.label: Dudas-Palti relations
concepts.description: Set of constraints on SU(5) F-theory GUT models with U(1) symmetries derived from 4D anomaly cancellation conditions, relating matter content and gauge structure.

concepts.label: Dimension-5 proton decay
concepts.description: Proton decay mediated by dimension-5 operators suppressed by inverse powers of GUT scale; a primary constraint on GUT model viability requiring protective mechanisms.

concepts.label: Global F-theory completion
concepts.description: Construction of consistent global F-theory model from local spectral cover data, requiring resolution of singularities and compatibility with anomaly cancellation.

concepts.label: Gauge group unification
concepts.description: High-energy unification of Standard Model forces via a larger simple gauge group before breaking to SM at lower scales; constrains matter content and coupling relations.

concepts.label: Saxion
concepts.description: Radial component of the axion supermultiplet in F-theory models; oscillates in early universe and dominates energy density before decaying.

concepts.label: Axino
concepts.description: Fermionic superpartner of the axion in supersymmetric theories; eaten by gravitino in F-theory GUTs to generate its mass.

concepts.label: Gravitino LSP
concepts.description: The lightest supersymmetric particle in F-theory models; acquires mass via axino absorption and contributes to dark matter.

concepts.label: Reheating temperature
concepts.description: Temperature of the universe after inflationary reheating; set by saxion decay in F-theory models to approximately 1 GeV.

concepts.label: Big bang nucleosynthesis
concepts.description: Primordial synthesis of light elements; constrains saxion reheating and gravitino abundance in early universe.

concepts.label: Dark matter
concepts.description: Measured relic density of non-baryonic matter from cosmological observations; constrained by gravitino and axion contributions.

concepts.label: Leptogenesis
concepts.description: Mechanism generating baryon asymmetry via lepton number violation; compatible with saxion dilution in F-theory GUTs.

concepts.label: Local GUT models
concepts.description: Non-minimal Grand Unified Theory models constructed on local patches of F-theory geometry, where GUT gauge groups emerge from higher-rank bulk gauge algebras.

concepts.label: Bulk gauge group
concepts.description: Higher-rank gauge algebra G_S appearing on the full F-theory base, one rank higher than the resultant GUT gauge group.

concepts.label: GUT gauge group
concepts.description: Grand Unified Theory gauge algebra (e.g., SU(5), SO(10), E_6) obtained by breaking the bulk gauge group via line bundle configurations.

concepts.label: Line bundles on curves
concepts.description: Non-trivial holomorphic line bundles over matter curves in F-theory; mediate breaking of bulk gauge symmetry to GUT groups.

concepts.label: Instanton configurations
concepts.description: Non-perturbative string instantons in F-theory that generate superpotential terms and enable GUT breaking to MSSM.

concepts.label: SO(10) gauge group
concepts.description: Spin(10) Grand Unified Theory group containing the Standard Model gauge algebra as a subgroup, constructed via spectral cover on GUT divisors.

concepts.label: flipped SU(5) model
concepts.description: Grand unified theory variant obtained by breaking SO(10) to SU(5)×U(1) where U(1) charges are non-standard, allowing alternative phenomenological predictions.

concepts.label: GUT Higgs
concepts.description: Scalar fields transforming under the GUT gauge group whose vacuum expectation values break the GUT symmetry to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Fano threefold
concepts.description: A smooth three-dimensional algebraic variety with ample anticanonical bundle, used as the base for F-theory elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: split spectral cover
concepts.description: A factorizable spectral cover hypersurface that provides additional degrees of freedom for phenomenological tuning in matter generation.

concepts.label: GUT scale
concepts.description: The energy scale at which grand unified theories achieve gauge coupling unification, conventionally ~2×10¹⁶ GeV in SU(5) or SO(10) models.

concepts.label: Wilson line GUT breaking
concepts.description: A mechanism for breaking GUT symmetries via non-trivial holonomy around cycles in extra dimensions, generating the Standard Model gauge group from a unified parent group.

concepts.label: volume moduli
concepts.description: Scalar fields parametrizing the sizes and shapes of divisors or surfaces in the compactification geometry; control coupling strengths and mass scales in the effective field theory.

concepts.label: twin sector
concepts.description: A hidden or parallel gauge sector with its own matter content and interactions, decoupled or weakly coupled to the visible Standard Model sector.

concepts.label: SUSY breaking gaugino condensate
concepts.description: A non-perturbative mechanism in which gaugino bilinear condensates in a hidden sector spontaneously break supersymmetry, transmitting SUSY breaking to the visible sector via mediation.

concepts.label: visible sector
concepts.description: The sector containing Standard Model particles and interactions, distinguished from hidden or twin sectors with which it may have suppressed couplings.

concepts.label: effective field theory
concepts.description: A low-energy description of quantum field theory valid below a cutoff scale, integrating out high-energy degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: coupling constant hierarchy
concepts.description: Differences in the magnitudes of gauge coupling constants at a given energy scale, set by geometric and modular parameters in string compactifications.

concepts.label: KK modes
concepts.description: Kaluza-Klein tower of massive excitations of higher-dimensional fields arising from compactification on the internal manifold.

concepts.label: gauge mediation
concepts.description: Supersymmetry breaking mechanism in which sparticles acquire masses through one-loop couplings to messenger fields that interact with the SUSY-breaking sector.

concepts.label: sparticle spectrum
concepts.description: Mass spectrum of supersymmetric partners of Standard Model particles, including squarks, sleptons, neutralinos, and charginos.

concepts.label: hypercharge flux breaking
concepts.description: The mechanism by which hypercharge flux in F-theory breaks the SU(5) GUT gauge symmetry down to SU(3)_C ⊗ SU(2)_L ⊗ U(1)_Y while generating Yukawa couplings and chiral matter.

concepts.label: two-loop running
concepts.description: Renormalization group evolution of coupling constants including next-to-leading order radiative corrections from two-loop diagrams.

concepts.label: LHC phenomenology
concepts.description: Predictions for particle production cross-sections, decay modes, and kinematic observables testable at the Large Hadron Collider.

concepts.label: mGMSB
concepts.description: Minimal gauge mediation model—the simplest implementation of gauge-mediated SUSY breaking with minimal messenger content.

concepts.label: kinematic edge
