concepts.description: Kinematic edge in dilepton or multi-particle invariant mass distributions arising from two-body decay chains in SUSY cascades, used to measure sparticle masses.

concepts.label: semi-local F-theory model
concepts.description: F-theory GUT construction that depends only on the local structure of the elliptic fibration and gauge sector, independent of the global Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: right-handed neutrino
concepts.description: Singlet fermion under Standard Model gauge groups that couples to left-handed leptons via Yukawa couplings; candidate for generating neutrino masses.

concepts.label: zero modes
concepts.description: Harmonic differential forms on Calabi-Yau manifolds whose integrals yield massless matter multiplicities in four-dimensional effective theories.

concepts.label: Anomalous U(1) Peccei-Quinn
concepts.description: Anomalous U(1) gauge symmetry combined with Peccei-Quinn mechanism that forbids bare mu and B*mu terms while protecting the strong CP problem.

concepts.label: mu term
concepts.description: Higgsino mass parameter in the MSSM supersymmetric potential that determines electroweak symmetry breaking scale.

concepts.label: SUSY breaking scale
concepts.description: Energy scale at which supersymmetry is spontaneously broken in the hidden sector, characterized by the auxiliary field vev F^(1/2).

concepts.label: Soft SUSY breaking parameters
concepts.description: Mass terms and couplings in the low-energy MSSM Lagrangian arising from high-scale SUSY breaking, including gaugino masses and scalar masses.

concepts.label: QCD axion
concepts.description: Hypothetical pseudoscalar particle that solves the strong CP problem through the Peccei-Quinn mechanism by relaxing the theta parameter.

concepts.label: Strong CP problem
concepts.description: The theoretical puzzle of why the strong nuclear force exhibits no observable CP violation, despite the QCD Lagrangian allowing a CP-violating theta term.

concepts.label: Giudice-Masiero mechanism
concepts.description: Mechanism in supergravity that generates the Higgsino mass parameter mu through Kahler potential interactions in gauge mediation.

concepts.label: B*mu problem
concepts.description: Theoretical problem of why the Higgs bilinear term coupling coefficient B is naturally of similar magnitude to mu in supersymmetric theories.

concepts.label: Gaugino mass unification
concepts.description: Condition in unified theories where gaugino masses are set equal at the GUT scale, predicting the low-energy mass hierarchy.

concepts.label: Axion decay constant
concepts.description: Energy scale fa characterizing the strength of axion couplings and related to the Peccei-Quinn symmetry breaking scale.

concepts.label: Neutralino NLSP
concepts.description: Next-to-lightest supersymmetric particle identified as a bino-like neutralino in this model class.

concepts.label: Electroweak symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of the SU(2)_L × U(1)_Y gauge symmetry generating masses for W/Z bosons and fermions.

concepts.label: Fayet-Polonyi model
concepts.description: Minimal supersymmetric model with a single chiral superfield whose F-term provides SUSY breaking.

concepts.label: PALP
concepts.description: Software package for enumerating and analyzing lattice polytopes; enables systematic construction of toric Calabi-Yau varieties from polytope data.

concepts.label: Neutrino sector
concepts.description: Set of fields and interactions responsible for neutrino masses and mixing in the low-energy effective theory.

concepts.label: SU(5) × U(1) gauge group
concepts.description: A Grand Unified gauge symmetry combining SU(5) GUT group with an additional abelian U(1) factor, extended beyond minimal SU(5).

concepts.label: matter sections
concepts.description: Holomorphic sections of the elliptic fibration determining the location and properties of matter curves and their associated chiral fermions.

concepts.label: Chern-Simons term
concepts.description: A topological three-form term in three-dimensional geometry that encodes one-loop quantum effects; used here to compute four-dimensional chiral indices.

concepts.label: E8 gauge group
concepts.description: The largest simple Lie group of rank 8; appears naturally in heterotic string theory but is avoided in this F-theory construction.

concepts.label: model discriminant
concepts.description: A criterion or set of criteria used to distinguish phenomenologically viable models from unphysical or fine-tuned solutions in large databases.

concepts.label: U(1) gauge field
concepts.description: Abelian gauge symmetry responsible for electromagnetic-like interactions; in F-theory arises from sections of line bundles on the elliptic fibration base.

concepts.label: F-theory landscape
concepts.description: Vast space of 4D effective theories obtainable from F-theory on distinct Calabi-Yau geometries and flux choices; contains constraints from quantum gravity and swampland.

concepts.label: μ problem
concepts.description: Naturalness puzzle explaining why the Higgs mass parameter μ is of order the weak scale rather than the GUT or Planck scale.

concepts.label: μ/B_μ problem
concepts.description: Extended hierarchy problem requiring simultaneous explanation of both the Higgs mass parameter μ and its bilinear coupling B_μ at compatible scales.

concepts.label: SUSY-breaking spurion
concepts.description: Auxiliary field or scalar that carries SUSY-breaking information and couples to the visible sector, characterized by its anomalous charge under symmetries.

concepts.label: Messenger sector
concepts.description: Hidden-sector fields that couple to both SUSY-breaking and visible sectors, mediating supersymmetry breaking at tree and loop levels.

concepts.label: D3-instanton
concepts.description: Non-perturbative worldvolume instanton effect on D3-branes in type IIB string theory generating exponentially suppressed contributions.

concepts.label: Sweet spot supersymmetry
concepts.description: Scenario where the messenger mass scale and SUSY-breaking scale are aligned to achieve natural electroweak symmetry breaking without excessive fine-tuning.

concepts.label: Higgs sector
concepts.description: The doublet(s) and singlet(s) responsible for electroweak symmetry breaking and generating fermion masses through Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: 7-brane geometry
concepts.description: Extended objects in F-theory defining local gauge groups through wrapping cycles and singularity enhancement in elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: Exponential suppression
concepts.description: Non-perturbative mechanism reducing a physical scale or coupling by an exponential factor relative to the fundamental scale.

concepts.label: modular symmetry
concepts.description: SL(2,ℤ) or congruence subgroup symmetry acting on the moduli space of string compactifications, constraining coupling functions.

concepts.label: standard embedding
concepts.description: Embedding of the spin connection into one E₈ gauge group of the heterotic string, breaking E₈ to E₆.

concepts.label: instanton correction
concepts.description: Non-perturbative contribution to coupling constants from wrapped Euclidean D-branes or worldsheet instantons.

concepts.label: matter field Kähler metric
concepts.description: Hermitian metric on matter field space whose determinant determines wave-function renormalization and physical Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: hierarchical Yukawa structure
concepts.description: Pattern of widely varying fermion mass matrices with top ≫ bottom ≫ electron mass ratios, achieved through modular weights and selection rules.

concepts.label: congruence subgroup
concepts.description: Discrete subgroup of SL(2,ℤ) such as Γ₀(3) or Γ₀(4) preserving asymptotic moduli regions with reduced modular weight.

concepts.label: asymptotic moduli region
concepts.description: Limit region of Calabi-Yau moduli space where geometric or field-theoretic structure becomes semi-classical and modular symmetry manifest.

concepts.label: holomorphic coupling
concepts.description: Complex-analytic dependence of Yukawa couplings on moduli fields, protected from non-holomorphic corrections by supersymmetry.

concepts.label: bundle-valued form
concepts.description: A differential form with values in a vector bundle; the construction and integration of such forms yields Yukawa couplings in string compactifications.

concepts.label: vanishing theorem
concepts.description: A topological constraint proving that certain Yukawa couplings allowed by gauge symmetry must vanish due to cohomological obstructions on the Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: Anomaly Mediated SUSY Breaking
concepts.description: Supersymmetry breaking mechanism where soft masses arise from anomalous running of couplings in a sequestered sector, mediated by anomalies.

concepts.label: Slepton mass problem
concepts.description: The issue in AMSB that sleptons acquire tachyonic masses, rendering the spectrum phenomenologically unviable.

concepts.label: Fermion mass hierarchy
concepts.description: The observed pattern of fermion masses spanning many orders of magnitude from electron to top quark.

concepts.label: Yukawa textures
concepts.description: Specific patterns of zeros and non-zero entries in Yukawa coupling matrices that determine fermion masses and mixings.

concepts.label: Flavour changing neutral currents
concepts.description: Rare processes mediated by neutral particle exchange that violate flavour conservation; highly constrained by experiment.

concepts.label: Anomalous running
concepts.description: Renormalization group evolution of coupling constants modified by quantum anomalies in a sequestered sector.

concepts.label: Family quantum numbers
concepts.description: Discrete or continuous symmetries that distinguish between generations of fermions and can suppress inter-generational couplings.

concepts.label: quark-meson model
concepts.description: An effective field theory framework describing the interaction between quarks and meson fields with three flavor symmetry.

concepts.label: field-dependent coupling
concepts.description: A coupling constant that varies as a function of the background field value, rather than remaining constant.

concepts.label: functional renormalization group
concepts.description: A non-perturbative technique that computes quantum corrections by tracking the renormalization group flow of all operators in the effective action as a function of an infrared cutoff scale.

concepts.label: renormalization group flow
concepts.description: The evolution of coupling constants and operator coefficients with respect to a running scale, governed by beta functions.

concepts.label: scalar field
concepts.description: A quantum field with spin-0 that transforms as a singlet under Lorentz transformations; in the QM model, represents scalar mesons.

concepts.label: pseudoscalar field
concepts.description: A quantum field with spin-0 that transforms as a pseudoscalar under parity; in the QM model, represents pseudoscalar mesons.

concepts.label: chiral symmetry
concepts.description: A continuous global symmetry of the Lagrangian that distinguishes left-handed and right-handed fermion fields; fundamental to QCD and the QM model.

concepts.label: chirally invariant operator
concepts.description: A composite operator in the effective action that respects the chiral symmetry structure and is generated by quantum fluctuations.

concepts.label: quantum fluctuation
concepts.description: Virtual particle-antiparticle pairs and loop diagrams that contribute quantum corrections to the effective action at higher orders.

concepts.label: effective action
concepts.description: The quantum-corrected action obtained by integrating out high-energy degrees of freedom; encodes all one-particle-irreducible processes.

concepts.label: field rescaling
concepts.description: A redefinition of the field variables by a multiplicative factor; at tree level is trivial but at loop level can affect coupling flows.

concepts.label: one-loop renormalization
concepts.description: Quantum corrections arising from a single closed loop of virtual particles in Feynman diagrams.

concepts.label: perturbative calculation
concepts.description: A systematic expansion of quantum field theory results in powers of the coupling constant, assuming weak coupling.

concepts.label: vector bundle
concepts.description: Holomorphic bundle over the Calabi-Yau whose structure group determines the gauge algebra of the effective field theory.

concepts.label: monadic bundle
concepts.description: Vector bundle constructed as the cohomology of a monad complex over a projective variety, enabling efficient computational description.

concepts.label: polynomial algorithm
concepts.description: Computational method based on algebraic manipulation of polynomials enabling automated calculation of geometric and physical quantities.

concepts.label: Feynman integral
concepts.description: A loop integral in quantum field theory representing the amplitude contribution from a Feynman diagram with specified propagators and vertices.

concepts.label: rigidity
concepts.description: The smallest dimension over which a Feynman integral is non-polylogarithmic; a measure of the geometric complexity required to evaluate the integral.

concepts.label: polylogarithmic function
concepts.description: A special function expressible in terms of classical polylogarithms; Feynman integrals that are polylogarithmic require no higher-dimensional geometry.

concepts.label: massless Feynman integral
concepts.description: A Feynman integral in four dimensions with all internal masses set to zero; characterized by scale invariance and conformal structure.

concepts.label: loop order
concepts.description: The number of independent loops L in a Feynman diagram; determines the power counting and complexity of the integral.

concepts.label: propagator
concepts.description: A factor in a Feynman integral representing the internal particle exchange line; counted by degree D in dimensional regularization.

concepts.label: marginal Feynman integral
concepts.description: A Feynman integral with (L+1)D/2 propagators in even D dimensions; generically involves Calabi-Yau geometries and saturates rigidity bounds.

concepts.label: dimensional regularization
concepts.description: A regularization scheme in which Feynman integrals are evaluated in D dimensions (typically D=4-2ε) to control divergences.

concepts.label: massless φ⁴ theory
concepts.description: A four-dimensional quantum field theory with a quartic scalar interaction and no mass terms; provides concrete examples of finite Feynman integrals.

concepts.label: rigidity bound
concepts.description: The upper limit 2(L-1) on the rigidity of massless four-dimensional Feynman integrals at L loops; may be saturated by marginal integrals.

concepts.label: finite integral
concepts.description: A Feynman integral with no divergences; in massless φ⁴ theory, certain loop integrals remain finite through cancellation of divergences.

concepts.label: Griffiths-Yukawa coupling length
concepts.description: A measure of the complexity and structure of Yukawa couplings in a Calabi-Yau family, characterizing how they deform along the moduli space.

concepts.label: trivial extension algebra
concepts.description: An algebra T(A) constructed from a finite-dimensional algebra A by adjoining a copy of its dual as a square-zero ideal, used to study periodicity and homological properties.

concepts.label: fractionally Calabi-Yau algebra
concepts.description: A finite-dimensional algebra satisfying a fractional version of the Calabi-Yau condition, characterised by homological regularities related to twisted periodicity.

concepts.label: periodicity
concepts.description: A property of algebras where the syzygy operator applied repeatedly returns to the original module after a finite number of iterations, indicating homological cyclicity.

concepts.label: twisted periodicity
concepts.description: A generalisation of periodicity where the syzygy operator composed with an algebra automorphism returns to the original module, a weaker condition than strict periodicity.

concepts.label: self-injective orbit algebra
concepts.description: An algebra obtained from a self-injective algebra via orbital quotient by a group action, preserving self-injectivity and enabling periodicity analysis.

concepts.label: Erdmann-Skowroński periodicity conjecture
concepts.description: A long-standing open problem asserting that the classes of periodic and twisted periodic algebras coincide.

concepts.label: cluster tilting theory
concepts.description: A framework in representation theory studying cluster categories and cluster-tilting subcategories, related to stability conditions and derived equivalences.

concepts.label: d-representation-finiteness
concepts.description: A homological finiteness condition where the d-th syzygy module of every finitely generated module has finite length, generalising representation-finiteness.

concepts.label: r-fold trivial extension
concepts.description: An iterated trivial extension T_r(A) obtained by applying the trivial extension functor r times to an algebra A.

concepts.label: representation type
concepts.description: A classification of finite-dimensional algebras into tame, wild, or finite representation type based on the complexity of their indecomposable module categories.

concepts.label: derived equivalence
concepts.description: An equivalence between the derived categories of two algebras, preserving homological structure and implying many invariants are shared.

concepts.label: symmetric algebra
concepts.description: An algebra isomorphic to its dual as a bimodule, possessing a special symmetry that constrains its homological properties and representation theory.

concepts.label: minimal period
concepts.description: The smallest positive integer n such that the n-th syzygy of a module returns to itself under the periodicity operator; a measure of homological cycle length.

concepts.label: strong coupling limit
concepts.description: A regime where the string coupling constant becomes large, requiring non-perturbative treatment or duality description.

concepts.label: Horava-Witten compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of eleven-dimensional supergravity on a Calabi-Yau manifold times an interval with E₈ gauge groups at the boundaries.

concepts.label: Newton's constant
concepts.description: The gravitational coupling constant G_N characterizing the strength of gravity; its smallness is problematic in standard compactifications.

concepts.label: supersymmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of supersymmetric symmetry, controlled by unbroken supersymmetry conditions in the effective action.

concepts.label: Du Bois singularities
concepts.description: A class of singularities on Gorenstein varieties characterized by specific cohomological properties and rational singularity generalizations.

concepts.label: obstruction space
concepts.description: Cohomological group measuring whether infinitesimal deformations extend to actual deformations; vanishing implies unobstructed deformations.

concepts.label: weighted homogeneous singularities
concepts.description: Singularities invariant under scaling in weighted coordinates; a special case of rational singularities.

concepts.label: ∂∂̄-lemma
concepts.description: A Kähler property stating that every ∂∂̄-exact form is exact, implying formality of the Dolbeault complex.

concepts.label: Gorenstein property
concepts.description: A duality condition on singularities ensuring the dualizing sheaf is a line bundle; required for well-defined adjunction.

concepts.label: local complete intersection
concepts.description: A singularity defined by codimension-many equations in a smooth variety; often more tractable than general singularities.

concepts.label: H¹(Y;O_Y)
concepts.description: Sheaf cohomology group measuring obstructions to extending holomorphic functions; vanishing constrains deformations.

concepts.label: log Calabi-Yau variety
concepts.description: A variety X with a divisor D such that K_X + D is trivial, generalizing Calabi-Yau geometry to singular and non-compact settings.

concepts.label: dualizing sheaf
concepts.description: The canonical sheaf ω_Y on a Gorenstein space, playing the role of the canonical divisor in Serre duality.

concepts.label: rational singularities
concepts.description: Singularities where higher direct images of the structure sheaf under resolution vanish, allowing vanishing theorems.

concepts.label: Shimura family
concepts.description: Arithmetic ball quotient parametrized by a variation of Hodge structure; certain CY families (n=3,5,9) partially compactify to Shimura varieties.

concepts.label: Shafarevich conjecture
concepts.description: Statement that finitely many isomorphism classes of CY manifolds exist in each dimension; proven for families with minimal Yukawa coupling length.

concepts.label: heterotic line-bundle model
concepts.description: String compactification on CY using heterotic E₈×E₈ gauge bundle; systematic source of SM-like gauge algebras via Chern class constraints.

concepts.label: CICY manifold
concepts.description: Complete intersection Calabi-Yau defined as transverse intersection of hypersurfaces in products of projective spaces.

concepts.label: standard-like model
concepts.description: A particle physics model admitting the gauge group and chiral fermion spectrum of the Standard Model or its GUT extension, derived from string compactification.

concepts.label: line bundle cohomology
concepts.description: Computing sheaf cohomology groups H^i(X, L) for holomorphic line bundles L, essential for determining chiral matter spectrum in heterotic models.

concepts.label: vector-like states
concepts.description: Pairs of matter fields with opposite chirality transforming identically under gauge groups, typically unwanted in phenomenological models.

concepts.label: weak Fano base
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface with ample anticanonical bundle, serving as the base of an elliptic fibration.

concepts.label: freely-acting involution
concepts.description: A Z_2 symmetry on the CY3 with no fixed points, quotient by which generates new three-folds while preserving some structure.

concepts.label: second section
concepts.description: A second independent holomorphic section of the elliptic fibration (in addition to the zero section), enabling richer geometry and Wilson line structure.

concepts.label: monad bundle
concepts.description: Vector bundle constructed via exactness of a short sequence of vector bundles; provides efficient parameterization for bundle scanning.

concepts.label: polynomial region structure
concepts.description: Decomposition of the line bundle charge space into cones where cohomology dimensions are given by polynomial functions of degree at most 3 in the bundle charges.

concepts.label: recursive cohomology relations
concepts.description: Recursive relationships or recurrence formulas that determine line bundle cohomology dimensions more efficiently than explicit polynomial fits across multiple regions.

concepts.label: configuration matrix
concepts.description: Matrix encoding the ambient variety structure of a CICY; rows specify degree pairs (d_i, n_i) of hypersurface constraints, and manifolds sharing rows exhibit similar cohomology structure.

concepts.label: irregular index behavior
concepts.description: Exceptional boundaries or discontinuities in the line bundle index within the charge space, marking regions where standard polynomial descriptions fail or exhibit singular geometry.

concepts.label: favourable CICY
concepts.description: Complete Intersection Calabi-Yau manifolds satisfying smoothness and regularity conditions, ensuring the manifold is a valid target for string compactification.

concepts.label: Riemann-Roch theorem
concepts.description: Classical theorem relating the Euler characteristic of a line bundle to its first Chern class and top Chern class of the ambient manifold.

concepts.label: analytic cohomology formulas
concepts.description: Closed-form expressions for line bundle cohomology dimensions as functions of bundle charges, derived from topological and algebraic properties rather than direct computation.

concepts.label: polystable bundle
concepts.description: A holomorphic vector bundle that is a direct sum of stable bundles with equal slope, generalizing stability to reducible configurations.

concepts.label: Strominger system
concepts.description: A system of geometric PDEs governing heterotic string compactifications on non-Kähler manifolds, coupling the metric, B-field, and gauge connection.

concepts.label: non-Kähler deformation
concepts.description: A continuous deformation of the complex structure of a Kähler manifold to a non-Kähler geometry satisfying the Strominger system.

concepts.label: neural network classifier
concepts.description: Machine learning model using interconnected layers of neurons with backpropagation; employed here to predict geometric properties of CICYs from combinatorial input data.

concepts.label: Support Vector Machine
concepts.description: Statistical learning algorithm that finds optimal hyperplanes to separate data classes; used here as an alternative classifier for CICY properties.

concepts.label: string model building
concepts.description: Construction of 4D effective field theories (including the Standard Model) from compactification of string theory on Calabi-Yau manifolds.

concepts.label: genetic algorithm
concepts.description: Evolutionary optimization method that iteratively selects and mutates candidate solutions; used here to tune neural network hyperparameters.

concepts.label: SMOTE
concepts.description: Synthetic Minority Oversampling Technique; resampling method that creates synthetic examples of the underrepresented class to address class imbalance in training data.

concepts.label: class imbalance
concepts.description: Unequal distribution of training samples across classes; common in CICY classification where favorable/SM models are rare; addressed via SMOTE and permutations.

concepts.label: heterotic Line Bundle Standard Models
concepts.description: String theory compactifications on Calabi-Yau threefolds using heterotic bundles to construct particle physics Standard Model gauge groups and spectra.

concepts.label: complex structure moduli
concepts.description: Parameters describing the shape of the Calabi-Yau manifold; their fixation by hidden sector fluxes or bundles constrains the visible sector spectrum.

concepts.label: hidden sector bundle
concepts.description: Vector bundle on the Calabi-Yau threefold in the hidden sector whose choice of connection and structure constrains visible sector moduli.

concepts.label: cohomology jumping
concepts.description: Discontinuous change in dimension of cohomology groups determining the particle spectrum when moduli approach special loci in moduli space.

concepts.label: topological constraint
concepts.description: Higher-dimensional geometric obstruction from line bundle cohomology causing certain couplings to vanish despite being allowed by local symmetries.

concepts.label: flipped SU(5) GUT
concepts.description: Grand unified theory based on SU(5) gauge group that breaks to SM-like spectrum with different hypercharge embedding than conventional SU(5).

concepts.label: five-brane
concepts.description: Solitonic object in heterotic string theory that wraps curves in the CY manifold; contributes to anomaly cancellation and moduli.

concepts.label: simply connected CY
concepts.description: Calabi-Yau manifold with trivial fundamental group π₁; constrains bundle topology and moduli space structure.

concepts.label: toric bases
concepts.description: Toric varieties used as base spaces for elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds in F-theory constructions.

concepts.label: tensor multiplet
concepts.description: 6D supergravity multiplet containing a self-dual tensor and moduli fields; count is constrained by anomaly cancellation.

concepts.label: quiver Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra structure defined on the path algebra of a quiver, combining algebraic and coalgebraic operations compatible with the quiver's directed graph.

concepts.label: Taft algebra
concepts.description: A finite-dimensional pointed Hopf algebra generated by a group-like element and a primitive element, forming a fundamental example in Hopf algebra classification.

concepts.label: Yetter-Drinfeld module
concepts.description: A module over a Hopf algebra H that is simultaneously a left H-module and a left H-comodule satisfying compatibility conditions between the two structures.

concepts.label: Nichols algebra
concepts.description: A braided graded Hopf algebra generated in degree one whose braided primitive elements generate the algebra without higher relations, fundamental to pointed Hopf algebra structure.

concepts.label: pointed Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra whose group-like elements generate a group; classification often proceeds via graded lifting from Nichols algebras of Yetter-Drinfeld modules.

concepts.label: finite abelian group
concepts.description: A finite commutative group serving as the group of group-like elements in a pointed Hopf algebra over G.

concepts.label: quantum enveloping algebra
concepts.description: A q-deformation of the universal enveloping algebra of a Lie algebra, encoding quantum group structure compatible with quantum symmetries.

concepts.label: semisimple Lie algebra
concepts.description: A Lie algebra decomposable as a direct sum of simple ideals, classified by root systems and Dynkin diagrams over algebraically closed fields.

concepts.label: semi-path Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra constructed from a quiver with semi-compatibility conditions on paths, generalizing standard path algebras.

concepts.label: Hopf algebra quotient
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra homomorphism with kernel that is a Hopf ideal, preserving the algebra, coalgebra, and antipode structures.

concepts.label: braided Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra object internal to a braided monoidal category, where the braiding intertwines tensor product factors.

concepts.label: path algebra
concepts.description: An algebra with basis given by paths in a quiver, with multiplication defined by path concatenation.

concepts.label: algebraic density property
concepts.description: An approximation property for holomorphic automorphisms on affine varieties enabling Andersén-Lempert approximation results.

concepts.label: Andersén-Lempert theory
concepts.description: Framework for approximating holomorphic automorphisms and embeddings via shear maps and algebraic approximation.

concepts.label: T-invariant subvariety
concepts.description: A closed subvariety of a toric variety that is preserved under the action of the torus T.

concepts.label: holomorphic automorphisms
concepts.description: Biholomorphic self-maps of a complex variety; their approximation properties are central to density theory.

concepts.label: toric surfaces
concepts.description: Two-dimensional affine toric varieties, classified combinatorially by rational polyhedral cones in dimension 2.

concepts.label: strong algebraic density property
concepts.description: A strengthened variant of the algebraic density property relative to the singular locus of a variety.

concepts.label: complete algebraic vector fields
concepts.description: Vector fields on affine spaces whose flows are defined for all time and generate global algebraic actions.

concepts.label: equivariant classification
concepts.description: Classification of geometric objects with respect to a group action, preserving the symmetry structure.

concepts.label: Brunella's classification
concepts.description: Landmark result classifying complete algebraic vector fields in the affine plane up to automorphism.

concepts.label: approximation results
concepts.description: Theorems establishing that certain geometric objects (automorphisms, embeddings) can be approximated by explicit algebraic or holomorphic maps.

concepts.label: toric ideal
concepts.description: A binomial ideal generated by differences of monomials, encoding the algebraic structure of a toric variety.

concepts.label: de Sitter vacuum
concepts.description: A quantum state of a cosmological compactification with positive vacuum energy density, consistent with observed cosmic acceleration.

concepts.label: coefficient algebra
concepts.description: Subalgebra generated by all coefficients of the characteristic polynomial of a Lie algebra acting on a finite-dimensional representation.

concepts.label: characteristic polynomial
concepts.description: Polynomial det(tI - ρ(X)) whose coefficients generate the coefficient algebra for Lie algebra element X in representation ρ.

concepts.label: invariant theory
concepts.description: Mathematical study of polynomials and algebraic structures invariant under group actions, classically applied to linear groups.

concepts.label: symmetric power representation
concepts.description: Tensor power of the standard representation S^k(V) equipped with the natural Lie algebra action.

concepts.label: upper triangular solvable Lie algebra
concepts.description: Finite-dimensional complex Lie algebra consisting of upper triangular matrices with commutative derived subalgebra.

concepts.label: symmetric polynomials
concepts.description: Ring of polynomials invariant under permutations of variables; generated by elementary symmetric polynomials.

concepts.label: general linear Lie algebra
concepts.description: Complex Lie algebra gl(n) of all n×n matrices under commutator bracket.

concepts.label: conjugacy action
concepts.description: Group action on matrices defined by g·X = gXg^{-1} for g in GL(n) and X in the space of n×n matrices.

concepts.label: special linear Lie algebra
concepts.description: Complex Lie algebra sl(n) of n×n traceless matrices under commutator bracket; subalgebra of gl(n).

concepts.label: trace functions
concepts.description: Classical invariant polynomials Tr(X^k) and their products generating invariant rings under Lie algebra actions.

concepts.label: invariant ring
concepts.description: Ring of polynomials on a vector space invariant under a given group action, e.g. GL(n)-invariants under conjugacy.

concepts.label: finite-dimensional representation
concepts.description: Homomorphism from a Lie algebra to the endomorphism algebra of a finite-dimensional vector space.

concepts.label: elliptic fibration flatness
concepts.description: Condition that the total space of an elliptic fibration over a base is smooth and non-singular; imposes linear constraints on the auxiliary compactification polytope.

concepts.label: top (toric fiber)
concepts.description: A toric divisor in the base together with its ambient space defining the allowed sections and singularities of the elliptic fibration; encodes gauge algebra and splitting type.

concepts.label: Hopf algebra
concepts.description: An algebraic structure that is simultaneously a unital associative algebra and a counital coassociative coalgebra with compatible algebra and coalgebra structures.

concepts.label: bialgebra
concepts.description: An algebraic structure combining unital associative algebra and counital coassociative coalgebra structures that are compatible but lack the antipode map required of Hopf algebras.

concepts.label: algebra
concepts.description: A vector space equipped with a unital associative multiplication operation satisfying distributivity and associativity axioms.

concepts.label: coalgebra
concepts.description: A vector space equipped with a counit and comultiplication map dual to the algebra structure, satisfying coassociativity and counit axioms.

concepts.label: Hopf coreflection
concepts.description: A right adjoint functor from the category of bialgebras to the category of Hopf algebras, assigning to each bialgebra its universal Hopf algebra quotient.

concepts.label: cofree Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A right adjoint functor from the category of algebras to the category of Hopf algebras, assigning to each algebra a universal Hopf algebra with a surjective forgetful map.
aliases: free Hopf algebra on an algebra

concepts.label: embedding functor
concepts.description: A faithful injective functor from one category into another that preserves and reflects categorical structure.

concepts.label: forgetful functor
concepts.description: A functor that maps objects and morphisms to their underlying objects and morphisms in a less structured category by forgetting some structure.

concepts.label: right adjoint functor
concepts.description: A functor F: C → D such that for every object in D there exists a universal arrow from that object to F, establishing Hom_D(X, F(Y)) ≅ Hom_C(G(X), Y) for a left adjoint G.

concepts.label: category of Hopf algebras
concepts.description: The category whose objects are Hopf algebras and whose morphisms are Hopf algebra homomorphisms preserving all structure.

concepts.label: coequalizer
concepts.description: A categorical limit construction dual to the equalizer, defined as the colimit of a parallel pair of morphisms in a category.

concepts.label: coproduct
concepts.description: A categorical limit construction dual to the product, representing the disjoint union or free sum of objects in a category.

concepts.label: Sweedler problem
concepts.description: A forty-year-old open problem asking whether every bialgebra admits a Hopf algebra coreflection and whether every algebra admits a cofree Hopf algebra.

concepts.label: Landweber-Novikov algebra
concepts.description: A graded algebra of cobordism operations acting on complex cobordism, fundamental to algebraic topology and deformation theory.

concepts.label: algebraic deformation theory
concepts.description: The systematic study of infinitesimal perturbations of algebraic structures and their moduli spaces.

concepts.label: algebras over LN
concepts.description: Algebraic structures that carry an action or module structure over the Landweber-Novikov algebra.

concepts.label: cobordism operations
concepts.description: Characteristic classes and cohomology operations arising from complex cobordism theory.

concepts.label: deformation functor
concepts.description: A functor measuring the space of infinitesimal deformations of a mathematical object in a prescribed category.

concepts.label: formal moduli
concepts.description: The formal scheme parametrizing infinitesimal deformations of an object, typically studied via power series.

concepts.label: cohomology operations
concepts.description: Natural transformations between cohomology functors, including Steenrod and cobordism operations.

concepts.label: obstruction theory
concepts.description: A framework for identifying obstructions to lifting deformations to higher-order infinitesimal structures.

concepts.label: vanishing ideal
concepts.description: The ideal I(X) of all polynomials that vanish on an algebraic variety or subset X, characterizing its defining equations.

concepts.label: toric set
concepts.description: A subset of projective space parameterized by monomial functions arising from combinatorial structures such as clutters.

concepts.label: clutter
concepts.description: A hypergraph or combinatorial structure whose edges define the monomials in the parameterization of the toric set.

concepts.label: degree-complexity
concepts.description: A measure of the computational or algebraic complexity of a vanishing ideal, quantified by the degrees of its generators under a given term order.

concepts.label: revlex order
concepts.description: The reverse lexicographic term order on polynomial rings, used to measure complexity of ideal bases.

concepts.label: complete intersection property
concepts.description: A variety is a complete intersection if its vanishing ideal is generated by a minimal number of polynomials equal to the codimension.

concepts.label: uniform clutter
concepts.description: A clutter where all edges have the same cardinality, inducing a homogeneous monomial parameterization.

concepts.label: parameterized linear code
concepts.description: A linear code over a finite field K whose codewords are generated by evaluating monomials on the toric set X.

concepts.label: minimum distance
concepts.description: The smallest Hamming distance between distinct codewords in a linear code; determines error-correction capability.

concepts.label: algebraic invariants
concepts.description: Numerical or structural properties of the vanishing ideal such as dimension, depth, regularity, and multiplicity.

concepts.label: finite field
concepts.description: A field with finitely many elements, denoted K; the ground field over which the variety and codes are defined.

concepts.label: projective space
concepts.description: The projective variety P^n over K on which the toric set X is embedded.

concepts.label: left-symmetric algebra
concepts.description: A non-associative algebra satisfying the left-symmetry condition: (xy)z - x(yz) = (yx)z - y(xz), generalizing associative structures.

concepts.label: linear function
concepts.description: A vector space homomorphism or linear map used as a construction parameter for algebraic structures.

concepts.label: simple left-symmetric algebra
concepts.description: A left-symmetric algebra with no non-trivial two-sided ideals, representing a minimal structural building block.

concepts.label: classification
concepts.description: Complete enumeration and categorical organization of all left-symmetric algebras constructed from linear functions.

concepts.label: generalization
concepts.description: Extension of the theory of 2-dimensional left-symmetric algebras to higher-dimensional cases via linear function construction.

concepts.label: mathematical physics application
concepts.description: Concrete examples of left-symmetric algebras arising in physical theories and related mathematical structures.

concepts.label: non-associative algebra
concepts.description: An algebraic structure where the associativity axiom (xy)z = x(yz) does not necessarily hold.

concepts.label: crossed product
concepts.description: A construction combining two Hopf algebras A and H via coalgebra morphisms (action and cocycle) into a new Hopf algebra A #_f^⊳ H.

concepts.label: normal Hopf subalgebra
concepts.description: A Hopf subalgebra A of a Hopf algebra E satisfying normality conditions ensuring that E can be factorized with A and a quotient subcoalgebra.

concepts.label: coalgebra morphism
concepts.description: A linear map preserving coalgebra structure (comultiplication and counit), used to connect Hopf algebras in a crossed product construction.

concepts.label: Hopf factorization
concepts.description: Decomposition of a Hopf algebra E into a semidirect product of a normal Hopf subalgebra A and a subcoalgebra H.

concepts.label: Hopf integral
concepts.description: A linear functional on a Hopf algebra satisfying invariance properties, generalizing Haar integrals and central to representation theory.

concepts.label: coquasitriangular Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra equipped with a universal R-matrix in the coalgebra dual, inducing braid structures on comodule categories.

concepts.label: braided monoidal category
concepts.description: A monoidal category with a braiding (natural isomorphism satisfying hexagon axioms), encoding quantum symmetries and anyonic statistics.

concepts.label: Hopf comodule
concepts.description: A module over a Hopf algebra H equipped with a coaction compatible with the Hopf structure, dual to the module concept.

concepts.label: universal R-matrix
concepts.description: An invertible element in H ⊗ H inducing the braiding and coquasitriangular structure on a Hopf algebra.

concepts.label: cocycle
concepts.description: A coalgebra morphism f: H ⊗ H → A encoding the 'non-abelian' part of the action in a crossed product construction.

concepts.label: action morphism
concepts.description: A coalgebra morphism ⊳: H ⊗ A → A defining how H acts on A in the crossed product A #_f^⊳ H.

concepts.label: monoidal category of comodules
concepts.description: The category of H-comodules with tensor product and associativity induced by the Hopf algebra structure of H.

concepts.label: involutivity
concepts.description: Property requiring that a structure composed with itself twice yields the identity, studied for crossed products of Hopf algebras.

concepts.label: commutativity
concepts.description: Property that the commutative algebra structure is preserved in the crossed product construction.

concepts.label: dual Leibniz algebra
concepts.description: Algebraic structure dual to a Leibniz algebra, preserving skew-symmetry properties in the dual vector space.

concepts.label: Leibniz algebra morphism
concepts.description: Structure-preserving map between Leibniz algebras that respects the Leibniz bracket operation.

concepts.label: Leibniz bracket
concepts.description: Binary operation on a Leibniz algebra satisfying a right-symmetric generalization of the Jacobi identity.

concepts.label: skew-symmetry
concepts.description: Property of bilinear forms or operations where swapping arguments introduces a sign change.

concepts.label: vector space duality
concepts.description: Relationship between a vector space and its dual space of linear functionals.

concepts.label: algebraic structure
concepts.description: Set equipped with operations satisfying specified axioms and closure properties.

concepts.label: structure-preserving map
concepts.description: Function between algebraic structures that commutes with the defining operations.

concepts.label: three-index symmetric representation
concepts.description: The four-dimensional irreducible representation (4) of SU(2) corresponding to three symmetric tensor indices, realized at codimension-two loci.

concepts.label: codimension-two locus
concepts.description: A two-dimensional subspace in the F-theory base where the elliptic fibration develops enhanced singularities, localizing matter.

concepts.label: SU(2) gauge theory
concepts.description: Non-Abelian gauge theory with SU(2) symmetry; realized in F-theory via divisors in the base.

concepts.label: singular divisor
concepts.description: A divisor in the F-theory base that carries a gauge group and develops singularities at lower-dimensional loci where matter is localized.

concepts.label: unHiggsing
concepts.description: The inverse of Higgsing: starting from a model with Abelian U(1) symmetry and elevating it to a non-Abelian gauge group by breaking the U(1) gauge freedom.

concepts.label: arithmetic genus
concepts.description: A topological invariant of a curve or divisor that determines the genus contribution and number of zero modes (matter fermions) localized on it.

concepts.label: triple point singularity
concepts.description: A curve singularity where three branches meet, occurring at codimension-two loci in 6D F-theory; associated with higher-dimensional SU(2) representations.

concepts.label: Morrison-Park form
concepts.description: A generalized Weierstrass parametrization that accommodates arbitrary matter representations and gauge groups via systematic section assignments.

concepts.label: 6D F-theory
concepts.description: F-theory compactified on a base surface (plus elliptic fiber) yielding 6D N=1 supergravity with localized matter on curves.

concepts.label: Hopf algebra extension
concepts.description: An inclusion A ⊆ E of Hopf algebras where E contains A as a sub-Hopf algebra.

concepts.label: complement
concepts.description: A Hopf subalgebra H ⊆ E such that the multiplication map H ⊗ A → E is an isomorphism (factorization property).

concepts.label: Lie algebra extension
concepts.description: An inclusion A ⊆ E of Lie algebras where E contains A as a sub-Lie algebra.

concepts.label: complement classification problem
concepts.description: The problem of describing and classifying all complements H of A in a given extension A ⊆ E.

concepts.label: matched pair
concepts.description: A pair of actions (▷, ◁) between two algebras H and A satisfying compatibility conditions that enables factorization H ⋈ A.

concepts.label: cohomological obstruction
concepts.description: A cohomology group HA²(H, A | (▷, ◁)) classifying deformations and isomorphism classes of complements.

concepts.label: factorization index
concepts.description: A numerical invariant [E:A]ᶠ measuring the number of non-isomorphic complements of A in E.

concepts.label: deformation of complements
concepts.description: A continuous or algebraic transformation of one complement into another via parameter variation in the cohomological obstruction space.

concepts.label: group algebra
concepts.description: An associative algebra kG formed from a group G over a field k, with basis elements indexed by group elements.

concepts.label: roots of unity
concepts.description: Complex numbers ζ satisfying ζⁿ = 1 for some positive integer n; used to construct quantum group-like structures.

concepts.label: multiplication map
concepts.description: The linear map μ: H ⊗ A → E given by μ(h ⊗ a) = ha, used to define the factorization property.

concepts.label: toric vector bundle
concepts.description: Rank r torus equivariant vector bundle on a toric scheme, classified by piecewise linear maps from the fan to Bruhat-Tits buildings.

concepts.label: discrete valuation ring
concepts.description: A commutative ring with a discrete valuation, generalizing the notion of p-adic integers; used as base scheme for arithmetic geometry.

concepts.label: toric scheme
concepts.description: A scheme over a discrete valuation ring equipped with an action of an algebraic torus, generalizing toric varieties to arithmetic settings.

concepts.label: fan
concepts.description: A polyhedral decomposition of a cone encoding the combinatorial structure of a toric variety or scheme.

concepts.label: Bruhat-Tits building
concepts.description: A polyhedral cell complex parameterizing parahoric subgroups of a reductive group over a local field; generalizes the affine Weyl group.

concepts.label: piecewise linear map
concepts.description: A continuous map composed of linear pieces on polytopes or fans, used to encode toric vector bundle data.

concepts.label: Klyachko classification
concepts.description: Classification theorem for torus equivariant vector bundles on toric varieties over fields via piecewise linear maps to R^r.

concepts.label: Mumford classification
concepts.description: Classification of equivariant line bundles on toric schemes over discrete valuation rings by characters of the torus.

concepts.label: equivariant splitting
concepts.description: Decomposition of a torus equivariant vector bundle into a direct sum of equivariant line bundles, characterized by piecewise linearity conditions.

concepts.label: toric line bundle
concepts.description: Rank 1 torus equivariant vector bundle on a toric scheme, parameterized by characters of the algebraic torus.

concepts.label: arithmetic geometry of toric varieties
concepts.description: Study of toric varieties and bundles over arithmetic rings, extending classical toric geometry to non-algebraically-closed and non-field bases.

concepts.label: graded piecewise linear map
concepts.description: A piecewise linear map from a fan to a building equipped with additional grading structure encoding rank and equivariance data.

concepts.label: K3 surface
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface with trivial canonical bundle and vanishing first Betti number; fundamental geometric object in string compactifications.

concepts.label: toric degeneration
concepts.description: A family of varieties degenerating to a toric variety, preserving toric structure in the limit; used to simplify analysis of elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: generalized-Witt algebra
concepts.description: A Lie algebra generalizing the classical Witt algebra of derivations of polynomial rings, with Lie bialgebra structures.

concepts.label: Lie bialgebra
concepts.description: A Lie algebra equipped with a compatible coalgebra structure satisfying the Jacobi identity for the coproduct.

concepts.label: Jacobson-Witt algebra
concepts.description: A restricted Lie algebra in characteristic p, representing the Cartan type simple modular restricted Lie algebra of W type.

concepts.label: quantization
concepts.description: A deformation process converting a commutative or cocommutative algebraic structure into a noncommutative or noncocommutative Hopf algebra.

concepts.label: restricted universal enveloping algebra
concepts.description: The universal enveloping algebra of a restricted Lie algebra subject to p-th power restrictions in characteristic p.

concepts.label: modular reduction
concepts.description: A technique reducing algebraic structures from characteristic 0 to characteristic p via reduction modulo p.

concepts.label: p-restrictedness reduction
concepts.description: An algebraic reduction process imposing p-th power restriction relations on a Lie algebra in characteristic p.

concepts.label: p-polynomial deformation
concepts.description: A noncommutative deformation of an algebra parametrized by p-polynomial relations in characteristic p.

concepts.label: noncocommutative coalgebra
concepts.description: A coalgebra structure where the coproduct fails to be cocommutative, i.e., Δ ≠ τ∘Δ.

concepts.label: Cartan type Lie algebra
concepts.description: One of four families of simple restricted Lie algebras in characteristic p, including the W, S, H, and K types.

concepts.label: characteristic p algebra
concepts.description: An algebra over a field of positive prime characteristic p, subject to p-th power relations.

concepts.label: Hopf algebra dimension
concepts.description: The vector space dimension of a Hopf algebra, here p^{1+np^n} for quantized Jacobson-Witt algebras.

concepts.label: Y-algebra
concepts.description: A family of vertex algebras introduced by Gaiotto and Rapčák, classifying objects for W∞-algebras of type W(2,3,…,N).

concepts.label: W∞-algebra
concepts.description: Universal two-parameter vertex algebra serving as a classifying object for W-algebras of various types.

concepts.label: vertex algebra
concepts.description: Algebraic structure underlying conformal field theory, with fields satisfying locality and translation covariance axioms.

concepts.label: W-algebra
concepts.description: Extension of the Virasoro algebra generated by currents of higher conformal weights, including principal W-algebras of type A.

concepts.label: Virasoro algebra
concepts.description: Central extension of the Witt algebra; the unique 2D conformal symmetry algebra underlying all conformal field theories.

concepts.label: W₃-algebra
concepts.description: Extension of the Virasoro algebra generated by one additional primary field of conformal weight 3.

concepts.label: conformal weight
concepts.description: Scaling dimension of a field under conformal transformations; generators of weight 4 are minimal for Y-algebra orbifolds (generic case).

concepts.label: principal W-algebra
concepts.description: W-algebra obtained from quantum affine algebra at critical level; principal W-algebras of type A are special cases of Y-algebras.

concepts.label: Z₂ action
concepts.description: Automorphism of order 2 acting on Y-algebras; orbifold quotient under this action is the focus of the study.

concepts.label: finite generating set
concepts.description: Finite collection of fields whose algebra under operator product expansion generates the entire vertex algebra.

concepts.label: conformal field theory
concepts.description: Quantum field theory with conformal symmetry; vertex algebras provide the algebraic foundation.

concepts.label: ALE space
concepts.description: Asymptotically locally Euclidean space with isolated singularities classified by ADE Dynkin diagrams; quotient of ℂ² by finite subgroup of SU(2).

concepts.label: outer-automorphism group
concepts.description: Symmetry group acting on the Dynkin diagram of a Lie algebra; controls possible realizations of affine and non simply laced extensions.

concepts.label: type II superstring
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional supersymmetric string theory with two copies of N=1 supersymmetry; includes type IIA and type IIB variants with different GSO projections.

concepts.label: geometric engineering
concepts.description: Method of deriving supersymmetric quantum field theories from string/F-theory compactifications on singular Calabi-Yau geometries; gauge groups from singularity types.

concepts.label: affine singularity
concepts.description: Extension of ordinary ADE singularities to affine (toroidal) cases denoted Â, D̂, Ê; related to affine Dynkin diagrams and affine Lie algebras.

concepts.label: polyvalent toric geometry
concepts.description: Generalization of bivalent and trivalent toric geometries enabling construction of solutions for complex affine singularities like Ĝ-type.

concepts.label: N=1 supersymmetry
concepts.description: Eight-dimensional supersymmetric gauge theory with one copy of supersymmetry generators; obtained from geometric engineering on CY manifolds.

concepts.label: connected Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra H over a field where the counit ε satisfies ker(ε) being nilpotent, making H a connected algebra in the sense of having a unique simple comodule.

concepts.label: graded Hopf algebra
concepts.description: The associated graded algebra gr(H) obtained from the coradical filtration of a Hopf algebra, preserving Hopf algebra structure.

concepts.label: finite-dimensional Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra H with finite vector space dimension over a ground field.

concepts.label: coradical filtration
concepts.description: A natural filtration on a coalgebra defined inductively by the coradical and used to construct the associated graded object.

concepts.label: Hochschild cohomology
concepts.description: Ext-group cohomology theory for algebras measuring deformations and obstructions to extensions; for coalgebras, computed with trivial bicomodule coefficients.

concepts.label: trivial H-bicomodule
concepts.description: A bicomodule where the coactions are the counit map ε, used as a coefficient object in cohomology theories.

concepts.label: cocommutative Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra where the comultiplication is commutative; dually dual to commutative Hopf algebras.

concepts.label: Hopf subalgebra
concepts.description: A subalgebra K ⊂ H that is also a Hopf algebra under the inherited Hopf structure, closed under multiplication and comultiplication.

concepts.label: dimension p²
concepts.description: Vector space dimension equal to p², where p is the characteristic of the ground field.

concepts.label: algebra structure
concepts.description: The multiplicative structure of a Hopf algebra, including unit and product maps.

concepts.label: coalgebra structure
concepts.description: The dual structure of a Hopf algebra consisting of comultiplication and counit satisfying coassociativity and counitality.

concepts.label: Rees algebra
concepts.description: The graded algebra R[It] = ⊕_{i≥0} I^i t^i constructed from an ideal I, encoding the symbolic and ordinary powers of I.

concepts.label: max-flow min-cut property
concepts.description: A combinatorial property of clutters stating that maximum flow equals minimum cut; equivalent to certain integrality conditions on polyhedra.

concepts.label: edge ideal
concepts.description: The monomial ideal I(C) generated by products of variables corresponding to edges of a clutter C.

concepts.label: symbolic power
concepts.description: The ith symbolic power I^(i) of an ideal I, consisting of elements vanishing to order i on all associated primes of I.

concepts.label: normally torsion free
concepts.description: An ideal I satisfying I^i = I^(i) for all i ≥ 1, meaning ordinary and symbolic powers coincide.

concepts.label: normality of Rees algebras
concepts.description: The property that the Rees algebra R[It] is integrally closed in its field of fractions.

concepts.label: irreducible representation
concepts.description: A faithful representation of an algebraic structure (here, Rees cones) that cannot be decomposed into smaller representations.

concepts.label: Rees cone
concepts.description: The cone generated by monomials of the form x_e t (for edges e) in the weighted monoid associated to a clutter.

concepts.label: integrality of polyhedra
concepts.description: The property that the vertices of a rational polyhedron are lattice points, ensuring integer solutions to linear programming problems.

concepts.label: combinatorial optimization
concepts.description: The field of selecting optimal solutions from a finite set using discrete variables and combinatorial structures.

concepts.label: commutative algebra
concepts.description: The study of commutative rings, ideals, modules, and homological properties including normalization and integral closure.

concepts.label: Normaliz
concepts.description: A computational tool for determining normality of monoids and Rees algebras and for solving polyhedron problems.

concepts.label: Yetter-Drinfeld Hopf algebra
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra R in the braided monoidal category ᵏᴳ_ᵏᴳ𝒴𝒟 of Yetter-Drinfeld modules over kG, with compatible module and comodule structures.

concepts.label: Schubert calculus
concepts.description: Intersection theory on flag manifolds using Schubert varieties; computes cohomology rings via intersection products.

concepts.label: Coxeter group
concepts.description: A finite group generated by reflections with presentation determined by a root system and Coxeter matrix.

concepts.label: Coinvariant algebra
concepts.description: The quotient of the polynomial ring by the ideal generated by symmetric polynomials of positive degree, isomorphic to the cohomology of the flag manifold.

concepts.label: Flag manifold
concepts.description: A homogeneous space G/B parametrising chains of subspaces; its cohomology ring is generated by Schubert classes.

concepts.label: Braided differential calculus
concepts.description: A framework for exterior differentiation and de Rham cohomology on quantum spaces using braided tensor categories.

concepts.label: Fomin-Kirillov algebra
concepts.description: A quadratic algebra generated by elements parametrised by root system with specific quadratic relations, related to Schubert calculus.

concepts.label: Kirillov-Maeno bracket algebra
concepts.description: A Poisson algebra structure on symmetric functions generated by Kirillov-Maeno brackets, encoding Schubert varieties.

concepts.label: Commutative subalgebra
concepts.description: A subalgebra all of whose elements pairwise commute; the cohomology ring is realised as such within the Nichols algebra.

concepts.label: Tate form
concepts.description: Generalized algebraic model for elliptic fibrations with additional monomials, extending the Weierstrass form to handle singularities and tunings more flexibly.

concepts.label: non-Higgsable cluster
concepts.description: A collection of irreducible gauge groups and matter representations localized on curves in the F-theory base that cannot be broken (Higgsed) away without creating a singularity in the CY threefold.

concepts.label: 6D supergravity
concepts.description: Six-dimensional consistent supergravity theory arising as the low-energy effective theory of F-theory on a base surface; constrained by anomaly cancellation conditions.

concepts.label: tuning algorithm
concepts.description: Systematic procedure for enumerating all admissible tunings of Weierstrass coefficients on a fixed base, enabling finite classification of elliptic CY threefolds and F-theory models.

concepts.label: dimension p²q²
concepts.description: The vector space dimension of a Hopf algebra equal to the product of two prime squares, where p and q are distinct primes with p⁴ < q.

concepts.label: dual Hopf algebra
concepts.description: The linear dual (kG)* of a group algebra, carrying the dual Hopf algebra structure induced by duality.

concepts.label: Radford biproduct
concepts.description: A Hopf algebra construction R#kG combining a Yetter-Drinfeld Hopf algebra R and a group algebra kG via semidirect product.

concepts.label: prime dimension factorization
concepts.description: Classification of semisimple Hopf algebras by expressing dimension as a product of prime powers with specified ordering constraints.

concepts.label: algebraically closed field
concepts.description: A field k of characteristic 0 in which every non-constant polynomial has a root, enabling complete Hopf algebra decomposition.

concepts.label: simple module decomposition
concepts.description: The decomposition of a Hopf algebra into irreducible representations, used to characterize semisimplicity.

concepts.label: rooted trees
concepts.description: Directed acyclic graphs with a distinguished root vertex and a unique path from root to any other vertex, used as a basis for combinatorial algebraic structures.

concepts.label: doubling space
concepts.description: A vector space constructed by adjoining a copy of the original space, used to extend algebraic structures to larger dimensional settings.

concepts.label: enveloping algebra
concepts.description: The universal associative algebra generated by a non-associative algebra, providing an embedding of the original structure into an associative setting.

concepts.label: module-bialgebra
concepts.description: An algebraic structure that is simultaneously a module over one algebra and a bialgebra, with compatible module and bialgebra operations.

concepts.label: left-symmetry
concepts.description: The axiom (x ⊢ y) ⊢ z - x ⊢ (y ⊢ z) = (y ⊢ x) ⊢ z - y ⊢ (x ⊢ z) characterizing pre-Lie algebras.

concepts.label: tree basis
concepts.description: A basis for algebraic structures indexed by rooted trees, where tree operations correspond to grafting and combinatorial compositions.

concepts.label: Toric hypersurface fibration
concepts.description: Genus-one fibration whose fibers are hypersurfaces in toric varieties associated to reflexive 2D polyhedra.

concepts.label: Extremal transition
concepts.description: Continuous geometric transition between CY manifolds induced by blow-ups or blow-downs in the base, corresponding to Higgsing in the effective theory.

concepts.label: Jacobian fibration
concepts.description: Associated elliptic curve fibration whose rational sections correspond to additional abelian gauge factors beyond the generic Mordell-Weil group.

concepts.label: Wilson lines
concepts.description: Non-trivial holonomy elements along non-contractible loops in the compactification manifold that break gauge symmetries and generate Standard Model-like spectra.

concepts.label: Chern-Simons invariant
concepts.description: Topological invariant measuring the curvature-induced phase of a connection on a Lagrangian submanifold; source of H-flux in heterotic compactifications.

concepts.label: H-flux
concepts.description: Heterotic string theory flux coupled to the Kalb-Ramond field B; generated by Chern-Simons terms from Wilson lines and affects moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: Worldsheet theory
concepts.description: Two-dimensional conformal field theory living on the string worldsheet; consistency constrains the 10D spacetime target geometry and backgrounds.

concepts.label: so(7,3) subalgebra
concepts.description: A subalgebra of E8 with signature (7,3) that is shown to fully contain the Standard Model gauge group and associated structure.

concepts.label: Dirac spinor
concepts.description: Four-component spinor solution to the Dirac equation; reinterpretation in the E8 framework connects fermions to spacetime geometry and quantum gravity.

concepts.label: Mixing angle
concepts.description: Parameter governing flavor mixing in the Standard Model (e.g., CKM, PMNS matrices); shown to depend on fermion masses in the E8 embedding.

concepts.label: Quantum gravity coupling
concepts.description: Interaction between gravitational degrees of freedom and quantum field theory, reinterpreted in the E8 model as geometric structure of spacetime.

concepts.label: noncommutative torus
concepts.description: A noncommutative geometry where spatial coordinates satisfy [x_μ, x_ν] = iθ_μν, parametrized by a deformation matrix θ.

concepts.label: gauge field
concepts.description: A connection one-form A_μ on a principal bundle encoding the local symmetry of a gauge theory.

concepts.label: vanishing curvature
concepts.description: The condition F_μν = ∂_μA_ν − ∂_νA_μ + [A_μ,A_ν] = 0, characterizing flat gauge fields.

concepts.label: Seiberg-Witten map
concepts.description: A field redefinition relating noncommutative gauge theory to ordinary (commutative) gauge theory by absorbing the noncommutativity parameter θ into field redefinitions.

concepts.label: deformation parameter
concepts.description: The noncommutativity matrix θ_μν controlling the strength and tensor structure of coordinate noncommutativity.

concepts.label: gauge invariance
concepts.description: Invariance of physical observables under local gauge transformations g(x) acting on fields.

concepts.label: flat gauge theory
concepts.description: A gauge theory where the field strength vanishes identically, leaving only topological and global information.

concepts.label: noncommutative geometry
concepts.description: A generalization of geometry where spacetime coordinates are noncommuting operators, modifying the algebra of observables.

concepts.label: Berglund-Hubsch type
concepts.description: Special subclass of Calabi-Yau manifolds defined by hypersurfaces in weighted projective spaces with abelian quotient symmetries.

concepts.label: Batyrev-Borisov approach
concepts.description: Combinatorial construction of CY manifolds and their mirrors using reflexive polytopes and toric geometry.

concepts.label: N=2 SCFT
concepts.description: Two-dimensional superconformal field theory with N=2 supersymmetry and central charge c=9 used to compactify heterotic dimensions.

concepts.label: Gepner model
concepts.description: Exactly solvable heterotic string model constructed as products of N=2 minimal models with total central charge c=9.

concepts.label: Vertex operator
concepts.description: Quantum field operator in conformal field theory whose correlators define physical amplitudes and states.

concepts.label: Borisov differential
concepts.description: Cohomological differential in toric geometry determined by points of reflexive Batyrev polyhedra, used to extract physical state cohomology.

concepts.label: E(6) representation
concepts.description: Irreducible representation of the E(6) gauge algebra, including 27-plet and anti-27-plet matter multiplets.

concepts.label: vacuum fermionic current
concepts.description: The expectation value of the current density operator for a charged fermionic field in quantum field theory, computed in the vacuum state.

concepts.label: AdS/CFT braneworld
concepts.description: A five-dimensional anti-de Sitter spacetime with a four-dimensional brane embedded parallel to the boundary, used to model extra-dimensional scenarios.

concepts.label: cosmic string
concepts.description: A topological defect carrying magnetic flux, extended along one spatial dimension in the bulk geometry.

concepts.label: boundary condition on brane
concepts.description: Constraints imposed on fermionic fields at the brane surface, determining how field configurations behave across the brane.

concepts.label: MIT bag boundary condition
concepts.description: A boundary condition confining quarks inside a bag by imposing constraint equations at the surface; applied here to fermionic fields on the brane.

concepts.label: Z2-symmetric braneworld
concepts.description: A braneworld model with discrete reflection symmetry about the brane, used in Randall-Sundrum type scenarios.

concepts.label: brane-free contribution
concepts.description: The component of the vacuum current density that arises from the AdS-bulk geometry without influence from the brane.

concepts.label: brane-induced contribution
concepts.description: The component of the vacuum current density that originates from the presence and boundary conditions of the brane.

concepts.label: current density decay
concepts.description: The asymptotic behavior of the current magnitude as a function of distance from the string or boundary.

concepts.label: power-law decay
concepts.description: Asymptotic behavior where current density falls off as a negative power of distance, characteristic of AdS geometry.

concepts.label: exponential decay
concepts.description: Asymptotic behavior where current density falls off exponentially with distance, characteristic of regions near the AdS boundary.

concepts.label: C and P symmetry
concepts.description: Charge-conjugation and parity-reflection discrete symmetries characterizing symmetric fermionic field models.

concepts.label: Randall-Sundrum model
concepts.description: A braneworld scenario with warped extra dimension where a single brane separates different regions of AdS bulk.

concepts.label: AdS horizon
concepts.description: The boundary in AdS spacetime at infinite proper distance, corresponding to the IR limit of the geometry.

concepts.label: cosmological constant
concepts.description: The energy density of the vacuum; observed to be small and positive, driving cosmic acceleration.

concepts.label: vacuum selection
concepts.description: The problem of determining which vacuum state among the landscape is realized in our universe.

concepts.label: anthropic reasoning
concepts.description: Selection principle based on the constraint that the observed universe must be compatible with the existence of observers.

concepts.label: multiverse wavefunction
concepts.description: Quantum wavefunction encoding the probability amplitudes for different vacuum configurations across the multiverse.

concepts.label: eternal inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary mechanism that never fully terminates, continuously spawning new bubble universes with different vacua.

concepts.label: initial conditions
concepts.description: The quantum state or configuration of the universe at early times that seeds its subsequent evolution.

concepts.label: critical equilibrium state
concepts.description: A reference state in noncritical string theory at which the cosmological constant is zero or at special value.

concepts.label: noncritical string theory
concepts.description: String theory formulation where the theory is not restricted to critical dimension, allowing variable CC as deviations from equilibrium.

concepts.label: vacuum probability
concepts.description: The relative likelihood of finding the universe in a particular vacuum state, derived from the multiverse wavefunction.

concepts.label: Running Vacuum Model
concepts.description: Effective gravitational field theory with dynamical dark energy characterized by H²- and H⁴-dependent terms, derived from critical string theory with gravitational anomalies.

concepts.label: vacuumon potential
concepts.description: Classical scalar field potential characterizing the inflationary phase of the RVM, satisfying certain Swampland criteria under specific parameter regimes.

concepts.label: Swampland criteria
concepts.description: Consistency constraints on effective field theories derived from quantum gravity and string theory that must be satisfied for a theory to have a UV completion in string theory.

concepts.label: gravitational anomalies
concepts.description: Quantum anomalies in the gravitational sector of critical string theory that induce primordial gravitational wave condensation and H⁴ terms in the RVM effective action.

concepts.label: primordial gravitational waves
concepts.description: Quantum gravitational excitations condensing in the early universe, generating the H⁴-dependent dynamics of the Running Vacuum Model.

concepts.label: slow-roll inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary paradigm requiring small potential gradient and curvature, typically parametrized by ε ≪ 1 and η ≪ 1.

concepts.label: de Sitter phase
concepts.description: Quasi-exponential expansion epoch with approximately constant Hubble parameter H, characterized by Gibbons-Hawking entropy.

concepts.label: Gibbons-Hawking entropy
concepts.description: Thermodynamic entropy of de Sitter space proportional to the horizon area, used to characterize the RVM during quasi-exponential expansion.

concepts.label: Kalb-Ramond axion
concepts.description: Pseudoscalar field from string theory compactification that naturally satisfies slow-roll conditions in the stringy RVM formulation.

concepts.label: string theory compactification
concepts.description: Mechanism to reduce extra spatial dimensions of string theory to produce four-dimensional effective field theories via compact manifold geometries.

concepts.label: quantum field theory consistency
concepts.description: Set of requirements for a field theory to admit a consistent ultraviolet completion and quantum interpretation, including Swampland constraints.

concepts.label: string theory landscape
concepts.description: The vast space of possible string theory vacua arising from different compactification geometries, flux choices, and moduli stabilization schemes.

concepts.label: tensor mode fraction
concepts.description: The ratio of tensor to total primordial gravitational wave power in inflationary perturbations, denoted r.

concepts.label: quantum tunneling
concepts.description: Quantum mechanical transition between metastable vacuum states, enabling transitions across the landscape.

concepts.label: large-field inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary mechanism where the inflaton field traverses trans-Planckian distances, generically producing observable tensor modes.

concepts.label: warped Calabi-Yau
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau manifold with a warped metric structure arising from localized fluxes, used to construct realistic string compactifications.

concepts.label: flux compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of extra dimensions on a Calabi-Yau manifold threaded by background fluxes, stabilizing moduli.

concepts.label: measure problem
concepts.description: The ambiguity in defining a probability distribution over string theory vacua due to infinite volume and eternal inflation.

concepts.label: inflationary mechanism
concepts.description: A specific dynamical realization of inflation within string theory, characterized by the field content and potential structure.

concepts.label: frequency distribution
concepts.description: The relative abundance or number count of inflationary mechanisms populating the string landscape.

concepts.label: dose-response relationship
concepts.description: Functional relationship between administered drug dose and observed pharmacological or clinical effect.

concepts.label: Phase II trial
concepts.description: Clinical study phase focused on characterizing dose-response relationships and preliminary efficacy of a new drug candidate.

concepts.label: model selection
concepts.description: Statistical procedure for choosing a single best-fitting dose-response model from a candidate set based on optimality criteria.

concepts.label: model averaging
