concepts.description: Measurable quantities characterizing neutrino physics: masses, mixing angles, CP phases, and oscillation parameters.

concepts.label: Wigner-Eckart theorem
concepts.description: Mathematical framework relating matrix elements of operators to Clebsch-Gordan coefficients under irreducible representations of a symmetry group.

concepts.label: Goldstone bosons
concepts.description: Massless excitations arising from spontaneously broken continuous symmetries; one for each broken generator.

concepts.label: Ward identities
concepts.description: Constraints on matrix elements and Green's functions arising from continuous symmetries, relating processes that differ by Goldstone-boson emission.

concepts.label: tadpole term
concepts.description: One-point correlation function (amplitude with single external state) proportional to order parameter, vanishing in unbroken phase.

concepts.label: pseudo-Goldstone bosons
concepts.description: Nearly-massless bosons arising from approximate (explicitly broken) continuous symmetries, with mass parametrized by explicit breaking strength.

concepts.label: explicit symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Symmetry-violating term in the Hamiltonian added by hand, as opposed to breaking by the vacuum state itself.

concepts.label: irreducible representations
concepts.description: Irreducible components of group representations; operators transform as specific irreps under group G.

concepts.label: matrix elements
concepts.description: Coefficients ⟨ψ'|O|ψ⟩ of operators O between quantum states, the primary objects constrained by selection rules and WE relations.

concepts.label: infinitely-extended systems
concepts.description: Systems with translational or other continuous spatial symmetries; allows spontaneous symmetry breaking absent in finite systems.

concepts.label: order parameter
concepts.description: Ground-state expectation value that vanishes in the unbroken phase and is nonzero in the broken phase; measures SSB strength.

concepts.label: Dirac neutrinos
concepts.description: Massive neutrinos arising from Yukawa coupling to right-handed neutrinos in B-L gauge theories, as opposed to Majorana mass terms.

concepts.label: Stueckelberg mass
concepts.description: Mass parameter Mz' for the Z' gauge boson mediating the B-L interaction; sets the characteristic scale of the new force.

concepts.label: gauge coupling strength
concepts.description: Coupling constant g' parameterizing the strength of the B-L gauge interaction.

concepts.label: resonant enhancement
concepts.description: Amplification of reaction cross-section when an intermediate resonance (Z') matches the center-of-mass energy.

concepts.label: collider bounds
concepts.description: Experimental constraints on new particle masses and couplings derived from high-energy particle collision data.

concepts.label: astrophysical constraints
concepts.description: Bounds on new physics parameters inferred from stellar evolution, neutron star cooling, and cosmological observations.

concepts.label: Z' boson
concepts.description: Neutral gauge boson mediating the new B-L interaction; a heavy or light vector boson beyond the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Dirac neutrino
concepts.description: A neutrino scenario in which neutrinos are distinct from their antiparticles and acquire mass via Yukawa coupling to a Higgs field.

concepts.label: muon decay
concepts.description: Leptonic decay process; lepton-number-violating modes such as μ→e and μ→eγ constrain neutrino physics models.

concepts.label: effective neutrino number
concepts.description: A measure of the number of light relativistic degrees of freedom in the early universe, constrained by cosmological observations (BBN, CMB).

concepts.label: cosmological constraints
concepts.description: Observational bounds from big-bang nucleosynthesis, CMB, and large-scale structure that limit the properties of light relics and neutrinos.

concepts.label: tree-level mass generation
concepts.description: Neutrino mass arising directly from renormalizable interactions at tree order, without loop suppression.

concepts.label: quantum mass generation
concepts.description: Neutrino mass arising from loop processes (radiative corrections); results in naturally suppressed mass scales.

concepts.label: multiple point principle
concepts.description: Principle requiring that scalar couplings and their beta functions vanish simultaneously at a critical energy scale, determining model parameters uniquely.

concepts.label: renormalization group equations
concepts.description: Differential equations describing the energy-scale dependence of coupling constants in quantum field theory, computed at two-loop order in this work.

concepts.label: B-L symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Radiative breaking of the B-L gauge symmetry at high energy scales, driven by the renormalization group evolution of scalar couplings.

concepts.label: scalar singlet field
concepts.description: A complex scalar field Ψ transforming as a singlet under the Standard Model gauge group but charged under U(1)_{B-L}, introduced to break B-L symmetry.

concepts.label: classical conformality
concepts.description: Property of a field theory where the classical action is invariant under scale transformations, relating to vanishing beta functions at tree level.

concepts.label: inflaton field
concepts.description: Scalar field whose dynamics drive cosmic inflation in the early universe; proposed to be identified with the B-L singlet Ψ in this scenario.

concepts.label: non-minimal gravitational coupling
concepts.description: Coupling between a scalar field and the Ricci scalar ξΨ²ℜ, modifying the field's kinetic structure and affecting inflationary dynamics.

concepts.label: quartic inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary scenario driven by a λΨ⁴ scalar potential with non-minimal coupling to gravity, realizing chaotic inflation-like dynamics.

concepts.label: two-loop beta functions
concepts.description: Second-order quantum corrections to the running of coupling constants, enabling precise prediction of symmetry breaking scales and parameter determination.

concepts.label: Majorana mass
concepts.description: Mass term for neutrinos arising from charge-conjugation-invariant coupling; generated radiatively in this model through symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Radiative neutrino mass
concepts.description: Neutrino mass generated at loop level rather than tree level, typically suppressed and linked to new physics at higher scales.

concepts.label: Inert scalar condition
concepts.description: Theoretical constraint ensuring certain scalar fields carry no vacuum expectation value and do not couple to fermions, stabilizing the model.

concepts.label: Loop-level quantum correction
concepts.description: One-loop or higher-order effects in quantum field theory that generate effective potentials and induce symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: GUT models
concepts.description: Grand Unified Theories such as SO(10) unifying strong, weak, and electromagnetic interactions at high scales; predict intermediate-scale symmetry breaking and B-L strings.

concepts.label: light neutrino masses
concepts.description: Masses of electron, muon, and tau neutrinos; generated at loop level through the see-saw mechanism coupling to heavy Majorana sector.

concepts.label: neutrino mass hierarchy
concepts.description: Pattern of light neutrino masses inferred from atmospheric and solar neutrino oscillation measurements; constrains heavy neutrino sector through see-saw mechanism.

concepts.label: closed loop cosmic strings
concepts.description: Isolated segments of cosmic string that decay or self-interact; act as non-thermal sources of heavy particles and radiation in early universe.

concepts.label: VEV suppression
concepts.description: Mechanism by which proton decay amplitudes are suppressed by the ratio of an intermediate Higgs vacuum expectation value to the GUT scale.

concepts.label: tan β
concepts.description: The ratio of Higgs doublet vacuum expectation values in supersymmetric theories; a key parameter constraining the electroweak sector.

concepts.label: GUT breaking representation
concepts.description: Higgs multiplets (like 45 and 54 in SO(10)) that break the grand unified gauge group down to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Metastable string state
concepts.description: A long-lived but unstable superstring configuration that decays through interactions with compactified dimensions.

concepts.label: Dimensional compactification
concepts.description: Mechanism for reducing spacetime dimensionality by curling extra dimensions into compact manifolds, essential for matching string theory to 4D physics.

concepts.label: Uncompactified limit
concepts.description: Limiting case where compactification radii approach infinity, recovering flat 10D spacetime behavior.

concepts.label: Compactification radius
concepts.description: Geometric parameter determining the size of extra dimensions; controls transition between compactified and uncompactified regimes.

concepts.label: Massless radiation
concepts.description: Emission of zero-mass degrees of freedom (photons, gravitons) as primary decay channel for strings in uncompactified space.

concepts.label: String wrapping
concepts.description: Configuration of a string wound around compact dimensions, affecting its mass spectrum and decay properties.

concepts.label: diffeomorphism symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry of general relativity under arbitrary smooth coordinate transformations; fundamental to covariant formulation of gravity.

concepts.label: local Lorentz symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge symmetry of local inertial frames in spacetime; fundamental structure of special relativity and teleparallel gravity.

concepts.label: metric fluctuations
concepts.description: Small perturbations around flat or background spacetime metric; quantize graviton degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: conservation laws
concepts.description: Mathematical constraints arising from continuous symmetries (Noether theorem); encode physical restrictions on allowed interactions.

concepts.label: two-tensor coupling
concepts.description: Interaction term between a rank-2 tensor field (e.g., scalar or vector boson) and spacetime metric or gravitational degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: cubic interaction terms
concepts.description: Third-order coupling vertices in action expansion; subdominant to quadratic terms but necessary for phenomenology.

concepts.label: flat background
concepts.description: Minkowski spacetime metric η_μν with zero curvature; reference vacuum around which perturbative expansion is constructed.

concepts.label: decoupling condition
concepts.description: Requirement that independent degrees of freedom can be treated separately in action; fails when symmetry mixes sectors.

concepts.label: quadratic action
concepts.description: Lagrangian density involving only field bilinears; defines free-field theory and mass spectrum without interactions.

concepts.label: spacetime symmetry breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of diffeomorphism or Lorentz gauge symmetry with dynamical metric/tensor order parameter; distinct from internal symmetry breaking.

concepts.label: phenomenological calculations
concepts.description: Derivation of predictions and observables from theoretical action; connects to experimental signatures and constraints.

concepts.label: E_6 inspired extra U(1)
concepts.description: Extension of the Standard Model gauge group with an additional U(1) symmetry motivated by grand unified E_6 theory; provides mechanisms for proton protection.

concepts.label: decay width suppression
concepts.description: Reduction in the rate of a particle decay process through cancellation between amplitudes or contributions from different topologies.

concepts.label: flavor mixing
concepts.description: The process by which weak eigenstates mix with mass eigenstates, parameterized by the CKM and PMNS matrices in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: Kähler moduli
concepts.description: Scalar fields parametrizing the size and shape of the Kähler cone of a Calabi-Yau manifold; counted by Hodge number h¹¹.

concepts.label: thermal effective potential
concepts.description: The one-loop effective potential arising from the thermal bath at finite temperature in a compactified string theory, which lifts moduli fields.

concepts.label: finite temperature
concepts.description: Implementation of thermal effects in string compactifications via a free action on the Euclidean time circle, generating a thermal bath at temperature T.

concepts.label: gauge theory engineering
concepts.description: The geometric realization of four-dimensional gauge theories from singularities in the internal Calabi-Yau geometry, where gauge algebras arise from enhanced structures at singular loci.

concepts.label: gauged supergravity
concepts.description: Effective low-energy theory of type II string compactifications on Calabi-Yau threefolds, featuring local supersymmetry and gauge interactions.

concepts.label: axio-dilaton
concepts.description: The modular-invariant combination of the heterotic dilaton and axion that parametrizes the string coupling and CP-violating theta angle in the dual heterotic frame.

concepts.label: framed logarithmic connection
concepts.description: A logarithmic connection on a vector bundle over a Riemann surface with designated framing data at specified poles.

concepts.label: framed parabolic connection
concepts.description: A parabolic connection on a Riemann surface with additional framing structure specifying behavior at parabolic points.

concepts.label: Riemann surface
concepts.description: A one-dimensional complex analytic manifold serving as the base space for bundles and connections.

concepts.label: transcendence degree
concepts.description: The size of a maximal algebraically independent subset of the function field of a variety.

concepts.label: regular functions algebra
concepts.description: The ring of holomorphic functions on an algebraic variety or complex analytic space.

concepts.label: parabolic point
concepts.description: A marked point on a curve where a parabolic bundle carries additional weights or flag structure.

concepts.label: gauge equivalence
concepts.description: Equivalence relation on connections induced by bundle automorphisms.

concepts.label: cubic surface
concepts.description: A smooth projective surface defined by a homogeneous polynomial of degree 3 in four variables; a fundamental object in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: cone of effective divisors
concepts.description: The convex cone generated by effective divisor classes on a variety, capturing all non-negative linear combinations of effective divisors.

concepts.label: line on cubic
concepts.description: A rational curve (projective line ℙ¹) contained in a cubic surface; a key geometric invariant affecting the surface's classification.

concepts.label: marked cubic surface
concepts.description: A cubic surface equipped with a distinguished line, parametrized by a finer moduli space than unmarked cubics.

concepts.label: Picard group
concepts.description: The group of divisor classes on a variety, isomorphic to the group of line bundles under tensor product.

concepts.label: moduli space of binary quintics
concepts.description: Parameter space classifying equivalence classes of degree-5 binary polynomials up to projective transformation.

concepts.label: real binary quintics
concepts.description: Degree-5 homogeneous polynomials in two variables with real coefficients.

concepts.label: smooth real binary quintics
concepts.description: Real quintic polynomials with distinct roots, corresponding to smooth points in the moduli stack.

concepts.label: stable real binary quintics
concepts.description: Real quintic polynomials admitting a semistable limit under geometric invariant theory, including singular forms.

concepts.label: real hyperbolic plane
concepts.description: Two-dimensional Riemannian manifold of constant negative curvature -1; upper half-plane model with metric ds² = (dx² + dy²)/y².

concepts.label: arithmetic quotient
concepts.description: Quotient of a symmetric space by an arithmetic lattice or arithmetic group, often an orbifold.

concepts.label: non-arithmetic triangle group
concepts.description: Triangle group not commensurable with a lattice in PSL(2,ℝ); generated by reflections with angles π/3, π/5, π/10.

concepts.label: five points on the line
concepts.description: Configuration of five collinear points in projective space ℙ¹, dual to the space of binary quintics via evaluation.

concepts.label: complete hyperbolic orbifold structure
concepts.description: Riemannian orbifold structure with constant negative curvature extending smoothly across singular locus.

concepts.label: connected component
concepts.description: Maximal connected subset of a topological space; determined by real discriminant sign for quintics.

concepts.label: induced metric
concepts.description: Riemannian metric on a subspace or quotient inherited from an ambient space or universal cover.

concepts.label: projective equivalence
concepts.description: Equivalence of binary forms under the action of PGL(2), identifying proportional polynomials and coordinate changes.

concepts.label: GIT quotient
concepts.description: Geometric Invariant Theory quotient providing a scheme-theoretic construction of moduli spaces via invariant ring theory and stability conditions.

concepts.label: stability condition
concepts.description: Criterion determining which points in a GIT action are semistable or stable, enabling quotient construction.

concepts.label: Kodaira fiber
concepts.description: Classification of singular fibers in elliptic fibrations determined by monodromy and intersection matrix.

concepts.label: heterotic orbifold construction
concepts.description: String theory compactification using E₈ × E₈ heterotic string on orbifold geometries to derive low-energy effective field theories.

concepts.label: MSSM spectrum
concepts.description: Low-energy particle spectrum of the Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model with superpartners and gauge content mirroring the SM.

concepts.label: supergravity effects
concepts.description: Gravitational contributions to the effective potential and field equations arising from the full supergravity framework.

concepts.label: low-energy effective field theory
concepts.description: Four-dimensional field theory obtained by integrating out heavy string modes and compactified dimensions.

concepts.label: E8 x E8 heterotic string
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional heterotic string theory with gauge group E₈ × E₈, compactified to four dimensions.

concepts.label: constant scalar curvature Kähler metric
concepts.description: A Kähler metric on an algebraic variety whose scalar curvature is constant everywhere; existence is a central problem in Kähler geometry.

concepts.label: foldable surface
concepts.description: A smooth toric surface whose lattice automorphism group contains a non-trivial cyclic subgroup.

concepts.label: moduli space of cscK surfaces
concepts.description: The parameter space of all constant scalar curvature Kähler surfaces with fixed polarization, studied locally around toric points.

concepts.label: cyclic subgroup
concepts.description: A subgroup generated by a single element, characterizing toric automorphisms of finite order.

concepts.label: terminal singularities
concepts.description: Singularities appearing in the minimal model program, characterized by high discrepancy and admitting crepant resolutions.

concepts.label: finite quotient
concepts.description: A geometric quotient of a variety by a finite group action, used to describe local moduli structure.

concepts.label: polarization
concepts.description: A choice of ample line bundle on a projective variety, fixing the embedding and normalization for moduli classification.

concepts.label: local K-moduli
concepts.description: The local structure of the moduli space of Kähler metrics on a given polarized variety, studied via deformation theory.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau orientifold
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau manifold with an orientifold involution, used in type IIB string theory flux compactifications to generate tadpole constraints and moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: flux superpotential
concepts.description: The superpotential generated by background fluxes in type IIB compactifications, including nonperturbative contributions from gaugino condensation.

concepts.label: α′ corrections
concepts.description: Stringy higher-derivative corrections to the Kähler potential and superpotential, suppressed in the large volume limit but essential for moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: Kähler inflation
concepts.description: An inflationary model where the inflaton field is a Kähler modulus (geometric deformation of the compactification manifold).

concepts.label: non-canonical kinetic term
concepts.description: A kinetic Lagrangian with field-dependent coefficients or mixing, arising naturally from the Kähler metric in string theory compactifications.

concepts.label: curvature perturbation
concepts.description: Metric perturbations coupling to the inflaton trajectory, parameterized by the scalar spectral index n_s and measured by the CMB.

concepts.label: isocurvature perturbation
concepts.description: Perturbations orthogonal to the adiabatic direction in multi-field inflation; can source curvature perturbations in the post-inflationary era.

concepts.label: scalar spectral index
concepts.description: The power-law index n_s characterizing the scale dependence of the primordial power spectrum; n_s ≈ 0.96 disfavors inflation at generic slow-roll scales.

concepts.label: assisted inflation
concepts.description: A multi-field inflationary mechanism where scalar fields with identical potentials conspire to produce an effective single-field solution and flat power spectrum.

concepts.label: volume modulus
concepts.description: The Kähler modulus controlling the overall size of the Calabi-Yau manifold; typically the heaviest and most tightly constrained by moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: Thermal inflation
concepts.description: Brief period of exponential expansion at sub-Planck temperatures triggered by a phase transition, diluting unwanted relics and resetting initial conditions.

concepts.label: Cosmological moduli problem
concepts.description: Tension arising when light moduli fields decay late in cosmic history, generating excessive entropy that dilutes baryon asymmetry and dark matter abundance.

concepts.label: Affleck-Dine mechanism
concepts.description: Late-time production of baryon asymmetry via coherent oscillations of flat directions in the scalar potential.

concepts.label: Flatino LSP
concepts.description: Lightest Supersymmetric Particle identified as the superpartner of the modulus field (flatino), arising in theories with dynamical supersymmetry breaking.

concepts.label: Double thermal inflation
concepts.description: Extension of single thermal inflation with two consecutive thermal transitions, providing enhanced dilution and moduli mass coverage.

concepts.label: Entropy dilution
concepts.description: Reduction of unwanted particle abundances (moduli decay products, gravitinos) through accelerated expansion.

concepts.label: moduli space of curves
concepts.description: Parameter space classifying curves up to isomorphism, a fundamental object in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: spin structure
concepts.description: A choice of square root of the canonical bundle on a curve, determining fermion representations in physics.

concepts.label: multiple-spin curves
concepts.description: Curves equipped with an m-tuple of distinct spin structures simultaneously.

concepts.label: Deligne-Mumford compactification
concepts.description: A smooth, proper compactification of a moduli space using geometric quotients and orbifold techniques.

concepts.label: quasi-stable curves
concepts.description: Nodal curves with finite automorphism groups, serving as stable objects in moduli theory.

concepts.label: line bundles
concepts.description: Rank-one vector bundles on an algebraic variety; classified by the Picard group.

concepts.label: stacky curves
concepts.description: Curves with automorphism groups and orbifold structure, formalized as algebraic stacks.

concepts.label: limiting objects
concepts.description: Geometric objects appearing in boundary strata of a compactification as limits of families.

concepts.label: coarse moduli space
concepts.description: A scheme parameterizing isomorphism classes of objects, with a universal property weaker than a fine moduli space.

concepts.label: local structure
concepts.description: Description of the étale-local geometry and stratification near points in a moduli space.

concepts.label: irreducible components
concepts.description: Maximal connected subsets of a scheme that cannot be written as a union of proper closed subsets.

concepts.label: SU(5) Yukawa unification
concepts.description: GUT boundary condition requiring the down-type Yukawa matrix equals the transpose of the electron-type Yukawa matrix at the GUT scale.

concepts.label: flavour-violating soft SUSY breaking
concepts.description: Non-zero off-diagonal entries in soft SUSY-breaking mass matrices and A-terms that violate flavour symmetry at the electroweak scale.

concepts.label: super-CKM basis
concepts.description: Fermion mass eigenstate basis where the CKM matrix is diagonal, used for parameterizing flavour-violating SUSY-breaking terms.

concepts.label: GUT boundary condition
concepts.description: Constraint imposed at the Grand Unified Theory scale relating SM gauge couplings and Yukawa matrices.

concepts.label: three-family Yukawa unification
concepts.description: Requirement that Yukawa coupling unification holds simultaneously for all three fermion generations.

concepts.label: two-family Yukawa unification
concepts.description: Relaxed unification condition restricting Yukawa coupling alignment to second and third families only, avoiding first-family LFV tensions.

concepts.label: slepton exchange
concepts.description: Supersymmetric loop contribution to LFV processes mediated by slepton (scalar lepton) propagators.

concepts.label: experimental constraints
concepts.description: Limits from flavour physics, electroweak precision tests, Higgs measurements, and LHC searches that restrict SUSY parameter space.

concepts.label: large sieve inequality
concepts.description: A classical analytic tool that bounds character sums uniformly over families of moduli, widely used in sieve theory and analytic number theory.

concepts.label: additive characters
concepts.description: Group homomorphisms from an additive group to the circle group, fundamental in harmonic analysis and Fourier theory on function fields.

concepts.label: power moduli
concepts.description: Ideals in function field rings of the form P^k for prime ideals P and positive integers k.

concepts.label: restricted moduli sets
concepts.description: Constrained families of moduli (ideals) satisfying additional structural or arithmetic conditions beyond general divisibility.

concepts.label: character sums
concepts.description: Exponential sums weighted by additive or multiplicative characters, quantifying deviation from uniform distribution.

concepts.label: high-dimensional sieves
concepts.description: Sieve methods extending classical one-dimensional techniques to multidimensional lattices or varieties over function fields.

concepts.label: Fourier analysis on function fields
concepts.description: Harmonic analysis framework using additive characters to decompose functions over function field rings and quotients.

concepts.label: analytic number theory
concepts.description: Branch of number theory using tools from analysis (characters, L-functions, zeta functions) to study divisibility and distribution properties.

concepts.label: moduli uniformity
concepts.description: The property that a bound on character sums holds uniformly across a family of moduli with controlled parameters.

concepts.label: finite volume method
concepts.description: Discretization technique that enforces local flux conservation by integrating governing equations over control volumes around grid vertices.

concepts.label: boundary element method
concepts.description: Integral equation-based discretization that reduces unbounded domain problems to boundary integrals, requiring only surface meshing.

concepts.label: flux conservation
concepts.description: Property ensuring that mass or momentum is conserved locally within each control volume or finite element.

concepts.label: upwind stabilization
concepts.description: Numerical technique that biases discretization upstream to suppress spurious oscillations in convection-dominated transport problems.

concepts.label: convection-dominated flow
concepts.description: Transport regime in which advection dominates diffusion, characterized by high Péclet numbers and prone to oscillatory solutions without stabilization.

concepts.label: porous media flow
concepts.description: Fluid motion through interconnected void spaces in a solid matrix, governed by coupled equations for flow and contaminant transport.

concepts.label: coupled domain problem
concepts.description: Mathematical problem with interior and exterior subdomains with different physics, requiring interface conditions to exchange information across the boundary.

concepts.label: non-symmetric coupling
concepts.description: Discretization scheme that couples two methods (FVM and BEM) without enforcing symmetric bilinear forms, trading symmetry for computational efficiency.

concepts.label: stability analysis
concepts.description: Mathematical proof that discrete approximations remain bounded and do not exhibit uncontrolled growth as mesh size varies.

concepts.label: convergence analysis
concepts.description: Proof that the numerical solution approaches the true solution as discretization parameters (mesh size, polynomial order) are refined.

concepts.label: implicit stabilization
concepts.description: Stabilization technique incorporated directly into the variational formulation to suppress oscillations without adding explicit artificial diffusion.

concepts.label: geometric invariant theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework for studying quotients of algebraic varieties by group actions, with applications to moduli space construction and stability analysis.

concepts.label: K3 surfaces
concepts.description: Smooth projective surfaces with trivial canonical bundle and vanishing H¹(O_X); fundamental objects in algebraic geometry with rich moduli theory.

concepts.label: polarized K3 surfaces
concepts.description: K3 surfaces equipped with an ample line bundle, whose degree defines the genus and determines the period domain.

concepts.label: odd genus K3 surfaces
concepts.description: K3 surfaces with a polarization of odd genus g, studied via syzygy point stability to produce effectivity results on moduli spaces.

concepts.label: canonical curves
concepts.description: Curves of genus g≥3 embedded into projective space P^{g-1} by the canonical line bundle, possessing minimal degree embeddings.

concepts.label: genus six curves
concepts.description: Smooth projective curves of genus 6, studied via syzygy point GIT stability to refine the Hassett-Keel program.

concepts.label: Hassett-Keel program
concepts.description: Program of studying the birational geometry and wall-crossing phenomena in the moduli space of curves by varying GIT stability conditions.

concepts.label: effectivity
concepts.description: Property asserting that divisor classes on a moduli space are effective (realized by actual geometric objects), providing explicit representability.

concepts.label: projective schemes
concepts.description: Schemes of finite type over a field embedded in projective space, the primary objects of study in algebraic geometry.

concepts.label: axionic moduli
concepts.description: Massless or light pseudo-scalar fields arising from dimensional reduction of higher-form gauge potentials and metric components in string compactifications.

concepts.label: odd axions
concepts.description: Axion fields with odd parity under geometric involutions; complementary class to even axions in Type IIB orientifolds.

concepts.label: even axions
concepts.description: Axion fields with even parity under geometric involutions; arise from C₂ reduction in Type IIB string theory.

concepts.label: F-term stabilization
concepts.description: Mechanism to generate scalar potential and lift moduli mass degeneracies through holomorphic superpotential contributions.

concepts.label: E3-brane instantons
concepts.description: Euclidean D3-branes wrapping three-cycles; generate non-perturbative superpotential contributions proportional to exp(-2πT).

concepts.label: fluxed E3-brane instantons
concepts.description: E3-brane instantons carrying internal flux; modifies instanton action and generates F-terms coupling to axionic directions.

concepts.label: poly-instantons
concepts.description: Non-perturbative effects from multiple simultaneous brane instantons or higher-genus worldsheet contributions; generalize single-instanton terms.

concepts.label: axion mass
concepts.description: Physical mass eigenvalue of axion fields; generated dynamically through non-perturbative effects and moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: crystallization model
concepts.description: Mathematical model describing continuous crystallization processes using systems of partial differential equations coupled with ordinary and integro-differential equations.

concepts.label: hyperbolic system
concepts.description: System of partial differential equations with hyperbolic character, characterized by wave-like propagation of solutions.

concepts.label: steady-state solution
concepts.description: Time-independent solution to a dynamical system that persists under constant inputs.

concepts.label: control Lyapunov functional
concepts.description: Lyapunov functional constructed to prove stability of controlled systems through feedback control design.

concepts.label: quadratic form
concepts.description: Polynomial function of degree two used to construct Lyapunov functionals in weighted L2-spaces.

concepts.label: weighted L2-space
concepts.description: Lebesgue square-integrable function space equipped with a weight function defining the inner product and norm.

concepts.label: closed-loop system
concepts.description: Dynamical system with feedback control where the system state influences the control input.

concepts.label: integro-differential equation
concepts.description: Differential equation incorporating integral terms, coupling local and non-local dynamics.

concepts.label: control design
concepts.description: Systematic approach for constructing feedback control laws to achieve desired system behavior.

concepts.label: IIB string theory
concepts.description: Type II superstring theory with chiral N=2 supersymmetry; primary framework for flux compactifications and F-theory duals.

concepts.label: string loop corrections
concepts.description: Quantum corrections from closed string loops (genus expansion) that modify the scalar potential beyond tree-level and one-loop effects.

concepts.label: AdS vacuum
concepts.description: Anti-de Sitter spacetime minimum of scalar potential with negative cosmological constant; non-supersymmetric stable background.

concepts.label: Moduli space of hyperbolic surfaces
concepts.description: The space of geometric structures on a fixed topological surface that are complete hyperbolic metrics, up to isometry.

concepts.label: Weil-Petersson form
concepts.description: A symplectic structure on the moduli space of hyperbolic surfaces defined via the L² pairing of tangent vectors to Teichmüller space.

concepts.label: Weil-Petersson volume
concepts.description: The volume of moduli spaces with respect to the Weil-Petersson symplectic form, whose coefficients encode intersection numbers.

concepts.label: Polynomial behaviour
concepts.description: The property that Weil-Petersson volumes grow polynomially as a function of topological parameters such as genus and boundary components.

concepts.label: Intersection numbers
concepts.description: Topological invariants on moduli spaces of curves measuring transverse intersections of tautological cohomology classes.

concepts.label: Mirzakhani's theorem
concepts.description: The fundamental result proving that Weil-Petersson volumes are polynomials in topological parameters and relating coefficients to intersection numbers.

concepts.label: Topological invariants
concepts.description: Quantities characterizing geometric objects that remain unchanged under continuous deformations, such as genus and Euler characteristic.

concepts.label: Stability phenomena
concepts.description: Theorems demonstrating that certain topological or cohomological properties stabilize (become independent of parameters) in families of spaces or moduli.

concepts.label: Riemann surfaces
concepts.description: One-dimensional complex manifolds; fundamental objects in algebraic geometry and complex analysis.

concepts.label: Stable cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology of a space or family that becomes independent of increasing parameters in the stable limit.

concepts.label: Mumford's conjecture
concepts.description: Conjecture on the stable rational cohomology of the moduli space of Riemann surfaces, relating it to an infinite loop space.

concepts.label: Madsen-Weiss theorem
concepts.description: Theorem proving Mumford's conjecture by establishing that moduli space of Riemann surfaces is homologically equivalent to an infinite loop space.

concepts.label: Harer stability theorem
concepts.description: Theorem establishing that the cohomology of the moduli space of Riemann surfaces stabilizes as genus increases.

concepts.label: Freudenthal suspension theorem
concepts.description: Classical theorem showing that homotopy groups of spaces stabilize under repeated suspension.

concepts.label: Bott periodicity
concepts.description: Phenomenon showing that homotopy and cohomology theories of certain spaces exhibit periodic structure with period 2 or 8.

concepts.label: Whitney embedding theorem
concepts.description: Classical theorem establishing that any smooth manifold can be embedded in Euclidean space of sufficiently high dimension.

concepts.label: Configuration spaces
concepts.description: Topological spaces parametrizing unordered or ordered collections of points in a given manifold.

concepts.label: Gauge theoretic moduli spaces
concepts.description: Moduli spaces arising from gauge theory, parametrizing solutions to gauge-theoretic equations modulo gauge transformations.

concepts.label: Pseudoisotopies
concepts.description: Continuous families of diffeomorphisms or self-maps of manifolds; their space exhibits stability phenomena.

concepts.label: Galatius theorem
concepts.description: Recent theorem on the stable cohomology of automorphisms of finitely-generated free groups.

concepts.label: plug-and-play framework
concepts.description: A modular optimization approach that integrates pre-trained denoisers into iterative algorithms without modifying the denoiser, enabling explainable image restoration.

concepts.label: weight-tying neural network
concepts.description: A neural network architecture where encoder and decoder weights are shared, enforcing structural symmetry and reducing the number of trainable parameters.

concepts.label: nonnegative weights
concepts.description: Constraint restricting all network weights to non-negative values, ensuring convexity of the potential function and monotonicity of the gradient.

concepts.label: monotone Lipschitz-gradient denoiser
concepts.description: A denoising function with monotone gradient and Lipschitz continuity, guaranteeing convergence properties in optimization algorithms.

concepts.label: proximal splitting method
concepts.description: An iterative optimization algorithm that decomposes composite convex problems by alternating between proximal operators of different functions.

concepts.label: weakly convex regularizer
concepts.description: A regularization term that is weakly convex (not necessarily strictly convex), implicitly induced by the denoiser in the optimization objective.

concepts.label: image restoration
concepts.description: The problem of recovering a clean image from a degraded or corrupted version using computational methods.

concepts.label: Lipschitz constant
concepts.description: A bound on the rate of change of a function; a smaller Lipschitz constant indicates smoother variation.

concepts.label: convexity preservation
concepts.description: A technique ensuring that the overall optimization objective remains convex despite potential ill-conditioning or weak convexity of individual components.

concepts.label: ill-conditioned problem
concepts.description: An optimization problem where the loss function is not strongly convex, making convergence analysis more challenging.

concepts.label: soft mass term
concepts.description: Dimension-2 gaugino or scalar mass parameter arising from SUSY-breaking that does not reintroduce quadratic divergences.

concepts.label: moduli decoupling
concepts.description: Separation of heavy moduli dynamics from the inflaton sector in the limit of unbroken supersymmetry.

concepts.label: KKLT stabilization
concepts.description: String theory moduli stabilization scheme using Kähler uplift and α'-corrections to achieve both moduli fixing and de Sitter uplifting.

concepts.label: Kähler Uplifting
concepts.description: Moduli stabilization mechanism using Kähler potential corrections and a nilpotent superfield to uplift the anti-de Sitter minimum.

concepts.label: inflaton potential
concepts.description: Scalar potential V(φ) governing the inflaton field dynamics during cosmic inflation.

concepts.label: non-decoupling effects
concepts.description: Contributions from heavy fields that persist even when their masses are sent to infinity, violating standard decoupling theorem.

concepts.label: moduli stabilization scale
concepts.description: Energy scale m_{3/2} at which moduli acquire masses and are removed from the low-energy effective action.

concepts.label: gauge-Higgs unification
concepts.description: A theoretical framework where the Higgs boson emerges as a component of a higher-dimensional gauge field, typically via compactification or extra dimensions.

concepts.label: Higgs decay
concepts.description: The process by which the Higgs boson decays into Standard Model particles, characterized by branching ratios and signal strengths.

concepts.label: signal strength
concepts.description: The ratio of the observed production and decay rate of a particle to the Standard Model prediction, used to test deviations from SM predictions.

concepts.label: tau Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: The coupling between the tau lepton and the Higgs boson, determining the tau lepton mass.

concepts.label: bottom Yukawa coupling
concepts.description: The coupling between the bottom quark and the Higgs boson, determining the bottom quark mass.

concepts.label: Higgs to bottom pair decay
concepts.description: The decay process H → bb̄, one of the dominant Higgs branching modes measured at the LHC.

concepts.label: Higgs to tau pair decay
concepts.description: The decay process H → ττ̄, providing sensitive probes of lepton-Higgs couplings.

concepts.label: gluon fusion
concepts.description: The dominant Higgs production mechanism at the LHC mediated by top-quark loops coupling to the Higgs.

concepts.label: coupling deviation
concepts.description: A systematic deviation of a coupling constant in an extended model from its Standard Model value.

concepts.label: fermion mass
concepts.description: The mass of a fundamental fermion particle, generated via Yukawa coupling to the Higgs vacuum expectation value.

concepts.label: super Riemann surfaces
concepts.description: Supersymmetric generalizations of Riemann surfaces with fermionic coordinates and structure sheaf enriched by odd variables.

concepts.label: moduli space of stable curves
concepts.description: Deligne-Mumford compactification $\overline{\cal M}_{g,n}$ parameterizing stable algebraic curves of genus g with n marked points.

concepts.label: super hyperbolic surfaces
concepts.description: Super Riemann surfaces equipped with a hyperbolic metric structure compatible with the supersymmetric geometry.

concepts.label: moduli volumes
concepts.description: Measure-theoretic volumes computed on moduli spaces of geometric objects, relating different geometric structures via integration.

concepts.label: tautological classes
concepts.description: Cohomology classes on $\overline{\cal M}_{g,n}$ arising from the universal curve, fundamental in intersection theory of moduli spaces.

concepts.label: KdV tau function
concepts.description: Generating function satisfying the Korteweg-de Vries hierarchy; generating function for intersection numbers forms a tau function.

concepts.label: Kontsevich-Witten theorem
concepts.description: Theorem relating generating functions of tautological class intersections on $\overline{\cal M}_{g,n}$ to KdV tau functions.

concepts.label: Mirzakhani's approach
concepts.description: Method proving generating function identities via volumes of hyperbolic surfaces and Weil-Petersson geometry.

concepts.label: algebraic geometry methods
concepts.description: Techniques using schemes, cohomology, and intersection theory to study moduli spaces and enumerative invariants.

concepts.label: super geometry techniques
concepts.description: Differential-geometric approach to super manifolds using supersmooth functions and odd differentials.

concepts.label: recursion relations
concepts.description: Recurrence equations relating volumes or intersection numbers at different genera or marked points.

concepts.label: cohomology class intersections
concepts.description: Cup product intersections of cohomology classes computed as integrals on the moduli space.

concepts.label: Q-ball
concepts.description: Non-topological solitonic object carrying baryon or lepton number that can form during the evolution of scalar fields; relevant in AD baryogenesis.

concepts.label: inflaton coupling
concepts.description: Interaction between the inflaton field and matter fields (e.g., AD scalar); enhanced coupling can modify asymmetry generation efficiency.

concepts.label: Type IIB string compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of ten-dimensional Type IIB superstring theory to four dimensions on a Calabi-Yau threefold with appropriate fluxes and branes.

concepts.label: Higgs boson mass
concepts.description: Empirical observation of the Standard Model Higgs at ~125 GeV, which constrains the scale of supersymmetry breaking to be large.

concepts.label: chiral superfield
concepts.description: Fundamental building block of supersymmetric field theory containing both fermionic and bosonic components; couples to moduli via the Kähler potential.

concepts.label: Kähler potential
concepts.description: Function in supergravity that defines the metric and kinetic structure of scalar fields, including moduli and matter fields; determines the form of scalar interactions.

concepts.label: uplifting
concepts.description: Mechanism to raise the vacuum energy from negative (AdS) to positive (dS) or zero by introducing additional contributions to the scalar potential without destabilizing moduli.

concepts.label: d-differential
concepts.description: A meromorphic differential form of degree d on a Riemann surface with prescribed zeros and poles characterized by an integral vector κ.

concepts.label: moduli space of d-differentials
concepts.description: The space Ω^d M_{g,n}(κ) parameterizing meromorphic d-differentials on genus-g Riemann surfaces with n marked points and pole/zero orders specified by κ.

concepts.label: affine complex manifold
concepts.description: A complex manifold equipped with an affine structure, allowing definition of parallel transport and canonical volume forms.

concepts.label: canonical volume form
concepts.description: A naturally occurring differential top-form on a manifold that is intrinsically defined and invariant under symmetries of the underlying structure.

concepts.label: parallel volume form
concepts.description: A volume form whose covariant derivative vanishes with respect to the affine connection on the manifold.

concepts.label: projectivization
concepts.description: The quotient space P Ω^d M_{g,n}(κ) = Ω^d M_{g,n}(κ) / ℂ* obtained by identifying d-differentials differing by a nonzero scalar multiple.

concepts.label: induced measure
concepts.description: A measure on the projectivized space obtained by pushing forward the canonical volume form via the quotient map ℂ*→1.

concepts.label: total volume finiteness
concepts.description: The property that the integral of an induced measure over a projectivized moduli space yields a finite real number.

concepts.label: genus of surface
concepts.description: The topological invariant g classifying compact Riemann surfaces and determining their fundamental group; surfaces of genus g have Euler characteristic 2-2g.

concepts.label: pole-zero data
concepts.description: The integral vector κ = (k_1, …, k_n) specifying the orders of zeros and poles of d-differentials at n marked points, with sum k_1+…+k_n = d(2g-2).

concepts.label: string gas cosmology
concepts.description: Early universe cosmological scenario where string modes (F-strings, D-strings, winding modes) thermalize and interact to dynamically stabilize moduli fields.

concepts.label: F-string modes
concepts.description: Vibrational excitation modes of fundamental strings (as opposed to D-branes); massless modes play a special role in moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: D-string modes
concepts.description: Vibrational excitation modes of D-branes carrying Ramond-Ramond charge; when combined with F-strings enable simultaneous stabilization of multiple moduli.

concepts.label: fine-tuning
concepts.description: Requirement for unnatural cancellations or coincidences among parameters; avoided by the proposed stabilization mechanism.

concepts.label: radiative generation
concepts.description: Mechanism by which effective couplings arise at one-loop order from higher-scale physics rather than appearing at tree level.

concepts.label: portal interaction
concepts.description: Renormalizable coupling between Standard Model fields and hidden sector degrees of freedom, mediating communication between sectors.

concepts.label: quartic Higgs coupling
concepts.description: Self-interaction strength λ of the Higgs potential term λ(H†H)², determining Higgs mass stability and vacuum structure.

concepts.label: top Yukawa interaction
concepts.description: Yukawa coupling between the Higgs doublet and the top quark, the largest fermion-Higgs coupling in the Standard Model.

concepts.label: underlying symmetry
concepts.description: High-scale symmetry forbidding tree-level Yukawa couplings, whose spontaneous breaking generates the low-energy effective couplings.

concepts.label: portal messenger
concepts.description: Scalar field mediating interactions between the Standard Model and hidden sector, testable at colliders.

concepts.label: collider experiment
concepts.description: High-energy physics experiment probing Standard Model and beyond-Standard-Model physics through particle collisions.

concepts.label: official statistics
concepts.description: Authoritative statistical information produced by government or public institutions for policy-making and public discourse.

concepts.label: machine learning
concepts.description: Automated techniques for learning patterns from data to enable prediction and decision-making without explicit programming.

concepts.label: data sources
concepts.description: Origin systems, databases, or repositories from which statistical data are collected and extracted.

concepts.label: data source changes
concepts.description: Transitions, replacements, or modifications in the underlying data sources used to produce official statistics.

concepts.label: concept drift
concepts.description: Temporal variation in the statistical properties, definitions, or meanings of data features that causes model predictions to degrade.

concepts.label: data quality
concepts.description: Degree to which data sources meet standards for accuracy, completeness, validity, and reliability.

concepts.label: bias
concepts.description: Systematic deviation from truth in data collection, representation, or algorithmic processing that distorts statistical inference.

concepts.label: monitoring
concepts.description: Continuous surveillance and assessment of data source behavior, model performance, and statistical outputs to detect anomalies.

concepts.label: statistical integrity
concepts.description: Adherence to standards of accuracy, consistency, transparency, and ethical practice in statistical production and reporting.

concepts.label: validity
concepts.description: Degree to which data and statistical measures accurately represent the underlying phenomena they purport to measure.

concepts.label: availability
concepts.description: Accessibility and continued provision of data sources required for timely statistical production.

concepts.label: ethical governance
concepts.description: Regulatory and ethical frameworks ensuring responsible handling of data in statistical production.

concepts.label: model validation
concepts.description: Systematic evaluation of machine learning model performance, generalization, and limitations using appropriate metrics and test sets.

concepts.label: DOME framework
concepts.description: A structured methodology for reporting machine learning studies based on four core components: Data, Optimization, Model, and Evaluation.

concepts.label: data
concepts.description: The collection of labeled instances used to train and evaluate machine learning models; a core component of DOME.

concepts.label: optimization
concepts.description: The process of tuning hyperparameters and model weights to minimize loss during machine learning training; a core DOME component.

concepts.label: model
concepts.description: The parameterized mathematical function or algorithm that makes predictions; a core DOME component.

concepts.label: evaluation
concepts.description: Quantitative assessment of model performance using metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, or AUC; a core DOME component.

concepts.label: performance metrics
concepts.description: Quantitative measures such as accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score, or AUC used to evaluate model predictions.

concepts.label: biological applications
concepts.description: Use of machine learning methods to solve problems in biology such as disease diagnosis, protein structure prediction, or gene expression analysis.

concepts.label: model limitations
concepts.description: Constraints on model applicability including bias, overfitting, data imbalance, or domain-specific constraints that affect reliability.

concepts.label: community standards
concepts.description: Agreed-upon best practices and recommendations established by scientific communities for rigorous methodology and reporting.

concepts.label: learning curve
concepts.description: A plot showing the performance of a machine learning algorithm as a function of a resource (e.g., training set size, iterations) used during training or evaluation.

concepts.label: hyperparameter configuration
concepts.description: A set of hyperparameter values specifying the behavior of a machine learning algorithm; learning curves model performance across configurations.

concepts.label: early stopping
concepts.description: A regularization technique that halts model training when performance on a validation set stops improving, guided by learning curves.

concepts.label: data acquisition
concepts.description: The process of gathering training data; learning curves help determine how much data is needed to reach target performance.

concepts.label: learning curve model
concepts.description: A mathematical or statistical model that predicts or extrapolates the performance trajectory of an algorithm given partial observations.

concepts.label: reference performance
concepts.description: A target performance threshold against which algorithm performance is compared in binary decision-making scenarios.

concepts.label: decision making
concepts.description: The process of selecting actions or configurations based on available information, guided by learning curve predictions.

concepts.label: performance prediction
concepts.description: Estimating or forecasting the accuracy, loss, or other metrics of an algorithm at future resource levels using learned curve models.

concepts.label: resource budget
concepts.description: A constraint on computational or data resources (e.g., maximum training examples or iterations) available for algorithm training.

concepts.label: training iteration
concepts.description: A single pass through a training procedure; the number of iterations is a resource axis often tracked in learning curves.

concepts.label: Machine learning interpretability
concepts.description: Methods and frameworks for explaining which features and mechanisms drive decisions made by machine learning models.

concepts.label: Loss landscape
concepts.description: The high-dimensional surface of a neural network's loss function as a function of its parameters, characterized by minima, barriers, and connectivity structure.

concepts.label: Energy landscape methods
concepts.description: Techniques from physical sciences that analyze the structure of potential energy surfaces to identify critical features and conserved properties of systems.

concepts.label: Conserved weights
concepts.description: Weight values or patterns that remain invariant across multiple minima of a loss landscape, indicating features essential to model function.

concepts.label: Feature relevance
concepts.description: The relative importance or influence of input data features in determining model predictions and decisions.

concepts.label: Order parameters
concepts.description: Scalar quantities that characterize the collective behavior or state of a system, identifying critical features distinguishing different phases or configurations.

concepts.label: Molecular sciences
concepts.description: Scientific discipline studying molecular structure, dynamics, and properties at the atomic and quantum level.

concepts.label: Model minima
concepts.description: Local or global minima of the loss landscape where model parameters are optimized during training.

concepts.label: Input data features
concepts.description: Individual variables or attributes within input data that serve as drivers or predictors for model decisions.

concepts.label: Model transparency
concepts.description: The degree to which a machine learning model's internal mechanisms and decision pathways are understandable to humans.

concepts.label: online active learning
concepts.description: Machine learning paradigm that selects the most informative data points to label from continuously arriving data streams in real time.

concepts.label: data stream
concepts.description: Continuous sequence of unlabeled or partially labeled data points arriving sequentially over time.

concepts.label: labeling cost
concepts.description: Resource expense (time, money, expert effort) associated with obtaining ground-truth annotations for data observations.

concepts.label: informative sample selection
concepts.description: Strategy for identifying data points that maximise machine learning model performance gain per labeling unit cost.

concepts.label: pool-based active learning
concepts.description: Active learning paradigm selecting observations from a fixed, closed pool of unlabeled data rather than from streaming data.

concepts.label: uncertainty sampling
concepts.description: Active learning strategy that selects samples where the model has lowest confidence or highest prediction uncertainty.

concepts.label: query strategy
concepts.description: Algorithm or heuristic that determines which unlabeled samples to select for annotation based on informativeness criteria.

concepts.label: machine learning model performance
concepts.description: Quantitative measure of a model's accuracy, generalization, or effectiveness on labeled or test data.

concepts.label: real-world application
concepts.description: Practical deployment scenario for machine learning systems on actual data with constraints like limited labeling budgets and streaming data arrival.

concepts.label: annotation effort
concepts.description: Total labor and resources required to obtain labels for a set of data observations through human or expert review.

concepts.label: streaming paradigm
concepts.description: Computational framework where data arrives continuously and models must adapt or select observations online without storing entire datasets.

concepts.label: sample informativeness
concepts.description: Property of a data point indicating its potential value for improving machine learning model training and generalization.

concepts.label: fake news detection
concepts.description: Machine learning task of automatically identifying false or misleading news articles to mitigate their propagation on social media.

concepts.label: machine learning models
concepts.description: Computational algorithms trained on data to predict or classify information; includes traditional, deep learning, and pre-trained variants.

concepts.label: pre-trained language models
concepts.description: Neural network models (e.g., BERT) trained on large corpora and fine-tuned for downstream tasks like fake news detection.

concepts.label: deep learning
concepts.description: Machine learning approach using multi-layer neural networks to learn hierarchical feature representations from raw data.

concepts.label: traditional machine learning
concepts.description: Classical machine learning methods (e.g., SVM, Naive Bayes, logistic regression) using hand-crafted features rather than learned representations.

concepts.label: dataset bias
concepts.description: Systematic skew in model performance due to training on datasets with limited domain diversity, reducing generalization across news types.

concepts.label: benchmark study
concepts.description: Systematic comparative evaluation of multiple models on standardized datasets to assess relative performance and identify best practices.

concepts.label: model performance
concepts.description: Quantitative metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score) measuring how well a trained model predicts or classifies unseen instances.

concepts.label: article topic
concepts.description: Categorical or semantic label describing the subject domain (e.g., political, health, science) of a news article.

concepts.label: article length
concepts.description: Quantitative feature measuring text size (word count) of a news article; analyzed as a potential factor in detection difficulty.

concepts.label: social media propagation
concepts.description: Viral spread and amplification of news content (true or false) through online social networks, increasing exposure and societal impact.

concepts.label: limited electronic content
concepts.description: Languages or domains with scarce digitized training data, creating a bottleneck for traditional machine learning requiring large corpora.

concepts.label: Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning
concepts.description: Machine learning techniques that protect sensitive data throughout the entire pipeline from training to inference while maintaining model utility.

concepts.label: Healthcare ML
concepts.description: Machine learning applications in medical domains including disease diagnosis, prognosis prediction, and patient treatment planning.

concepts.label: Medical data
concepts.description: Sensitive patient health information including diagnostic records, genetic data, and treatment histories subject to privacy regulations.

concepts.label: Model training
concepts.description: The process of optimizing ML model parameters using training data to learn predictive patterns.

concepts.label: Model inference
concepts.description: The deployment phase where trained ML models make predictions on new data in production settings.

concepts.label: Inference-as-a-service
concepts.description: Cloud-based deployment model where trained ML models are provided as services for remote prediction with privacy considerations.

concepts.label: Data privacy
concepts.description: Protection of sensitive information from unauthorized access and disclosure throughout data processing and analysis.

concepts.label: Differential privacy
concepts.description: Mathematical framework guaranteeing that individual records cannot be distinguished in outputs by adding calibrated noise.

concepts.label: Federated learning
concepts.description: Distributed ML approach where model training occurs on decentralized data sources without centralizing raw data.

concepts.label: Secure multiparty computation
concepts.description: Cryptographic technique enabling multiple parties to jointly compute functions on private inputs without revealing individual data.

concepts.label: Homomorphic encryption
concepts.description: Encryption scheme allowing computations on encrypted data without decryption, preserving data privacy during processing.

concepts.label: Privacy-utility tradeoff
concepts.description: Fundamental tension between protecting data privacy and maintaining model prediction accuracy in ML systems.

concepts.label: Real-world healthcare deployment
concepts.description: Translation of research ML models into clinical practice and operational healthcare systems with regulatory compliance.

concepts.label: Reinforcement Learning
concepts.description: Machine learning paradigm where agents learn to maximize cumulative rewards through interaction with an environment via trial and error.

concepts.label: Computational Emotion Model
concepts.description: Formal algorithmic representation of emotion processes in artificial agents that influences decision-making and action selection.

concepts.label: Emotion Theory
concepts.description: Psychological and cognitive frameworks explaining the nature, function, and mechanisms of emotions in biological systems.

concepts.label: Decision-Making Architecture
concepts.description: Computational system that integrates sensory inputs, internal states, and learned policies to generate action selection and control.

concepts.label: Appraisal
concepts.description: Cognitive evaluation process that interprets environmental events relative to agent goals and concerns, often generating emotional responses.

concepts.label: Homeostasis
concepts.description: Regulatory mechanism maintaining internal physiological or computational state within viable bounds.

concepts.label: Intrinsic Motivation
concepts.description: Internally-driven incentive for action generation independent of external rewards, such as curiosity or competence seeking.

concepts.label: Learning Efficiency
concepts.description: Rate at which an agent acquires knowledge and improves policy performance relative to interaction cost.

concepts.label: Model-Based Reinforcement Learning
concepts.description: RL approach where agents build and use explicit models of environment dynamics for planning and decision-making.

concepts.label: Social Signal
concepts.description: Observable behavioral or communicative cue that conveys agent state or intent to other agents or humans.

concepts.label: Human-Robot Interaction
concepts.description: Interdisciplinary field studying communication, collaboration, and trust between humans and autonomous robotic agents.

concepts.label: Agent Motivation
concepts.description: System of drives and incentives governing action initiation and goal pursuit in an autonomous agent.

concepts.label: Affective Modeling
concepts.description: Research discipline focused on computational representation and simulation of emotion and affective phenomena in AI systems.

concepts.label: CRISP-ML(Q)
concepts.description: A process model for machine learning development covering six phases from business understanding to deployment maintenance, with integrated quality assurance methodology.

concepts.label: Machine learning application lifecycle
concepts.description: The complete development cycle of ML systems from initial project scoping through operational deployment and maintenance.

concepts.label: Business understanding
concepts.description: Initial phase defining project scope, business objectives, and success criteria for machine learning applications.

concepts.label: Data understanding
concepts.description: Phase assessing data availability, quality, and feasibility of using data to meet project objectives.

concepts.label: Quality assurance methodology
concepts.description: Systematic approach to identify and mitigate risks specific to machine learning development across the project lifecycle.

concepts.label: Risk identification
concepts.description: Process of systematically detecting and cataloging challenges and failure modes in machine learning development.

concepts.label: Model degradation
concepts.description: Performance decline of deployed machine learning models due to environmental changes, data drift, or concept drift.

concepts.label: Monitoring and maintenance
concepts.description: Ongoing phase tracking model performance in production and implementing updates to combat degradation.

concepts.label: CRISP-DM
concepts.description: Classical data mining process model with strong industry support but limited coverage of machine learning specific tasks.
aliases: Cross-industry standard process for data mining

concepts.label: ML-specific tasks
concepts.description: Technical activities unique to machine learning development not adequately addressed by traditional data mining process models.

concepts.label: Technical quality assurance
concepts.description: Quality assurance methods focused on technical aspects of model development, evaluation, and deployment.

concepts.label: B-model
concepts.description: The mirror-dual string theory perspective on a Calabi-Yau manifold, obtained via mirror symmetry from the A-model.

concepts.label: Integral affine structure
concepts.description: A piecewise linear structure on a manifold with transition maps in GL(n,ℤ), underlying tropical and mirror-symmetric constructions.

concepts.label: Dual intersection complex
concepts.description: The dual polyhedral complex encoding the combinatorial structure of a toric degeneration or tropical variety.

concepts.label: Logarithmic Hodge structure
concepts.description: A Hodge structure with logarithmic singularities at boundary divisors, naturally appearing in degenerating families.

concepts.label: Iritani's residual B-model
concepts.description: A construction of variation of Hodge structure for toric CY hypersurfaces capturing B-model periods near large complex structure limit.

concepts.label: Kato-Usui theory
concepts.description: Extension of variation of Hodge structure to boundary points via logarithmic structures and nilpotent orbits.

concepts.label: Polarized logarithmic Hodge structure
concepts.description: A logarithmic Hodge structure equipped with a polarization form, naturally arising at boundary of a degenerating CY family.

concepts.label: Punctured disk family
concepts.description: A one-parameter family of varieties parametrized by D∖{0}, with monodromy and limiting behavior at the puncture.

concepts.label: Tropical geometry
concepts.description: Combinatorial shadow of algebraic varieties obtained by taking valuations, underlying the Gross-Siebert program.

concepts.label: Shannon entropy
concepts.description: Information-theoretic measure quantifying uncertainty in probability distributions, extended here to evaluate data intrinsic structure and model interpretability.

concepts.label: rough set theory
concepts.description: Mathematical framework for handling vagueness and incompleteness in data through approximation spaces, granules, and indiscernibility relations.

concepts.label: data granularity
concepts.description: Structural decomposition of data into meaningful granules capturing relationships and indiscernibility within feature spaces.

concepts.label: data complexity
concepts.description: Intrinsic structural properties of datasets reflecting dimensionality, noise, class overlap, and hierarchical organization.

concepts.label: integrated framework
concepts.description: Unified methodology combining Shannon entropy and rough set theory to provide multi-faceted evaluation of machine learning models.

concepts.label: Cayley trick
concepts.description: A geometric construction that associates a hybrid LG model to a compact complete intersection variety by lifting it to a non-compact ambient space.

concepts.label: Bounded Calabi-Yau geometry
concepts.description: A Calabi-Yau manifold equipped with a complete Kähler metric and bounded volume form satisfying geometric bounds needed for L² Hodge theory.

concepts.label: Strongly elliptic function
concepts.description: A holomorphic function on a Calabi-Yau manifold satisfying ellipticity conditions that enable application of L² Hodge theory and Morse-Bott theory.

concepts.label: L² Hodge theory
concepts.description: Cohomology theory for non-compact manifolds using L²-integrable differential forms, developed by Li-Wen, enabling harmonic analysis on incomplete metrics.

concepts.label: Twisted de Rham cohomology
concepts.description: Cohomology of the twisted exterior derivative d + dW∧ acting on differential forms, associated to a holomorphic function W on a manifold.

concepts.label: Frobenius manifold
concepts.description: A manifold with a commutative associative algebra structure on tangent spaces, compatible with a flat metric and defined by a potential function.

concepts.label: Critical locus
concepts.description: The set of points where the differential dW vanishes, i.e., the zero set of the gradient of W.

concepts.label: Complete Kähler metric
concepts.description: A Kähler metric on a possibly non-compact manifold such that every Cauchy sequence of points converges, ensuring metric completeness.

concepts.label: maximum entropy method
concepts.description: Optimization framework that constructs probability distributions subject to moment constraints while maximizing entropy.

concepts.label: moment constraints
concepts.description: Mathematical constraints specifying expected values of functions (moments) that a probability distribution must satisfy.

concepts.label: Bayesian variational inference
concepts.description: Approximate inference technique that optimizes a variational distribution to match a posterior via divergence minimization.

concepts.label: log determinant estimation
concepts.description: Computational problem of efficiently approximating the logarithm of a matrix determinant for large-scale linear algebra.

concepts.label: Bayesian optimization
concepts.description: Sequential design method that uses a probabilistic model (surrogate) to select informative observations and optimize an expensive black-box function.

concepts.label: large-scale approximation
concepts.description: Computational technique designed to handle high-dimensional or data-intensive problems through efficient representation or sampling.

concepts.label: entropy maximization
concepts.description: Optimization objective that seeks the distribution with maximum Shannon entropy subject to constraints.

concepts.label: constrained optimization
concepts.description: Mathematical programming problem of optimizing an objective function subject to equality or inequality constraints.

concepts.label: event-based sensor
concepts.description: Neuromorphic sensor that asynchronously captures pixel-level brightness changes, generating sparse spatiotemporal event streams rather than dense frames.

concepts.label: asynchronous sensing
concepts.description: Continuous, event-driven data acquisition triggered by stimulus changes rather than at fixed time intervals.

concepts.label: synchronous processing
concepts.description: Batch or periodic processing of data at discrete, regular time intervals or sampling rates.

concepts.label: ALERT module
concepts.description: Asynchronous PointNet-based embedding that continuously integrates new events and dismisses old ones via a learnable leakage mechanism.

concepts.label: PointNet
concepts.description: Neural architecture that directly processes unordered point clouds without requiring voxelization or mesh conversion.

concepts.label: leakage mechanism
concepts.description: Learnable temporal decay function that exponentially downweights old events in the embedding to maintain recency bias.

concepts.label: Vision Transformer
concepts.description: Transformer architecture adapted for image/video tasks via patch-based tokenization of spatial regions.

concepts.label: patch-based processing
concepts.description: Decomposition of spatiotemporal data into overlapping or non-overlapping patches to reduce computational complexity.

concepts.label: input sparsity
concepts.description: Characteristic property of event-stream data where only a small fraction of spatial locations contain events at any given time.

concepts.label: object recognition
concepts.description: Task of identifying and localizing semantic object categories in visual data.

concepts.label: gesture recognition
concepts.description: Task of identifying hand or body motion patterns from sensor data.

concepts.label: latency
concepts.description: Time delay between sensor input and model output; a critical metric for real-time event processing.

concepts.label: sampling rate
concepts.description: Frequency at which features are extracted or readout from a continuous stream; determines trade-off between responsiveness and compute cost.

concepts.label: AutoML
concepts.description: Automated machine learning systems that automatically select, configure, and optimize machine learning algorithms and hyperparameters with minimal human intervention.

concepts.label: pipeline synthesis
concepts.description: The process of automatically constructing sequences of machine learning operations (data preprocessing, feature engineering, model selection) to solve a given task.

concepts.label: self-play
concepts.description: Training technique where an agent learns by repeatedly playing against itself, generating its own training data and improving through this iterative competition.

concepts.label: pipeline grammar
concepts.description: Formal specification defining the syntactic rules and constraints for valid machine learning pipeline structures and operator compositions.

concepts.label: evolutionary algorithms
concepts.description: Population-based optimization techniques inspired by natural evolution, using selection, mutation, and recombination to explore solution spaces.

concepts.label: pre-trained model
concepts.description: Machine learning model with learned parameters initialized from training on large diverse datasets, enabling transfer learning and faster convergence on new tasks.
