concepts.description: K3 surface arising as transverse intersection of two hypersurfaces in a higher-dimensional ambient space.

concepts.label: Fermat quartic
concepts.description: Plane quartic curve defined by x⁴+y⁴+z⁴=0; special symmetric K3 surface with maximal automorphism group.

concepts.label: direct product K3×K3
concepts.description: Product of two K3 surfaces forming a 4-dimensional Calabi-Yau manifold.

concepts.label: bidegree (1,2) hypersurfaces
concepts.description: Divisors in ℙ¹×ℙ³ of bidegree (1,2); two such hypersurfaces intersect generically at a K3 surface.

concepts.label: U(1)×U(1) gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Abelian gauge group with two independent U(1) factors arising from rank-2 Mordell-Weil generators in F-theory.

concepts.label: Cartan generators
concepts.description: Maximal commuting subalgebra elements of a Lie algebra; their divisor classes correspond to U(1) factors in the Abelian limit.

concepts.label: Symmetric representation
concepts.description: A tensor representation of a Lie group; for SU(3), the symmetric rank-2 tensor is a 6-dimensional irreducible representation.

concepts.label: Codimension-two singularities
concepts.description: Singular loci of complex codimension 2 in the elliptic fibration base; their resolution determines localized matter representations.

concepts.label: Monte Carlo exploration
concepts.description: Computational sampling technique using random walks and statistical methods to explore high-dimensional parameter spaces of geometric configurations.

concepts.label: four-dimensional F-theory model
concepts.description: F-theory compactification on a Calabi-Yau 3-fold producing a 4D N=1 supersymmetric effective field theory.

concepts.label: ℤ₅ gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Cyclic discrete gauge group of order 5; constructed in 6D F-theory over del Pezzo and other toric bases.

concepts.label: ℤ₃ gauge symmetry
concepts.description: Cyclic discrete gauge group of order 3; constructible in 6D F-theory models via Fano 3-fold geometry.

concepts.label: Freed-Witten quantisation
concepts.description: Topological quantization condition on G(4)-flux ensuring consistency of the D-brane action with background fields in F-theory.

concepts.label: stable degeneration limit
concepts.description: A geometric limiting procedure on F-theory elliptic fibrations that produces the heterotic dual Calabi-Yau and spectral cover.

concepts.label: Stückelberg mechanism
concepts.description: A mechanism in effective field theory where massless axions are absorbed by U(1) gauge bosons, relating geometric and effective U(1) counts.

concepts.label: section gluing
concepts.description: The condition that sections in the two K3 half-fibers of the stable degeneration can be globally extended to the full F-theory elliptic fibration.

concepts.label: SU(N) gauge theory
concepts.description: Non-Abelian gauge theory with SU(N) gauge group, arising from F-theory on appropriate base geometry.

concepts.label: M2 instanton
concepts.description: Non-perturbative wrapped brane instanton effect generating superpotential terms in F-theory, with exponentially suppressed amplitude.

concepts.label: phase transition
concepts.description: Point in moduli space where the geometry or gauge structure undergoes a transition, potentially accompanied by instanton-generated terms.

concepts.label: Tate-Shafarevich group
concepts.description: Arithmetic invariant ℤₙ classifying torsors of an elliptic curve; appears as the structure of n-sections in fibered geometries.

concepts.label: ℙ¹-bundle base
concepts.description: A threefold base for F-theory compactification constructed as a ℙ¹ bundle over a toric surface, analogous to minimal models in 6D F-theory.

concepts.label: Non-Higgsable gauge factor
concepts.description: A gauge group or gauge algebra component that cannot be broken via Higgs mechanism without breaking supersymmetry; forced by the geometry of the base.

concepts.label: SU(3) × SU(2) gauge group
concepts.description: Product gauge algebra appearing frequently in F-theory models, phenomenologically relevant as it contains the strong and weak nuclear force gauge factors.

concepts.label: Seven-brane cluster
concepts.description: A localized configuration of seven-branes in the F-theory geometry that generates gauge factors via intersection singularities, often non-Higgsable.

concepts.label: Moduli deformation
concepts.description: A continuous parameter in the geometry that controls deformations of the base or fiber structure, determining which gauge factors remain for generic values.

concepts.label: Dark matter candidate
concepts.description: A potential source of dark matter from the gauge structure and matter content of the effective field theory, geometrically realized in F-theory.

concepts.label: heterotic K3 models
concepts.description: Heterotic string compactifications on K3 surfaces with orbifold singularities, generating gauge groups and matter spectra.

concepts.label: instanton number
concepts.description: Topological charge counting instantons per fixed point in heterotic compactifications, constraining gauge embeddings.

concepts.label: Dynkin diagram
concepts.description: Graph-theoretic representation of a Lie algebra, with vertices for simple roots and edges encoding root angles.

concepts.label: weak-strong coupling
concepts.description: Duality relating weakly-coupled (perturbative) regime of one theory to strongly-coupled regime of another.

concepts.label: tops
concepts.description: Toric 3-dimensional polytopes whose normal fan gives the structure for constructing non-abelian gauge groups (especially SU(5)) in F-theory via Kodaira fiber classification.

concepts.label: brane recombination
concepts.description: A geometric transformation relating distinct elliptic fibration models via contraction or birational equivalence, connecting different fiber structures to the same gauge symmetry class.

concepts.label: Instanton effects
concepts.description: Non-perturbative corrections from wrapped M5-branes in F-theory; generate higher-order superpotential terms and Yukawa matrix entries suppressed at tree level.

concepts.label: Wavefunction profile
concepts.description: Profile of a zero-mode fermion along the elliptic fiber; its overlap with the Yukawa coupling point determines physical coupling strength via normalization.

concepts.label: E8 symmetry
concepts.description: Maximal gauge symmetry underlying the elliptic fibration in F-theory, within which all GUT and Standard Model groups must embed.

concepts.label: Matter localization
concepts.description: Geometric mechanism in F-theory where matter fields localize at (or near) special loci such as singularities or intersection points on the base surface, controlling coupling strength and topology.

concepts.label: chiral exotic
concepts.description: Additional chiral fermion matter beyond the three SM generations; must be absent or vectorlike for phenomenological viability.

concepts.label: U(1) hyperflux
concepts.description: Internal gauge flux in F-theory that Higgses GUT groups directly to MSSM, unavailable in heterotic models.

concepts.label: Landau wave function
concepts.description: Quantum eigenstate in curved background geometry; repulsion near brane leads to hierarchical mass scales.

concepts.label: Brane curvature
concepts.description: Geometric curvature around exceptional branes in F-theory that induces repulsion mechanism for neutral Landau wave functions.

concepts.label: μ term
concepts.description: Superpotential mass parameter in MSSM; hierarchy mechanism generates viably small values via Landau repulsion.

concepts.label: Global symmetry
concepts.description: Nearly exact approximate continuous or discrete symmetry protecting μ term and forbidding dangerous operators in F-theory GUTs.

concepts.label: GUT mass relation
concepts.description: Prediction of GUT unification on coupling constants and fermion masses; distorted by Aharanov-Bohm effect in F-theory.

concepts.label: Aharanov-Bohm effect
concepts.description: Quantum phase accumulated by charged particles in background flux that distorts GUT mass relations for lighter generations.

concepts.label: Dirac gauginos
concepts.description: Supersymmetric particles where gauginos acquire Dirac masses instead of Majorana masses, requiring adjoint chiral multiplets.

concepts.label: chiral adjoints
concepts.description: Chiral multiplets transforming in the adjoint representation of the gauge group, required for Dirac gaugino mass terms.

concepts.label: discrete R-symmetry
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry acting on superfields that protects against dangerous operators and baryon/lepton number violation in supersymmetric models.

concepts.label: vector-like leptons
concepts.description: Pairs of chiral leptons and anti-leptons with identical quantum numbers, used to modify gauge coupling unification in Dirac gaugino models.

concepts.label: Majorana masses
concepts.description: Conventional supersymmetric gaugino mass terms; contrasted with Dirac masses in this work.

concepts.label: superpartner masses
concepts.description: Masses of supersymmetric partners of Standard Model particles, constrained by collider experiments.

concepts.label: Holomorphic Yukawa
concepts.description: The tree-level or intrinsic Yukawa coupling defined in the superpotential, independent of wavefunction renormalization from fluxes.

concepts.label: Third generation
concepts.description: The heaviest fermion generation (top, bottom, tau) with O(1) Yukawa couplings naturally generated in local F-theory SU(5) models.

concepts.label: Light generations
concepts.description: The first and second fermion generations (up/down/electron, charm/strange/muon) with suppressed Yukawa couplings requiring non-perturbative explanations.

concepts.label: D-quark mass
concepts.description: The physical mass of down-type quarks (down, strange, bottom), differing from lepton masses despite unified couplings in SU(5) GUTs.

concepts.label: basis transformation
concepts.description: Change of coordinates in group space to eliminate or reduce gauge-kinetic mixing terms.

concepts.label: gaugino mass mixing
concepts.description: Residual mixing in soft supersymmetry-breaking gaugino mass terms that cannot be eliminated by basis choice alone.

concepts.label: renormalization group equation
concepts.description: Differential equation governing the running of coupling constants and mass parameters as a function of energy scale.

concepts.label: trilinear soft coupling
concepts.description: Soft SUSY-breaking coupling of dimension three (A-terms) between scalars and fermions, e.g. A_{ijk} φ_i φ_j ψ_k.

concepts.label: scalar mass term
concepts.description: Soft SUSY-breaking mass-squared parameter for scalar fields in the Lagrangian.

concepts.label: Standard Model hypercharge
concepts.description: The U(1)_Y gauge symmetry of the Standard Model, conventionally normalized by hypercharge assignments.

concepts.label: D-brane models
concepts.description: String theory constructions where open strings end on D-branes, generating gauge theories and chiral fermion spectra at orbifold singularities.

concepts.label: warped throat geometry
concepts.description: Non-compact region of a string compactification with strong gravitational warping, such as the Klebanov-Strassler deformed conifold, that naturally generates hierarchies.

concepts.label: Planck/electroweak hierarchy
concepts.description: The observed 10¹⁶ ratio between the Planck scale and the electroweak scale, naturally generated by exponential warping in Randall-Sundrum scenarios.

concepts.label: 3-form flux
concepts.description: Background fluxes of the NS-NS and RR 3-form fields that stabilize dilaton and complex structure moduli in string compactifications.

concepts.label: dilaton stabilization
concepts.description: Fixing the string coupling constant through flux-generated superpotential contributions, typically addressing the cosmological moduli problem.

concepts.label: orbifold singularity
concepts.description: Conical singularity with discrete symmetry where D-branes can be localized, generating enhanced gauge symmetries and chiral open string modes.

concepts.label: intersecting D6-branes
concepts.description: String theory objects obtained via T-duality from D9-branes with B-fluxes; used for model building in toroidal and orbifold compactifications.

concepts.label: type IIA orientifold
concepts.description: String theory compactification using type IIA string theory on orientifold backgrounds with O-planes; framework for building semi-realistic gauge theories.

concepts.label: complex structure instability
concepts.description: Runaway moduli problem where geometric deformations are not stabilized; addressed via orbifold projections or flux choices.

concepts.label: inflaton
concepts.description: Scalar field driving cosmic inflation; string theory moduli are candidates for the inflaton in early-universe dynamics.

concepts.label: Quantum annealer
concepts.description: A quantum device that solves optimization problems by adiabatic evolution; used to enhance genetic algorithm search in the string landscape.

concepts.label: Schoen manifold
concepts.description: Explicit CY threefold constructed as a fiber product; admits large families of stable holomorphic bundles.

concepts.label: Bianchi identity
concepts.description: Constraint from heterotic string theory on the curvature and bundle data ensuring consistency of the compactification.

concepts.label: Kaehler cone
concepts.description: Region of the Kaehler moduli space where the CY metric is well-defined and bundles satisfy positivity conditions.

concepts.label: tensor-matter transition
concepts.description: A change in the hyper- and tensor multiplet sectors of 6d supergravity while preserving the vector multiplet (gauge algebra) structure.

concepts.label: superconformal point
concepts.description: A special point in the moduli space where 6d theories exhibit enhanced superconformal symmetry, realizing transitions between different vacua.

concepts.label: (4,6,12) singularity
concepts.description: A specific collision singularity that emerges when intersection points of two curves are tuned in F-theory base geometry, driving tensor-matter transitions.

concepts.label: toric resolution
concepts.description: A systematic geometric resolution of singularities in toric varieties, yielding smooth toric fibrations.

concepts.label: non-flat fiber
concepts.description: A fiber in a fibration that is not a standard torus, arising at superconformal points and corresponding to non-toric Kähler deformations.

concepts.label: Kähler deformation
concepts.description: A variation of the Kähler structure of a complex manifold, parameterized by Kähler moduli, that preserves holomorphicity.

concepts.label: 6D SCFT
concepts.description: Six-dimensional superconformal field theory, a quantum field theory with maximal superconformal symmetry in six dimensions.

concepts.label: frozen singularity
concepts.description: A type of singularity in the base of an elliptic fibration that cannot be resolved, excluded from the classification of 6D SCFTs realizable in F-theory.

concepts.label: transverse intersection
concepts.description: A geometric condition requiring that components of the discriminant locus intersect transversally (generically), constraining fiber collision patterns.

concepts.label: singular fiber collision
concepts.description: Configuration where two or more singular fibers of different Kodaira types meet at a point in the base, imposing constraints on compatible gauge enhancements.

concepts.label: elliptic K3 surfaces
concepts.description: K3 surfaces with a structure of elliptic fibration over P¹, characterized by their Weierstrass models and complex structure moduli.

concepts.label: Kulikov models
concepts.description: Classification of complex structure degenerations of K3 surfaces into three types: Type I (finite distance), Type II, and Type III (infinite distance limits).

concepts.label: infinite distance limits
concepts.description: Degenerations in complex structure moduli space where the distance diverges, classified by Swampland Distance Conjecture predictions.

concepts.label: Emergent String Conjecture
concepts.description: Conjectural principle that infinite distance limits in string moduli space signal emergence of a weakly-coupled string as a tower of states.

concepts.label: Type III Kulikov models
concepts.description: Infinite distance degenerations of elliptic K3 surfaces characterized by two canonical forms and emergent affine symmetry algebras.

concepts.label: non-minimal singularities
concepts.description: Singularities in codimension one on Weierstrass models that require explicit blowup resolution in the K3 classification.

concepts.label: decompactification limits
concepts.description: Infinite distance limits where extra dimensions effectively decompactify, signaled by emergent affine Lie algebra enhancements.

concepts.label: affine symmetry algebra
concepts.description: Loop algebra extension of Lie algebras emerging at infinite distance limits, indicating dimensional enhancement or decompactification.

concepts.label: B-fibration
concepts.description: A special elliptic fibration type on Calabi-Yau threefolds with enhanced symmetry properties enabling Z₂-invariant bundle construction.

concepts.label: S-duality
concepts.description: Equivalence between SO(32) heterotic string on CY3 and type I string with D9- and D5-branes; related to type II intersecting D-brane models by mirror symmetry.

concepts.label: spectral eigenvector
concepts.description: The dominant eigenvector of the network Laplacian, which determines late-time dynamical behavior in network evolution.

concepts.label: flux compactifications
concepts.description: Compactification of extra dimensions in string theory with non-zero fluxes, stabilizing moduli and generating a discrete set of possible vacua.

concepts.label: radiative natural SUSY
concepts.description: SUSY models where the weak scale emerges radiatively from renormalization group running with small tree-level gaugino and sfermion masses, avoiding fine-tuning.

concepts.label: higgsino
concepts.description: Supersymmetric partner of the Higgs boson; light higgsinos naturally arise in radiatively-driven SUSY models from small μ values.

concepts.label: mSUGRA
concepts.description: Constrained minimal SUSY GUT model with universal gaugino and sfermion masses at the GUT scale, typically highly fine-tuned at current LHC bounds.

concepts.label: search optimization
concepts.description: Dynamical process of exploring the string landscape through random walks and gradient flows to identify hospitable vacua.

concepts.label: mean first passage time
concepts.description: Expected time for a random walk to reach a target state from an initial state; used as a measure of search efficiency.

concepts.label: funnel topology
concepts.description: Landscape geometry characterized by smooth, converging pathways toward low-energy minima, analogous to protein folding landscapes.

concepts.label: dynamical criticality
concepts.description: Critical point in landscape dynamics where random walks transition between recurrent and transient behavior, optimizing search efficiency.

concepts.label: recurrence
concepts.description: Property of random walks where the walker returns to the starting point with probability 1; occurs in lower-dimensional spaces.

concepts.label: transience
concepts.description: Property of random walks where the walker has nonzero probability of never returning to the starting point; occurs in higher-dimensional spaces.

concepts.label: hospitable vacua
concepts.description: String theory vacua with physical properties compatible with observed cosmological parameters and particle physics.

concepts.label: cosmological constant problem
concepts.description: The stark discrepancy between the observed tiny value of dark energy density and theoretical predictions from quantum field theory.

concepts.label: electroweak vacuum metastability
concepts.description: Property of the Standard Model vacuum as a metastable state with finite lifetime due to Higgs potential instability at high energies.

concepts.label: de Sitter Page time
concepts.description: Characteristic timescale for a de Sitter universe defined as τ ∼ M_Pl^2/H^3, related to thermodynamic equilibration.

concepts.label: non-equilibrium critical phenomena
concepts.description: Critical behavior and phase transitions occurring in systems driven away from equilibrium by external forces or finite evolution time.

concepts.label: multiverse dynamics
concepts.description: Temporal evolution of the string landscape considering finite lifetimes and mixing times across multiple disconnected vacua.

concepts.label: accessibility measure
concepts.description: Quantitative criterion assigning weight to vacua based on efficiency of access under time evolution, analogous to closeness centrality in networks.

concepts.label: first-passage statistics
concepts.description: Probabilistic framework analyzing time to first reach target state in stochastic dynamics; basis for accessibility weighting.

concepts.label: closeness centrality
concepts.description: Network science measure quantifying average distance from one node to all others; mathematical analogue of accessibility measure.

concepts.label: pocket universe
concepts.description: Causally disconnected region of spacetime created during eternal inflation, each containing a distinct vacuum state.

concepts.label: mixing time
concepts.description: Timescale for landscape dynamics to reach equilibrium across all vacua; assumed exponentially long compared to inflation duration.

concepts.label: Mordell-Weil rank
concepts.description: The rank of the group of rational sections of an elliptic fibration, determining the number of independent non-Higgsable abelian gauge fields.

concepts.label: non-Higgsable abelian gauge field
concepts.description: A U(1) gauge symmetry in F-theory that cannot be broken by Higgs mechanism without violating anomaly cancellation or creating unresolvable singularities.

concepts.label: Spin(4) gauge theory
concepts.description: Gauge theory with Spin(4) gauge group engineered geometrically via crepant resolutions of Weierstrass models in elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: SO(4) gauge theory
concepts.description: Gauge theory with SO(4) gauge group engineered geometrically via crepant resolutions of Weierstrass models in elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: flop
concepts.description: A birational transformation between two crepant resolutions of a singular variety, typically exchanging two irreducible components of the exceptional divisor.

concepts.label: affine A₁ Dynkin diagram
concepts.description: The extended Dynkin diagram for SU(2), characterized by a loop with two nodes, arising as the dual graph of the collision configuration.

concepts.label: box graph
concepts.description: A decorated graph encoding the structure of higher codimension fibers in elliptic fibrations, based on the representation graph of matter multiplets and convex paths between nodes.

concepts.label: higher codimension fiber
concepts.description: Singular fibers of an elliptic fibration occurring at points of codimension ≥2 in the base, encoding enhanced gauge symmetry and matter content.

concepts.label: cone of effective curves
concepts.description: The convex cone in the Picard lattice spanned by classes of effective curves; its generators determine the birational geometry and extremal contractions.

concepts.label: minuscule representation
concepts.description: An irreducible representation of a Lie algebra in which all weights lie in a single orbit under the Weyl group, characterized by a single fundamental weight.

concepts.label: N=2 supersymmetric gauge theory
concepts.description: A four-dimensional field theory with N=2 extended supersymmetry, featuring vector and hypermultiplets whose moduli spaces encode geometric data of Calabi-Yau compactifications.

concepts.label: reductive Lie group
concepts.description: A Lie group whose Lie algebra is semisimple or a direct product of semisimple and abelian factors; includes classical groups SU(n), SO(n), Sp(2n) and exceptional groups E₆, E₇, E₈.

concepts.label: 5D supersymmetric gauge theory
concepts.description: Five-dimensional N=1 supersymmetric gauge theories with anomaly constraints and renormalization group fixed points.

concepts.label: renormalization group fixed point
concepts.description: Infrared fixed point of 5D gauge theory beta functions; existence necessary for UV-complete field theory from geometry.

concepts.label: Calabi-Yau threefold singularities
concepts.description: Isolated singularities in Calabi-Yau threefolds that serve as geometric data for defining five-dimensional superconformal field theories in M-theory.

concepts.label: 5d SCFT
concepts.description: Five-dimensional superconformal field theory arising at low energy in M-theory compactified on the transverse space to a CY singularity.

concepts.label: M-theory/type IIA duality
concepts.description: Fiberwise duality relating M-theory on a space-time to type IIA string theory, enabling systematic extraction of gauge-theory phases.

concepts.label: gauge theory phases
concepts.description: Different low-energy gauge theory descriptions of a 5d SCFT arising from distinct type IIA reductions or partial resolutions of the CY singularity.

concepts.label: Coulomb branch parameters
concepts.description: Scalar VEVs and mass parameters of the 5d gauge theory, dual to Kähler deformations of the CY singularity.

concepts.label: toric CY singularities
concepts.description: Singularities in Calabi-Yau threefolds with toric (combinatorial) description, enabling systematic fiberwise M-theory/type IIA analysis.

concepts.label: non-isolated toric singularities
concepts.description: Toric singularities with higher-dimensional singular locus; the paper comments on extensions of the M-theory/IIA duality to this case.

concepts.label: orbifold singularities
concepts.description: Local geometric singularities in M-theory that serve as building blocks for constructing supersymmetric quantum field theories.

concepts.label: 0-form symmetry
concepts.description: Global symmetry acting on point-like operators; the traditional notion of symmetry group in quantum field theory.

concepts.label: 2-group symmetry
concepts.description: Non-abelian extension of global symmetry structure where 0-form and 1-form symmetries mix; captures interplay between point and line operators.

concepts.label: orbifold homology
concepts.description: Homology theory adapted to orbifold geometry, capturing topological information about singular spaces and their boundary singularities.

concepts.label: cutting and gluing
concepts.description: A geometric procedure for decomposing non-compact orbifold geometries into local pieces and reconstructing global symmetry data from their combination.

concepts.label: fiber component splitting
concepts.description: Decomposition of irreducible components in higher-codimension fibers; the pattern is consistent with generation of matter and Yukawa couplings.

concepts.label: Bifundamental matter
concepts.description: Hypermultiplet transforming as a fundamental representation under one gauge group and anti-fundamental under another in a product gauge group.

concepts.label: Higgs branch moduli
concepts.description: Complex moduli space parameterizing vacuum expectation values of scalar fields in the theory; central to understanding symmetry breaking patterns.

concepts.label: Matter delocalization
concepts.description: Phenomenon where matter fields in F-theory geometry are supported across multiple collision points of discriminant loci rather than localized at a single point.

concepts.label: G-flux quantization
concepts.description: Quantization condition for the M-theory G-flux on elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau fourfolds, constrained by topological and geometric data.

concepts.label: Freed-Witten quantization
concepts.description: Quantization condition for worldvolume fluxes on D-branes (7-branes in type IIB) accounting for anomaly cancellation and topological constraints.

concepts.label: unitary gauge group
concepts.description: Gauge algebra of the form su(n) or u(n), arising from resolved singularities in elliptically fibered geometries.

concepts.label: non-spin submanifold
concepts.description: A submanifold whose tangent bundle does not admit a spin structure, leading to half-integral shifts in flux quantization on D-branes.

concepts.label: half-integral shift
concepts.description: A quantization correction of ±1/2 applied to flux numbers when the support manifold is non-spin, arising from spin-structure anomalies.

concepts.label: flavor U(1) gauge group
concepts.description: An additional abelian gauge symmetry beyond the non-abelian gauge group, often arising from recombined 7-branes or geometrically as sections in elliptic fibrations.

concepts.label: Gopakumar-Vafa invariant
concepts.description: Genus-zero virtual curve count on a Calabi-Yau; relates topological geometry to the multiplicity of massless matter in F-theory.

concepts.label: Enhancement locus
concepts.description: Locus in the base where a smooth Kodaira fiber degenerates to a more singular type; naively expected site of charged singlet matter in F-theory.

concepts.label: Geometric Anomaly Cancellation
concepts.description: Equation relating intersection numbers, Euler characteristic, and Gopakumar-Vafa invariants; proves anomaly vanishing without explicit flux data.

concepts.label: rank-two 5d SCFT
concepts.description: Five-dimensional superconformal field theory with two-dimensional conformal manifold, engineered via M-theory on isolated toric CY3 singularities.

concepts.label: isolated toric CY3 singularity
concepts.description: Singular point on a Calabi-Yau threefold defined by a toric diagram, resolvable via toric blow-up; supports two compact divisors in rank-two case.

concepts.label: gauge-theory phase
concepts.description: Deformation phase of a 5d SCFT with known Lagrangian description in terms of gauge fields and matter.

concepts.label: type IIA background
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional type IIA supergravity solution consisting of an A-type ALE space fibered over the real line with D6-brane stacks.

concepts.label: D6-brane wrapping
concepts.description: Topological configuration in which D6-branes wrap 2-cycles in an ALE resolution, generating flavor symmetries and matter content.

concepts.label: toric diagram
concepts.description: Lattice polytope encoding the combinatorial data of a toric variety; projections onto lower-dimensional lattices determine resolutions.

concepts.label: mass deformation
concepts.description: Deformation of a 5d SCFT by relevant scalar mass operators, which triggers renormalization group flow and phase transitions.

concepts.label: 5D N=1 quiver gauge theory
concepts.description: Five-dimensional N=1 supersymmetric gauge theory with product gauge group structure and matter in bifundamental representations.

concepts.label: ℂ∗-fibration
concepts.description: Total space of a fiber bundle with fiber ℂ∗ (punctured complex line) over a base space; structure underlying local CY3 geometries.

concepts.label: local K3 surface
concepts.description: A K3 surface viewed as the base of a fibration; used as a geometric foundation for constructing local CY3 singularities.

concepts.label: singularity deformation
concepts.description: Local deformation of an algebraic singularity parameterized by moduli; counted via Higgs branch dimension.

concepts.label: IIA string theory on K3
concepts.description: Type IIA superstring compactified on a K3 surface with D6-branes, dual to M-theory on local CY3.

concepts.label: IIB string theory with 5-branes
concepts.description: Type IIB superstring with NS5-branes and/or D5-branes; dual frame to M-theory and IIA descriptions.

concepts.label: compactification of ℂ∗-fibers
concepts.description: Geometric compactification replacing ℂ∗ fibers with compact tori; triggers Stückelberg mechanism and modifies gauge structure.

concepts.label: finite coupling
concepts.description: Regime where gauge coupling is not at weak or strong limit; geometric M-theory description is reliable.

concepts.label: Universal Extra Dimensions
concepts.description: Extension of the Standard Model with additional spatial dimensions compactified at a TeV scale, preserving 4D gauge symmetries in the bulk.

concepts.label: Discrete residual symmetry
concepts.description: Remnant discrete gauge symmetry preserved after orbifold compactification that prevents rapid proton decay channels.

concepts.label: Standard Model singlet neutrinos
concepts.description: Right-handed neutrino states that are gauge singlets under the SM; their orbifold parity assignment controls neutrino mass generation.

concepts.label: Neutron decay
concepts.description: Beta decay process; the dominant mode in this model is n → 3ν, suppressed relative to standard channels by the discrete symmetry.

concepts.label: Trilinear R-parity violation
concepts.description: R-parity violating superpotential terms cubic in superfields, such as λᵢⱼₖ L̂ᵢ L̂ⱼ Êₖ or λ'ᵢⱼₖ L̂ᵢ Q̂ⱼ D̂ₖ.

concepts.label: Bilinear R-parity violation
concepts.description: R-parity violating superpotential terms quadratic in superfields, such as μᵢ L̂ᵢ Ĥᵤ coupling leptons to the Higgs.

concepts.label: U(1) selection rule
concepts.description: Discrete symmetry constraint arising from a spontaneously broken U(1) gauge symmetry that suppresses certain terms in the effective superpotential.

concepts.label: Dimension-4 proton decay
concepts.description: Baryon-number violating nucleon decay mediated by dimension-4 operators in the superpotential, the dominant decay mode without R-parity.

concepts.label: Squark-exchange diagram
concepts.description: Feynman diagram mediating nucleon decay via virtual squark exchange, contributing to baryon-number violation in supersymmetric theories.

concepts.label: B − L breaking
concepts.description: Spontaneous breaking of baryon-minus-lepton-number symmetry in the theory, allowing B − L violating processes.

concepts.label: D-brane model
concepts.description: String theory construction using D-branes to generate 4D effective field theories with chiral matter and gauge symmetries.

concepts.label: baryon number
concepts.description: Conserved quantum number B assigning +1/3 to quarks and 0 to leptons; protects proton stability when gauged.

concepts.label: lepton number
concepts.description: Conserved quantum number L assigning +1 to leptons and 0 to quarks; protects against neutrinoless processes when gauged.

concepts.label: E3 instantons
concepts.description: Euclidean D3-branes wrapping cycles in Calabi-Yau threefolds that contribute to non-perturbative superpotential corrections, particularly relevant for moduli stabilisation.

concepts.label: E(-1) instantons
concepts.description: Fractional instantons (Euclidean M2-branes or D1-branes) on orbifold singularities that can induce Yukawa couplings only when located at singularities sharing collapsed homologous two-cycles.

concepts.label: D3-branes at orbifold singularities
concepts.description: D3-branes localized at orbifold singularities in type IIB string theory, defining the visible sector gauge theory.

concepts.label: annulus diagrams
concepts.description: One-loop worldsheet amplitudes in string theory with open-string boundaries; relevant for instanton calculus with matter field insertions.

concepts.label: stringy instanton calculus
concepts.description: Systematic computational framework for determining non-perturbative contributions to superpotential couplings from Euclidean branes using worldsheet methods.

concepts.label: collapsed homologous cycles
concepts.description: Two-cycles in singular Calabi-Yau geometries that become singular or collapse at orbifold singularities, determining fractional instanton coupling geometry.

concepts.label: Kähler invariant function
concepts.description: The function G = K + log|W|² encoding the complete N=1 supergravity Lagrangian in terms of Kähler potential K and superpotential W.

concepts.label: heavy scalar fields
concepts.description: Chiral multiplets with large expectation values or masses that can be separated from low-energy effective theory through decoupling.

concepts.label: light fields
concepts.description: Low-mass or light-coupled chiral multiplets that dominate the low-energy effective action, including inflatons in inflation scenarios.

concepts.label: inflation with moduli
concepts.description: Cosmological inflation scenario where the inflaton field coexists with stabilized moduli, requiring controlled decoupling between sectors.

concepts.label: quiver gauge theory
concepts.description: A gauge theory whose structure is encoded in a quiver diagram, arising from multiple branes at singularities with matter in bifundamental representations.

concepts.label: higher-dimensional operators
concepts.description: Effective operators involving couplings of Higgs fields, standard model singlets, and axion fields that naturally lead to ultralight axion generation.

concepts.label: Wilson coefficient
concepts.description: A dimensionless coupling constant in effective operators; O(1) Wilson coefficients appear in ultralight axion mass generation mechanisms.

concepts.label: exploratory data analysis
concepts.description: Initial statistical and visual investigation of a dataset to understand structure, distributions, and optimal representations.

concepts.label: weighted projective space
concepts.description: Generalization of projective space with weighted homogeneous coordinates; used to define Calabi-Yau hypersurfaces via weight systems.

concepts.label: neural network approximation
concepts.description: Machine learning framework trained to predict Hodge numbers from weight systems; serves as fast surrogate for computationally expensive topological calculations.

concepts.label: transversality
concepts.description: Condition ensuring a hypersurface intersects the singular locus of the ambient space in codimension ≥ 2; necessary for smoothness of CY.

concepts.label: supersymmetric solution
concepts.description: A vacuum state preserving some fraction of supersymmetry, characterized by vanishing supersymmetry variations.

concepts.label: Minkowski vacuum
concepts.description: A flat spacetime solution with zero cosmological constant, representing a critical point of the string potential.

concepts.label: potential positivity
concepts.description: The condition that the effective scalar potential is non-negative in a given region of moduli space, constraining vacuum structure.

concepts.label: racetrack model
concepts.description: A string moduli stabilization scenario using two competing non-perturbative superpotential terms to fix moduli.

concepts.label: 1-modulus system
concepts.description: A simplified string compactification with a single dynamical scalar degree of freedom after moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: type IIB supergravity
concepts.description: 10-dimensional supersymmetric theory obtained from type IIB string theory; foundation for flux-compactified landscape models.

concepts.label: group manifold compactification
concepts.description: Compactification of extra dimensions on homogeneous spaces (Lie groups or quotients thereof), reducing 10D type IIB to 4D effective theory.

concepts.label: classical regime
concepts.description: Limit where supergravity approximation is valid and higher-derivative and string-loop corrections are suppressed.

concepts.label: asymptotic de Sitter conjecture
concepts.description: Swampland conjecture claiming no asymptotic de Sitter solutions exist in quantum gravity, contradicted if classical dS solutions are found.

concepts.label: braneworld construction
concepts.description: Framework in string theory where Standard Model particles are confined to a lower-dimensional brane embedded in higher-dimensional spacetime.

concepts.label: Israel junction conditions
concepts.description: Boundary conditions relating extrinsic curvature and stress-energy tensor across a thin-shell or domain wall in spacetime.

concepts.label: Friedmann equations
concepts.description: Differential equations governing the expansion of a homogeneous isotropic cosmology in terms of energy density and scale factor.

concepts.label: Repulsive Force Conjecture
concepts.description: A swampland bound asserting that sufficiently long-range repulsive forces cannot exist consistently in quantum gravity.

concepts.label: Anti de Sitter Distance Conjecture
concepts.description: A swampland conjecture constraining the mass scale of tower of light particles in relation to the cosmological constant in AdS vacua.

concepts.label: Strong energy condition
concepts.description: A condition in general relativity requiring (ρ + 3p/c²) ≥ 0, which forbids accelerated expansion and is equivalent to the bound |∇V|/V ≥ √(4/(d-2)) in Einstein-dilaton gravity.

concepts.label: Tower of light particles
concepts.description: An infinite series of increasingly massive particles that become exponentially light as one approaches particular regions in moduli space, constrained by swampland conjectures.

concepts.label: tadpole charge
concepts.description: Flux-induced D3-brane charge that must satisfy tadpole cancellation conditions in string compactifications.

concepts.label: multiverse
concepts.description: An ensemble of causally disconnected universes with different physical properties, arising from eternal inflation in string theory landscapes.

concepts.label: Warped deformed conifold
concepts.description: A warped throat geometry in the Type IIB compactification constructed from a deformed conifold singularity, with warp factor exponentially suppressing the tip region.

concepts.label: Conifold deformation modulus
concepts.description: Scalar field controlling the deformation of the conifold singularity in the throat; couples to the bulk volume modulus through the warped geometry.

concepts.label: Warp factor
concepts.description: Exponentially small geometrical suppression factor in the metric near a throat region, arising from the distribution of fluxes and sources; controls the effective scales at the tip.

concepts.label: Kähler potential coupling
concepts.description: Cross term in the Kähler potential mixing the conifold deformation modulus and volume modulus, induced by the warped geometry and affecting the scalar potential structure.

concepts.label: power law plateau inflation
concepts.description: A class of inflationary models featuring a plateau-like potential with power-law behavior, introduced by Dimopoulos and Owen as an alternative to standard slow-roll inflation.

concepts.label: warm inflation
concepts.description: Non-standard inflationary scenario in which the inflaton field couples to radiation fields, producing heat and particle production during inflation.

concepts.label: observational consistency
concepts.description: The requirement that inflationary model predictions match observational data from CMB and large-scale structure, constraining tensor-to-scalar ratio, spectral index, and primordial non-Gaussianity.

concepts.label: D-brane inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary model in string theory where motion of D-branes in warped geometries drives scalar field evolution.

concepts.label: light particle species
concepts.description: Massless or light bosons and fermions that remain in thermal equilibrium and contribute to entropy count.

concepts.label: Hubble patch
concepts.description: Causal patch of spacetime with radius of order one Hubble length, defining region accessible to observations and quantum coherence.

concepts.label: massive IIA supergravity
concepts.description: Ten-dimensional Type IIA string theory with massive deformations, amenable to compactification on G2 manifolds.

concepts.label: G2 orientifold
concepts.description: Compactification of massive IIA on G2 holonomy manifold with orientifold projection, yielding 3d theories with reduced supersymmetry.

concepts.label: brane-flux decay
concepts.description: Decay of anti-brane in open-string sector via tachyon condensation or coupling to fluxes, destabilizing the dS solution.

concepts.label: non-BPS D7-brane
concepts.description: A Dirichlet 7-brane that does not preserve the Bogomol'nyi-Prasad-Sommerfield bound, carrying K-theory charge unstable in isolation.

concepts.label: K-theory charge
concepts.description: Topological charge carried by D-branes in Type II string theory classified by K-theory of the compactification space.

concepts.label: charge cancellation
concepts.description: The requirement that total K-theory charge vanish on a compact space in consistent string theory vacua.

concepts.label: classical vacua
concepts.description: String theory solutions satisfying the equations of motion without quantum corrections.

concepts.label: string theory effective action
concepts.description: Low-energy effective field theory derived from underlying microscopic critical string theory models, containing the RVM as a valid solution.

concepts.label: ΛCDM model
concepts.description: Standard cosmological model with constant dark energy density (Λ) and cold dark matter; baseline phenomenological theory against which RVM is compared.

concepts.label: localized sources
concepts.description: Branes, D-branes, or other extended objects with non-zero energy-momentum tensor localized in extra dimensions.

concepts.label: no-go theorem
concepts.description: Mathematical proof that a particular configuration or vacuum state cannot be realized given specified constraints and assumptions.

concepts.label: brane-world cosmology
concepts.description: Cosmological scenario where four-dimensional universe is a brane embedded in higher-dimensional spacetime, with gravity leaking into bulk.

concepts.label: ten-dimensional string theory
concepts.description: Fundamental formulation of string theory requiring ten spacetime dimensions for consistency; must be compactified to yield four-dimensional physics.

concepts.label: quintessence field
concepts.description: Dynamical scalar field proposed to explain dark energy and cosmological constant; couples to gravity and other scalar potentials.

concepts.label: equivalence principle
concepts.description: Fundamental principle stating that inertial and gravitational mass are equivalent; tested to extreme precision via measurements of long-range forces.

concepts.label: long-range force
concepts.description: Fifth-force interaction mediated by scalar field exchange; emerges from coupling of Higgs VEV to quintessence.

concepts.label: proton-to-electron mass ratio
concepts.description: Fundamental dimensionless constant μ = m_p/m_e; time-variation signals quintessence-mediated coupling to electroweak sector.

concepts.label: time-dependence of constants
concepts.description: Variation of fundamental coupling constants or mass ratios over cosmic time; constrained by astrophysical and laboratory measurements.

concepts.label: Standard Model consistency
concepts.description: Requirement that the low-energy effective theory of particle physics remain compatible with quantum gravity constraints and observational bounds.

concepts.label: trans-Planckian excursion
concepts.description: Field displacement during inflation exceeding the Planck mass, challenging effective field theory validity and quantum gravity consistency.

concepts.label: runaway potential
concepts.description: A scalar potential lacking critical points, characterized by monotonic evolution toward infinity or zero.

concepts.label: dissipation coefficient
concepts.description: Parametrization of energy transfer rate from inflaton to radiation field in warm inflation, dependent on temperature and coupling strength.

concepts.label: scalar field slow-roll
concepts.description: Inflationary dynamics in which potential energy dominates kinetic energy, enabling quasi-exponential expansion.

concepts.label: quantum field theory dissipation
concepts.description: Energy loss mechanism in quantum field theory induced by coupling scalar fields to thermal bath through particle production.

concepts.label: inflationary observables
concepts.description: Measurable cosmological predictions from inflation including scalar spectral index, tensor-to-scalar ratio, and bispectrum.

concepts.label: thermal bath
concepts.description: Radiation field maintained at finite temperature during warm inflation via dissipation from the inflaton.

concepts.label: infinite distance conjecture
concepts.description: Swampland proposal stating that as moduli approach infinite distance in field space, an infinite tower of states becomes exponentially massless.

concepts.label: Salam-Sezgin model
concepts.description: A 6-dimensional supergravity compactification with a monopole background on a 2-sphere, reducing to 4D with two scalar fields and an exponential effective potential.

concepts.label: Cvetic-Gibbons-Pope realization
concepts.description: String theory realization of the Salam-Sezgin model providing an ultraviolet completion and fixing moduli dynamics through monopole background geometry.

concepts.label: fading dark matter
concepts.description: Dynamical dark energy model where dark matter energy density decreases over cosmic time, proposed by Agrawal-Obied-Vafa to address H₀ tension.

concepts.label: H₀ tension
concepts.description: Discrepancy between Hubble constant measurements from local distance ladder observations and cosmic microwave background observations, indicating possible new physics.

concepts.label: Neveu-Schwarz 5-branes
concepts.description: Extended defects in string theory on which standard model fields can be confined, decoupling gauge couplings from the string dilaton.

concepts.label: Horndeski theory
concepts.description: General scalar-tensor gravity theory with up to fourth-order equations of motion, encompassing Galileon models and generalizations.

concepts.label: Galileon term
concepts.description: Higher-derivative scalar field self-interaction producing equations of motion of at most third order; cubic Galileon introduces cubic derivative coupling.

concepts.label: exponential potential
concepts.description: Scalar field potential of the form V(φ) ∝ exp(−λφ/M_P), commonly used in dark energy and inflation models.

concepts.label: higher derivative interactions
concepts.description: Terms in effective Lagrangian containing derivatives beyond canonical kinetic term, modifying scalar field dynamics while preserving ghost-freedom.

concepts.label: scalar field dynamics
concepts.description: Evolution equations and behavior of scalar fields governed by kinetic term, potential, and higher-derivative interactions.

concepts.label: ghost-freedom
concepts.description: Absence of auxiliary fields with negative kinetic energy; required for stability and unitarity in effective field theories.

concepts.label: Hubble friction
concepts.description: Damping effect from cosmic expansion that slows scalar field motion, enabling fields to remain frozen near potential maxima.

concepts.label: Brans-Dicke coupling
concepts.description: Non-minimal coupling between a scalar field and the gravitational field; parameter ω controls strength of coupling.

concepts.label: contortion distribution
concepts.description: Geometric non-trivial distribution of torsion in spacetime; contributes to effective vacuum energy density.

concepts.label: metastable potential
concepts.description: Potential with local minima separated by energy barriers; vacuum can tunnel to lower energy states.

concepts.label: cosmic microwave background anisotropies
concepts.description: Temperature and polarization fluctuations in the CMB constraining dark energy and dark matter properties.

concepts.label: large scale structure
concepts.description: Distribution of galaxies and matter on megaparsec scales, providing cosmological constraints on scalar-matter couplings and growth of structure.

concepts.label: coupling function minimum
concepts.description: Scalar field coupling to matter possessing a finite-field extremum, allowing gravitational coupling to vary with time.

concepts.label: non-linear regime
concepts.description: Regime at small and intermediate scales where perturbative approaches break down; screening mechanisms become important for fifth forces.

concepts.label: Non-geometric flux
concepts.description: Flux-like background charges (Q and P) arising from T-duality that cannot be expressed geometrically in any duality frame.

concepts.label: Refined AdS scale conjecture
concepts.description: Swampland conjecture constraining the spectrum of moduli masses relative to the AdS vacuum scale in stable AdS vacua.

concepts.label: Flux hierarchy
concepts.description: Ordering or ranking of geometric and non-geometric flux components by magnitude or string-scale suppression.

concepts.label: Random matrix theory
concepts.description: Statistical framework for analyzing spectral properties of large random matrices; applied here to predict moduli mass spectra.

concepts.label: Moduli mass
concepts.description: Mass eigenvalue of a stabilized modulus field; sensitive to the scalar potential curvature.

concepts.label: O-plane
concepts.description: Orientifold plane source carrying negative tension and Ramond-Ramond charge; essential for tadpole cancellation and potential energy generation in type II compactifications.

concepts.label: field dissipation
concepts.description: Loss of scalar field energy to thermal degrees of freedom; characteristic feature of warm inflation.

concepts.label: Galileon
concepts.description: Derivative self-interaction term in scalar field theories; characteristic of Horndeski Lagrangians and modified gravity; also appears in massive gravity and generalized Proca.

concepts.label: scalar helicity mode
concepts.description: Propagating scalar degree of freedom in modified gravity theories, distinct from tensor (graviton) modes; coupled to matter and gravity through derivative interactions.

concepts.label: massive gravity
concepts.description: Modified gravity theory in which the graviton acquires mass; contains derivative self-interactions analogous to Galileons; shares Swampland constraints with Horndeski theories.

concepts.label: generalized Proca
concepts.description: Family of vector-tensor theories with vector field helicity modes and derivative self-couplings; shares structural features and constraints with Horndeski Lagrangians.

concepts.label: swampland bound on gradient
concepts.description: Quantitative constraint |V′|/V ≥ c with c ~ O(1) from Swampland conjecture; tightened in presence of derivative interactions in Horndeski theories.

concepts.label: Festina Lente bound
concepts.description: Lower bound on the mass of charged particles in quasi-de Sitter space imposed by the swampland conjecture.

concepts.label: axionic Festina Lente
concepts.description: Extension of the Festina Lente bound to axion-like particles arising from type II string theory.

concepts.label: axion-like particles
concepts.description: Pseudoscalar particles arising from string theory compactifications, characterized by weak coupling and periodic potentials.

concepts.label: instanton action
concepts.description: Non-perturbative contribution to the effective action from Euclidean field configurations in string theory.

concepts.label: type II string theory
concepts.description: String theory framework with two supercharges in 10 dimensions, naturally containing both closed and open string sectors.

concepts.label: axionic black holes
concepts.description: Black hole solutions in theories with axion-like particles, featuring modified thermodynamics and decay processes.

concepts.label: Euclidean wormholes
concepts.description: Non-perturbative Euclidean gravitational configurations connecting distant spacetime regions, relevant for vacuum transitions.

concepts.label: lattice polytope
concepts.description: A convex polytope whose vertices have integer coordinates in a lattice.

concepts.label: vertex enumeration
concepts.description: Computational procedure to identify all vertices of a polytope from a set of points or constraints.

concepts.label: facet enumeration
concepts.description: Computational procedure to identify all maximal faces of a polytope.

concepts.label: lattice point completion
concepts.description: Algorithm to enumerate all integer points contained within the convex hull of a given point set.

concepts.label: symmetry computation
concepts.description: Determination of automorphisms and symmetry groups acting on a polytope.

concepts.label: incidence structure
concepts.description: Relations between vertices, edges, faces, and facets describing combinatorial structure of a polytope.

concepts.label: polytope duality
concepts.description: Correspondence between a polytope and its dual, swapping vertices with facets and preserving incidence.

concepts.label: compactification volume
concepts.description: The integrated volume of the internal Calabi-Yau space, relevant for string coupling and four-dimensional Planck scale.

concepts.label: higher derivative corrections
concepts.description: Subleading terms in the effective action beyond 2-derivative Einstein gravity, arising from string loop and worldsheet effects.

concepts.label: LVS inflation
concepts.description: Large Volume Scenario inflation in which slow-roll dynamics emerge from Kahler moduli evolution in large-volume Calabi-Yau geometries.

concepts.label: blow-up inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary scenario where the inflaton corresponds to the size of a blow-up divisor in a toric Calabi-Yau geometry.

concepts.label: fibre inflation
concepts.description: Inflationary mechanism in which the inflaton is identified with the volume of a fibre divisor in an elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau.

concepts.label: poly-instantons inflation
concepts.description: Inflation model driven by non-perturbative effects from multiple instantons contributing to the superpotential.

concepts.label: heterotic string orbifold
concepts.description: Compactification of heterotic string theory on orbifold geometries, using fermionic construction with discrete symmetry groups to generate 4D models.

concepts.label: fertility methodology
concepts.description: Systematic extraction technique for phenomenological string models from large landscape scans, identifying viable vacua.

concepts.label: tachyon-free configuration
concepts.description: String compactification with no negative mass-squared modes; necessary condition for vacuum stability.

concepts.label: heterotic superstring vacua
concepts.description: Solutions to heterotic string theory equations of motion classified by gauge symmetry, particle content, and phenomenological properties.

concepts.label: Pati-Salam symmetry
concepts.description: Gauge group SU(4) × SU(2)_L × SU(2)_R that unifies quarks and leptons and serves as an intermediate GUT breaking to the Standard Model.

concepts.label: fractional charge states
concepts.description: Particles carrying electric charge that is not an integer multiple of the electron charge; absent in phenomenologically viable models.

concepts.label: Higgs triplets
concepts.description: SU(2)-triplet scalar fields that may appear in GUT theories and affect proton decay and precision observables.

concepts.label: weakly coupled free fermionic string
concepts.description: A formalism for constructing heterotic string models using free fermion world-sheet degrees of freedom.

concepts.label: NAHE set
concepts.description: A foundational set of basis vectors in free fermionic string construction, named after Nanopoulos, Antoniadis, Hagelin, and Ellis.

concepts.label: mirrored models
concepts.description: String vacua in which the observable and hidden sector gauge groups (and matter content) are identical or structurally related.

concepts.label: basis vector extension
concepts.description: Systematic addition of new fermionic basis vectors to the NAHE set to generate and explore connected regions of the landscape.

concepts.label: Rank cut
concepts.description: A truncation or removal of basis vector components in the free fermionic construction that breaks geometric interpretation of the model.

concepts.label: Exceptional groups
concepts.description: Non-classical Lie groups (E6, E7, E8) appearing in the gauge algebra structure of string models.

concepts.label: orbifold twist
concepts.description: A discrete symmetry operation that constructs heterotic vacua with different numbers of sectors; correlates with gauge group probability distribution.

concepts.label: O7-plane
concepts.description: Orientifold seven-plane; sources negative RR charge and generically produces singular loci where D7-branes become non-smooth.

concepts.label: Whitney Umbrella
concepts.description: A canonical ADE singularity (cone over P¹) appearing locally on D7-branes near O7− planes, invalidating naive brane geometry.

concepts.label: D-brane flux
concepts.description: Two-form flux threading the worldvolume of a D-brane; quantized in integer cohomology and contributes to moduli stabilization.

concepts.label: flux lattice
concepts.description: Discrete lattice of quantized flux configurations on a D-brane worldvolume; dimension affected by singularities in O7 presence.

concepts.label: No-Scale Supergravity
concepts.description: A supergravity framework with a flat Kähler potential structure ensuring vanishing cosmological constant at tree level and natural emergence of de Sitter vacua.

edges.evidence: The procedure constructs log CY compactifications of weak LG models of Fano varieties.
Log CY compactifications are constructed from LG models of Fano varieties; applied to del Pezzo surfaces and coverings of projective spaces of index one.
Del Pezzo surfaces are special cases of Fano varieties of dimension 2.
Coverings of projective spaces of index one are treated as a class of Fano varieties in this study.
For coverings of degree greater than 2, the log CY compactification is singular; moreover, no smooth projective log CY compactification exists.
Fano varieties are defined by ample anticanonical divisors; the anticanonical system dimensions are studied in the main conjecture.
The conjecture proves that the number of fiber components over infinity and finite fibers equals the dimension of the anticanonical system of the Fano variety.
The fiber over infinity is the divisor at infinity added in the compactification procedure.
The study focuses on coverings of projective spaces of index one, restricting the class of Fano varieties considered.
Log CY varieties are defined by having trivial log canonical bundle K_X(D).
For coverings of degree greater than 2, no smooth projective log CY compactification exists; only singular compactifications are possible.
The metric is determined by the Kähler form on a Calabi-Yau manifold with Ricci-flatness constraint.
Weighted blow-up yields a compactification by a manifold with corners that resolves singularities.
Construction of metrics on cone products requires weighted blow-up techniques for geometric analysis.
Mapping properties of the Laplacian are derived on weighted Hölder spaces as key analytical step.
Elliptic regularity theory on weighted Hölder spaces enables construction of complete metrics.
Constructed metrics exhibit maximal volume growth consistent with quasi-AC geometry.
Isolated conical singularities are modelled on Calabi-Yau cones with controlled tangent cone structure.
Tangent cone at infinity does not uniquely determine the complete metric; multiple non-isometric completions exist.
Singular metrics show transition between isolated conical singularity and distinct tangent cone at infinity.
Complete CY metrics are constructed on smoothings of cone products with controlled geometry at infinity.
F-theory compactifications are defined on elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds as the compactification space.
The CY3 carries an elliptic fibration structure with elliptic fibers, which provides the geometric foundation for F-theory.
Singular fibers in the elliptic fibration are classified by Kodaira types, determining gauge algebra content.
Kodaira fiber types directly determine the gauge algebra content in F-theory compactifications.
In the CyTools scan, all 39 examined χ=-6 elliptic CY3s carry gauge algebras with SU(3)⊕SU(2)⊕U(1) factors.
Correct hypercharge U(1)_Y embedding is a necessary condition for realistic electroweak theory (Level 1 filter).
Proper hypercharge embedding structure constrains the matter content and chiral generation count.
Three chiral generations are necessary for realistic Yukawa coupling structure and fermion mass hierarchies (Level 2-3).
Yukawa sector structure and rank conditions determine protection against fast proton decay (Level 3-4).
Moduli stabilization mechanisms (LVS/KKLT) must be compatible with Yukawa sector and proton stability (Level 5).
F-theory compactifications on CY3 are related to heterotic string by duality; N=1 dualities between heterotic and F-theory in 6D.
N=2 dualities of type II/heterotic strings in 4D get promoted to N=1 heterotic/F-theory dualities in 6D.
Weierstrass models provide the standard form for explicitly encoding F-theory compactifications on elliptic fibrations.
Reflexive polytopes from the Kreuzer-Skarke database classify toric bases for elliptic F-theory compactifications.
The gauge group structure constrains the allowed matter representations and generation count (Level 2).
We study Landau Ginzburg theories mirror to 2D N=2 gauged linear sigma models on toric Calabi-Yau manifolds.
We derive and solve new constraint equations for Landau Ginzburg elliptic Calabi-Yau superpotentials.
2D N=2 gauged linear sigma models on toric Calabi-Yau manifolds
Landau Ginzburg theories mirror to 2D N=2 gauged linear sigma models
F-theory compactification in Calabi-Yau threefolds case
For Calabi-Yau fourfolds, we give a new algebraic realization for ADE hypersurfaces in F-theory compactification.
Geometry extending the geometry of elliptically fibered K3 leads to gauge models
Geometry with affine so(8) Lie algebra toric data leads to pure N=1 six dimensional SO(8) gauge model
We give the mirror symmetry of the canonical line bundle over the Hirzebruch surfaces F_n in the CY threefold case.
We study Landau Ginzburg theories mirror to gauged linear sigma models on toric Calabi-Yau manifolds.
For Calabi-Yau fourfolds, we give a new algebraic realization for ADE hypersurfaces.
This geometry leads to a pure N=1 six dimensional SO(8) gauge model from the F-theory compactification.
Constraint equations for Landau Ginzburg elliptic Calabi-Yau superpotentials depend on dual linear sigma model data.
F-theory is compactified on elliptically fibered Calabi-Yau threefolds (abstract, title)
Special points in the moduli space where the coupling remains constant (abstract)
At constant coupling special points, CY3s can be realized as orbifolds of T^6 by Z_m × Z_n (abstract)
Enhancement of gauge symmetries arises from intersection of two kinds of singularities (abstract)
Singularities in the discriminant locus intersect to enhance gauge symmetries
Point-like instantons coalesce giving rise to enhanced gauge group (abstract)
When Hirzebruch surface is the base, constant coupling corresponds to instantons coalescing (abstract)
Coalescence of instantons gives rise to enhanced Sp(k) gauge group (abstract)
Kodaira fiber types classify the singular fibers in elliptically fibered spaces (Motivating Observation)
ALL 39 elliptically fibered CY3 threefolds examined carry gauge algebras containing these factors (Motivating Observation)
Special constant coupling points can be realized in orbifold limits (abstract)
Moduli space parameterizes all inequivalent F-theory compactifications (Filtering Hierarchy context)
Kodaira fiber classification maps singular fiber types in elliptic fibrations to Lie algebra generators of the gauge group.
Kodaira classifier relates degeneracy locus singularities to specific gauge algebra factors (su(3), su(2), u(1)).
The extracted gauge algebra must contain SU(3) ⊕ SU(2) ⊕ U(1) factors as a necessary condition for SM-like phenomenology.
Correct gauge algebra is necessary but not sufficient; the hypercharge U(1)_Y must be properly embedded to match electroweak physics.
Level 1 filtering: only models with correct U(1)_Y embedding can be considered genuine SM candidates.
Chirality index equals χ/2 = (h^{1,1} - h^{2,1})/2 topologically, but equals net chirality only after flux choice.
Three chiral generations required phenomenologically; chirality index must equal 3 before flux-dependent corrections.
Level 2 filtering: exactly three chiral families are a non-negotiable requirement for SM phenomenology.
Yukawa matrices must exhibit correct rank structure with hierarchy top ≫ bottom ≫ electron to match experimental fermion masses.
Level 3 filtering: Yukawa rank conditions and texture zeros are essential for phenomenologically viable SM.
Level 4 filtering: models must forbid rapid proton decay via discrete symmetries or anomalous U(1) protection to survive.
Level 5 filtering: LVS/KKLT stabilization (Swiss cheese topology) must be compatible with the Yukawa sector geometry.
CY3s are classified and inventoried by their Hodge numbers h^{1,1} and h^{2,1}; small height means h^{1,1}+h^{2,1} ≤ 24.
Kreuzer-Skarke reflexive polytope database parameterises toric CY3 geometries; CyTools scans examine these polytopes for CY constructions.
F-theory models are constructed via elliptically fibered CY4s with toric bases; Weierstrass models exploit this fibration structure.
Heterotic line-bundle models and spectral cover constructions use CY3 compactifications; Anderson/Gray/Lukas systematically scan bundles on CICYs.
Gauge algebra structure from Kodaira fibers must support three chiral matter generations; not all su(3)⊕su(2)⊕u(1) geometries achieve this.
Small Hodge numbers imply controlled volumes and moduli spaces; large h-numbers complicate LVS/KKLT stabilization control.
Kodaira fiber classification taxonomizes the singular fibers of the elliptic fibration to determine gauge structure.
Kodaira fiber types determine the non-abelian gauge algebra; su(3)⊕su(2)⊕u(1) factors arise from specific fiber singularities.
Rational sections on the elliptic fibration form the Mordell-Weil group, generators of which correspond to U(1) factors.
The Shioda map is a homomorphism from the Mordell-Weil group to the Picard lattice, encoding charge structure.
The geometric origin of global gauge group structure lies with the Shioda map of Mordell-Weil generators.
Shioda map geometry results in constraints on U(1) charges of non-abelian matter consistent with geometric restrictions.
Charge constraints restrict which linear combinations of U(1) generators can define the hypercharge.
F-theory models featuring the SM algebra realise the precise global gauge group [SU(3)×SU(2)×U(1)]/Z6.
Depending on global group structure, SU(2)×U(1) can unhiggs into either SU(2)×SU(2) or SU(3)×SU(2), showing structure dependence.
Gauge group transitions via (un-)higgsing alter the allowed matter representations and field content.
Charge constraints restrict the representations of matter fields consistent with the geometry.
Implications of charge constraints are explored as a criterion for the F-theory swampland, filtering inconsistent models.
The discriminant polynomial in the Weierstrass model defines the location and type of singular fibers.
The structure of the discriminant locus encodes gauge group and matter representation data.
Projections of del Pezzo surfaces are studied to construct singular Calabi-Yau threefolds (Abstract).
By projecting del Pezzo surfaces, one constructs singular CY3s; smoothing yields smooth CY3s (Abstract).
Smoothing singular Calabi-Yau threefolds yields new examples of smooth CY3s with Picard rank 1 (Abstract).
The construction procedure involves smoothing singular threefolds to obtain smooth CY models (Abstract).
New CY3 examples are distinguished by having Picard group of rank 1 (Abstract).
Syzygetic structure of del Pezzo surfaces is studied in order to construct their projections (Abstract).
The exceptional divisor of a blowup is precisely the preimage of the center, here a ℂℚ in the blowup (Abstract).
A type II primitive contraction is one whose exceptional divisor is the blowup of ℂℙ² at a point (Abstract).
Del Pezzo surfaces are Fano surfaces defined by the ampleness of the anticanonical divisor -K_X.
The SM Lagrangian structure is determined by gauge group SU(3)⊕SU(2)⊕U(1) with specific fermion representations.
χ = -6 reflexive polytopes from Kreuzer-Skarke database all examined carry elliptic fibrations with SM-like gauge algebras.
Correct U(1)_Y embedding is Level 1 filter: without correct hypercharge, particle charge assignments violate SM structure.
Level 2 filter requires exactly 3 chiral generations; χ/2=3 but chirality index requires flux choice.
Level 3 filter requires Yukawa couplings exist with correct rank structure (top≫bottom≫electron) establishing fermion mass hierarchy.
Level 4 filter: fast proton decay must be prevented via anomalous U(1) or discrete symmetry, eliminating many GUT candidates.
Level 6 filter: dS vacuum, inflation, and dark energy must satisfy swampland consistency conditions in UV completion.
F-theory formulation on elliptic fibrations enables systematic gauge algebra extraction via Weierstrass models and discriminant locus.
Heterotic line-bundle models on CICYs and spectral cover models use CY3s for compactification with systematic chirality computation.
SU(5) GUT embedded in F-theory and heterotic models breaks to SM via Wilson lines; only O(100) survive all filters from O(10⁵) candidates.
F-theory is fundamentally formulated on elliptic fibrations; Weierstrass models and toric bases classify gauge groups systematically.
The paper extends results of Leray-Vallette on homotopical properties of pre-CY algebras to pre-CY categories using direct proofs adapting HTT techniques.
A pre-CY category is defined as a dg quiver equipped with a cyclic pairing; dg quiver is the underlying categorical object.
The non-degenerate cyclic pairing is the essential data defining a pre-CY structure on a dg quiver.
A pre-CY morphism is a structure-preserving map between pre-CY categories respecting the cyclic pairing and differential.
The paper proves that any pre-CY category has a minimal model; this is a key result establishing minimality in the pre-CY setting.
Any quasi-isomorphism of pre-CY categories admits a quasi-inverse; this is proven as a main theorem.
The work extends Leray-Vallette results on pre-CY algebras to categories, generalizing from dg algebras to dg categories.
Authors give direct proofs adapting techniques instead of using properadic calculus, indicating properadic methods are an alternative approach.

edges.source: isomorphism in category of pre-Calabi-Yau categories
edges.evidence: The paper shows that a pre-CY morphism whose first component is an isomorphism of dg quivers is an isomorphism in the category of pre-CY categories.
A dg quiver extends the algebraic structure to a categorical setting, generalizing path algebras to differential graded paths.
For a projective klt log pair (X,D) of absolute coregularity c, the fundamental group π₁^reg(X,D) admits a normal abelian subgroup of finite index and rank at most 2c.
The fundamental group π₁^reg(X,D) is a key invariant for understanding the structure of klt log pairs.
We prove almost abelianity of the fundamental group of the regular locus for projective klt Calabi-Yau pairs in dimension three.
Almost abelianity is defined as admitting a normal abelian subgroup of finite index.
A log resolution π: Y → X produces an exceptional divisor whose structure encodes singularity complexity.
The rank of a normal abelian subgroup is bounded by at most 2c where c is the absolute coregularity.
The conjecture is proven in low dimensions 0 ≤ c ≤ 3, with dimension three results on CY pairs.
Results on almost abelianity of the fundamental group are explicitly proven for 3-dimensional klt CY pairs.
Log resolutions are the primary tool for analyzing the structure and coregularity of klt log pairs.
In cases c ∈ {0,1,2} and fixed dimension, bounds on the index of a solvable normal subgroup can be established, which is stronger than abelian bounds.
The fundamental group of the regular locus π₁^reg(X,D) is studied separately to understand the full fundamental group structure.
The index and rank of finite-index abelian subgroups are controlled by the absolute coregularity c.
CY pairs form a special class of klt log pairs whose coregularity structure has been analyzed in dimension ≤3.
Singular fibers in Kodaira classification produce su(3) ⊕ su(2) ⊕ u(1) gauge algebras in ALL 39 examined CY3s (Motivating Observation).
Chirality index χ/2 = 3 but does not determine net chirality without flux choice (Level 2 discussion).
Level 3: exactly 3 chiral generations required before Yukawa couplings can have correct rank structure (top ≫ bottom ≫ electron).
Level 5: moduli stabilization (LVS/KKLT) must be compatible with the proton-safe Yukawa sector and discrete symmetries.
Paper provides a recipe for building F-theory duals for arbitrary heterotic compactifications on elliptically fibered manifolds (Abstract).
Heterotic spectral cover structure transitions to F-theory geometry via the duality correspondence, encoding bundle information.
Weierstrass form (y² = x³ + fx + g) is standard representation for elliptic fibrations in F-theory with base-dependent coefficients.
Toric bases allow systematic F-theory model classification via toric polytope combinatorics, determining possible gauge groups and Weierstrass coefficients.
Level 5 requires Swiss cheese structure compatible with Yukawa sector and gauge algebra constraints for successful moduli stabilization.
The DHT conjecture builds a bridge between mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds and quasi-Fano varieties.
The conjecture bridges mirror symmetry for Calabi-Yau manifolds to a broader context including quasi-Fano varieties.
Tyurin degenerations are a particular emphasis in discussing the Doran-Harder-Thompson conjecture.
Various topics on degenerations and Lagrangian fibrations are discussed in the context of mirror symmetry.
